Reviews.Title: “perfect location comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: carol jane h
Reviews.Content: Large room by Paris Hotel standards. Our room was in Bldg 1 on the back/side. I thought I'd requested a view but not. Even tho I booked 2 months in advance and got a great rate I'd suguest booking through the hotel instead,if you can get the same price.Very clean up to date wih modern bath,lots of hot wate and shower pressure, no small feat in ideally located small,charming Paris hotels. Highly reccommend but do your research first to get the best value for your dollar.Rooms go fast so plan to book early.Very safe,senic and convienient area . Breakfast good but overpriced walk around the corner to rue cler and ck out posted breakfast menus. If you sleep in and prefer a late breakfast use the Hotel Breakfast.Large comfortable beds.Tiny elevator typical Paris.Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Yen M
Reviews.Content: We had recently stayed a week at the hotel's apartment for a week at the beginning of this year. My daughter had written a review of the apartment and I would like to add our review of the hotel. We had stayed at this hotel in previous 3 occasions and had enjoyed our stay each time. We had arranged to meet up with our daughter and her partner in Paris to spend a week together to celebrate new year. We are just so glad that we chose to stay at the apartment as it has provided us with a home away from home. We had many enjoyable meals in the apartment and were able to relax after a long day sight seeing in the evenings. The apartment is well kept with good facilities. The bathroom is well stocked with toiletries, towels, toilet rolls, extra sets of linen and there is a computer in the lounge. The kitchen is furnished with all the things one needs for preparation of meals. All in all we have had a wonderful time in the apartment and we thoroughly enjoyed the week we spent in Paris. We are looking forward to staying at the hotel's apartment again in the new year.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed the apartment (not the main hotel)”
Reviews.Author: desert_lover222
Reviews.Content: We selected Hotel Relais Bosquet based on TA, and had already booked a room in the hotel, but then came across mention of the separate apartment when looking at their website more thoroughly (click on "The Hotel", then "Our apartments" down at the bottom). We switched to the ground floor "Apartement Champ de Mars" at 25, rue du Champ de Mars (across the street) and were very pleased. It's in a great location close to the Eiffel Tower and Rue Cler, well-furnished and comfortable, with good appliances, excellent wi-fi, and very well supplied with towels, cosmetics, and other goods. You get a very large living room, adequate bedroom and closet, kitchenette with barstool seating, reasonable size modern bathroom with separate WC, and two patio areas with exclusive access (but visible from apartments above). Everything was in working order. We received excellent help from the hotel staff across the street for our (modest) needs, but it was good to know that they were available at all times. The apartment was mostly very quiet, being being in the back of the building away from the street (except for a few noisy hours in the neighborhood on Saturday night). Overall we felt the apartment was excellent value and extremely satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tallahasse_FLBarb
Reviews.Content: It's rare when a hotel lives up to expectations but it is certainly true of Hotel Relais Bosquet. From the moment we arrived until the moment we departed the staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. The location was perfect, within walking distance or a short metro or bus ride to any Paris destination. Loved Rue Cler which is just a block away. The breakfast was delicious in a very relaxing atmosphere. What a great start to the day! Our room, a standard room, was very clean and not nearly as small as anticipated. We even had a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower! Would definitely return to Hotel Relais Bosquet when we next visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “charming and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: annekins
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a mother/daughter trip to Paris. We stayed at the Hotel Relais Bosquet. It is a small hotel, located within walking distance to the eifel tower and les invalides. Very clean and quiet at night, Metro within two blocks also public bus. Great breakfast. One issue to watch- the window in the bath fronts on a small courtyard. The glass was frosted. However, as we observed you could not see out through the frosted glass but people accross the courtyard could see "everything". We discovered this while looking out the bedroom window and there was a great display of the man accross the way in the shower. A word to the wise- pull the curtain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoveHis2ry
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we know little to no French. The hotel staff members were cheerful and helpful in every way. They verified hours, ordered taxis, and answered many questions. The rooms are bright and pleasant and very clean. The breakfast is second to none. We just loved the area and were happy to come back to such a quiet and relaxing environment each day. We are stopping by again on our way back to the States in June and are bringing friends. We are confident that they too will enjoy their stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A gem !!”
Reviews.Author: travelingfamof6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful, we stayed 3 nights in room 23. We had a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower and 2 large balcony windows opening to the street below. It was noisy (even with the darkening shade), but I enjoyed seeing the sights on the street below and the Eiffel. The staff is friendly and helpful, room is nicely decorated and large, with mini frig and even a little sound system. The toilet is in a separate room from the bathroom, but we liked that. The Rue Cler street is so nice to walk, eat, and sit, and watch the locals. Bus 69 nearby can take you to the Louvre, Orsay, Rodin, Invalides and you can watch the city as you ride. Loved this place !!

Reviews.Title: “Could not be in better hands”
Reviews.Author: Stan H
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay 3 nights but stayed 8. Part of the reason was I needed medical care and the hotel took direct action to help me and the night I was in the hospital they made sure my wife and daughter got what they needed. Also, the location was great. The staff was always ready with a map to help us find our way. Rue Cler was a couple of blocks away and Metro was a couple of blocks in a different direction. The bus stop was across the street. And the great Eiffel Tower was only 4 blocks away. This hotel was a good value and the customer service was genuine and complete. When we go back to Paris, we will definitely stay at the hotel Relais Bosquet.

Reviews.Title: “The worst is going to happen!”
Reviews.Author: MissBonie
Reviews.Content: We keep posting these wonderful reviews on this great hotel and it's going to replace Jays Paris as the highest rated hotel on Trip Advisor! Then, the worse will happen. It will be tough to book and their rack rates will go up! All kidding aside, we had originally booked the Westin for a week stay in Paris, but rememebered how much we loved the Relais Bosquet when we visited the city five years ago. Our second visit did not disappoint us. We love the location, the bakery next door, and the Rue Cler area as a whole. Don't miss the crepes at Ulysses! But, it's the staff. They are phenomenal. So patient, informative and helpful. They know how to treat their guests and provide the best in Parisian hospitality. I will mention one issue we had in regard to our room. It was a little warm. We shut off the value for the heat and opened up the windows, but the wind would bang them around. About the third night, I had an "ah-ha" moment, and we closed the black-out shutters and then barely opened them a tad, so that we could get a little more air. The windows open into the room, so it worked perfectly! We are already looking forward to our next visit, which I hope is before the year end. And, we'll return again to the Relais Bosquet.

Reviews.Title: “Paris 2012”
Reviews.Author: Jens40th
Reviews.Content: Very small lobby on a residential street but clean rooms and bathrooms that were recently renovated. The room doors were a little difficult to open they stuck but you eventually got them opened,just don't be in a rush. This was a special trip with my Mother ,niece and a friend, we tried to get rooms close but they couldn't arrange it, not a problem as we asked upon check in. There were 2 of us to a room we had twin size beds and the rooms were cleaned daily. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful at all times and you could use their computers with internet service for free. Hotel is walking distance to Eiffel Tower and the train stop was only a few blocks away as well as numerous restaurants. You could walk to all the high end shops as well. There was also a bakery right at the corner of the block.

Reviews.Title: “3 star that should be a 4”
Reviews.Author: TheWoodsYorks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights earlier this month. We booked a suite (room 41) - it was ample big enough with great storage. Parisian hotel rooms can be small - not this one. It was immaculate, beautifully appointed, as was the whole hotel. The service provided by the staff was some of the best we have experienced. They even came to our aid when we had a hiccup with parking (our fault) and couldnt have been more helpful in taking time out to assist us. The location is spot on, close to river, tower, metro, car parks and great local restaurants. We used to stay at a hotel 4* about 5 mins away but its closed for refurbishment - we wont go back, we'll return to Hotel Bosquet. Thank you to all for a wonderful break.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay at a Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lizard1995
Reviews.Content: I spent four days as a guest of this hotel and I cannot say enough good things about our experience. This was a trip with my sister, my mother, and my teenaged daughter, and we had a wonderful visit. The staff was friendly, helpful and very kind. The breakfast was extraordinary, with may options to choose from. We had superior rooms, which were spacious and comfortable and charming and had everything we needed. I can't speak to value as I don't know how it compares to other hotels in the area, but I can say that nothing about the hotel disappointed us. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LoonyPrune
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Relais Bosquet in Feburary for 3 nights. We had a lovely twin room which over looked the typical French street and we had a terrific view of the Eifel Tower as well which looked great at night. The Hotel was so easy to get to from the airport - Roissy Bus, metro from Opera to Ecole Militaire and a short walk. The area the Hotel is in is very nice and it's only a short walk to the Tower and the Seine. We bought a 5 day travel pass which meant we could travel from the airport and all over Paris on bus, metro or train. We used the busses a lot just hopping from stop to stop, and the bus stops are very near the Hotel. I'd highly recommend investing in a pass - just don't lose them as I did as once they're gone, they're gone! I'd also bought a Museum pass for 2 days which in hindsight I could have done without. It was great queue jumping at the Louvre, but to get our moneys worth we tried to fit in as much as possible and probably missed out on half the Louvre. Next time I think I'd just get an advance ticket for the Louvre and spend a day in there! It's stunning but so big! The staff at the Hotel are so friendly and helpful. I loved staying there, nothing is too much trouble. There was a fridge in the room which I used to store the many bottles of wine I bought from the supermarket! All in all I loved Paris, and the French people were so friendly and helpful - especially those that helped sort out the cheapest replacement travel tickets! We went back to the airport on the train and this wasn't as good as the Roissy bus. One or two beggars, crammed to the rafters until Gare de Nord, but quite pleasant after that with musicians playing for us! Will I be back? I hope so! Will I stay at the Hotel Relais Bosquet again? I couldn't imagune staying any where better! My only regret is I didn't push the boat out and stay for longer!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Relais Bosquet with my daughter and friend during our first trip to Paris in February- it did not disappoint. The staff was extremely helpful always ready with a great dinner suggestion. The location is excellent- near sights, metro stations and in a wonderful neighborhood. When we return to Paris, we will definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Nick Z
Reviews.Content: I've never reviewed a hotel on Trip Advisor, but after our stay at Hotel Relais Bosquet, I had to. My wife and I are in our mid 30's and we stayed here for 7 nights. I've travelled to several hotels in the US and a few in Europe and I can honestly say that this was the friendliest hotel staff I've ever encountered. We felt a little bad that we didn't speak more French, but all of the hotel staff spoke very good English. The hotel was clean and quiet. The rooms were large for Paris standards, especially for the price. The location was absolutely perfect. It was a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and 2 blocks to the Metro Station that you could take to any place in the City. It was a great metro station location because we never had to make more than one connection to get to the sights we wanted. The restaraunts and bakeries in the area were wonderful. The breakfast at the hotel was quite good also. We loved the Rue Cler area. While we are younger, we don't enjoy the very loud, party scene. This area was perfect because, it was busy during the day, but not overwhelmingly crowded. It was quiet during the night. The restaraunts and cafes were good with good variety. The only very small negative was that the beds were a bit stiff, but we still both slept well. The one thing I would recommend is that perhaps they rotate a couple of dishes on their hot buffet. Something like quiche would have been nice once or twice a week, perhaps a special dish on Saturdays or Sundays. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone travelling to Paris. When we return, without question, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurita M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Relais Bosquet in September 2011. After researching our options, this seemed like the best fit. We were not disappointed. The hotel was in a perfect location, close to many restaurants and markets, and a short walk to the Eiffel Tower. There is also a great flea market just around the corner on Sunday. The staff were very friendly and helpful and answered all our questions to the best of their ability. We had to return our key to the front desk each time we left the hotel, which was a little different, but not a problem. There was always someone at the front desk when we returned, so we didn't have to wait to get it back. We stayed in a superior room and it was comfortable and clean. The beds were very comfortable, and the room darkening blinds made it easy to get a good nights sleep so that we could make the most of each day. Keep in mind that the hotel rooms in Paris are smaller than what North Americans may be used to, and this is the same pretty much anywhere you stay. Consider it part of the adventure and charm, and not an inconvenience. I would definitely stay at the Hotel Relais Bosquet again.

Reviews.Title: “Well equipped and homely serviced apartment in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: clare_nz_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 2-4 person serviced apartment near the Hotel building for one week and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The apartment is located on Rue du Champ de Mars in the building right next door to Le Bosquet restaurant. The apartment was cosy, spacious and well equipped. Unlike most serviced apartments, the kitchen had just about everything you'd ever need to prepare meals. Condiments and leftover food from other guests was also left on the bench for use, which proved very handy for us. There is an excellent artisan bakery on the corner across the road from the apartment (you'll see it when you walk back towards the hotel), which is great for picking up fresh bread and pastries for breakfast. Cheese shops, delicatessens, butchers and greengrocers are all just around the corner on Rue Cler and also on Rue Saint Dominque. There are also a couple of supermarkets and wine cellars very close by and the metro is just around the corner. The bathroom includes a washing machine and drier, as well as a bath/shower. There are two wall beds in the lounge room and a double bed in the master bedroom with adjoining courtyard. Since we were there in winter we didn't use the outdoor courtyards. We could imagine that the courtyard next to the lounge and kitchen would be a very nice spot to enjoy meals in the warmer months. There is a computer in the lounge cupboard if you need to use the internet and also free wi-fi. The apartment is cleaned and given a linen change every three days. The staff were incredibly helpful and arranged our transfer from the airport as well as booking us a table at Le Florimond for New Years Eve dinner. They were more then happy to provide recommendations for other restaurants in the local area and book you a table. There are plenty of great restaurants in the nearby area if you're after some great dining experiences – it just pays to book ahead or try and be in the door before 7PM. We would thoroughly recommend the serviced apartment for groups of three or more (or even only two people if you prefer to have cooking facilities and a lounge). My parents normally stay in the hotel and enjoy it there too.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel in a particularly nice neighborhood/location”
Reviews.Author: russr
Reviews.Content: I found my hotel from Charles deGaulle quite easily taking the RER and then the Metro getting off at Ecole Militaire. It was less than a 5 minute walk to the hotel - where I arrived at 1015 AM. My room wasn't ready yet, but they clearly made a call to housekeeping to get the room ready. In the meanwhile, they offered me breakfast (there is nothing better than a real French baguette) and then I used my laptop in their reception with the free wifi. I got to my room around 1130 AM. It was small, but not uber-small. Everything was clean, bright and comfortable. And after I walked around the neighborhood, I realized how nice the area was - close to the Eiffel Tower and a brief walk to the Seine. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location and a Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: winemac
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a quick but fantastic 3 night stay in this wonderful hotel! If you've read the previous reviews you know many of the positives. We can confirm all of these - staff were extremely friendly, helpful, and accommodating. In fact, we could find no fault with the hotel. A marvelous breakfast started our day, pleasant greetings throughout were nice, and the room was comfortable. Add to this wonderful hotel's experience one of the most important factors in vacationing - location - and you have quite possibly the best base to enjoy central Paris! We loved walking the streets looking for interesting shops, cafes, and restaurants. And the Eiffel is always there as a beacon for guidance! I could go on and on, but the end result would be the same: Hotel Relais Bosquet is fantastique! To all the wonderful staff: Merci Beaucoup!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Paris”
Reviews.Author: LouisaSydney
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel was our first taste of France after arriving from a long haul flight from Australia, Staff were very welcoming and accommodated us with an early check in as soon as our room was available (at10am) The hotel is in a fabulous location 5 minutes from Eiffel Tower which made for some lovely after dinner walks and very close to Rue Cler , ideal for the gourmet traveller, Our room as spotless, quiet and very comfortable and good value. We would have no hesitation in recommending this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mackenzie”
Reviews.Author: Justin M
Reviews.Content: We just spent a weekend at relais bosquet and it was fantastic. This is our second stay here and we chose it again because the staff are so incredibly helpful. It is convenient to metro stations and busses and a quick walk to the eiffel tower. We discovered rue cler around the corner and what a gem it is. Thank you once again to Christian and the other staff. The Mackenzie's

Reviews.Title: “Location, value, tourist aid”
Reviews.Author: Genings
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at this hotel for six nights in February: it is in a terrific location, convenient to Metro, just 10 minute walk to Eiffel Tower. We ate the buffet breakfast -- yes, you can do well for less just with the bakery on the corner, but the buffet was fine (not included in room price; you could also have a continental breakfast for less). The "superior" room is spacious by European standards, recently renovated, spotlessly clean, modern bath, heavily insulated windows etc. There is an elevator. The hotel is updating its "standard" rooms -- didn't see one, but they are smaller and less expensive. They offer special rates, apparently, on their Facebook page, but we did as well on their regular website. What set this hotel apart for us was the extremely friendly, helpful staff -- especially Christian and Bernard. My advice is to consult with the hotel through their Facebook page, which they seem to monitor regularly. Bernard made a reservation for us at a restaurant several days before we arrived, and I can see that they have done similar things for other guests. Christian was very helpful with travel and restaurant recommendations, and not afraid to offer a strong opinion. All in all, the hotel was a wonderful base for Paris -- we will definitely be staying there in the future. It was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CELIA K
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed at this hotel and everything is perfect: location, rooms, attention and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdolfoB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a hidden gem in Paris ! Very good location, just 2 blocks away from Ecoile Militaire subway station, very close to shops, nice restaurants and attractions like the Eiffel Tower and the Invalides. Staff in the hotel is really good, fast for check in and check out and especially by giving good advices about city. Breakfast is included and it is really rare to find a hotel in Europe where breakfast can be good. Nice selection of everything, good service and relaxed atmosphere. It is a small place, but as it is a small hotel, you will never see a overcrowded place. Rooms are good, small, but superior to other Paris hotels. It is very clean, confortable and in our case, bathroom was big ! There are some rooms with balcony and view to Eiffel tower, which can make a nice difference. In room you can have free wifi connection, just ask for the password at front desk. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: Shaw-Allan
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Hotel Relais Bosquet, it is in a great location with a good choice of nearby restaurants and bars without being in the noisy tourist hotspots. We ate breakfast in the hotel and it was a real treat in the friendly little breakfast room. We visited with friends and would definitely recommend. Lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and close to Rue Cler”
Reviews.Author: Stella
Reviews.Content: I can never get tired of the 7th arrondisement in Paris. I like the feel of quiet residential neighborhood and close proximity to good restaurants that lined Rue St Dominque and Rue Cler. For our 3rd visit to Paris we decided to get a nicer hotel closer to Rue Cler and after much research settled on Relais Bosquet due to the positive comments about customer service. In that regard I was not disappointed. The customer service was top notch. The front desk was very polite, and took care of business with class. Rue Cler is about 1/2 block away and the hotel is very close to the very rustic but good value Cafe du Marche. Unfortunately I did not know it at the time, but Rue Cler is a bit dead on Mondays. But during other days you can really pick up a lot of nice supplies for a picnic lunch or snack - from raw oysters to pates to fruits to cheese to bakery to chocolates to ice cream. A foodie heaven to sum. Rue St. Dominque is another street that is packed with nice shops and restaurants and about 10 minute walk away. We went to Fables de la Fountaine and Cafe Constant and they were both very good. The hotel was really 2 residential buildings transformed into a hotel. The is a hallway that connects the two on the ground floor. As a result, the elevator is miniscule (fits 2 person and 2 suitcases), and the staircase is narrow and not advisable to use. Partially due to the retrofitting, our room is a bit peculiar and a disappointment. It was a very large room by Parisian standards, and it was decorated nicely and very clean. But the toilet was in a tiny room next to the bed, and there was no sink near it. So every night we had to go through the ritual of going to the toilet, and then run across the room to go to the shower/tub/sink in the bathroom at the other end. Not fun. Lastly, the sound travels. One night on our floor, the kids (apparently in a different room) kept knocking on the door of their parent's room, looking for toothbrush and such. We could hear every word. So I will consider this hotel again because overall it was really a good hotel, but I will want to double check the layout of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in the 7th”
Reviews.Author: ddb8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were more than pleased with the Hotel Relais Bosquet Paris (a Rick Steve's rec). Besides being very comfortable, quiet, a very good breakfast, courteous & helpful staff, it was in a great location. We were able to walk to numerous attractions, cafes, and a good marketplace. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat unless I wanted the hub-bub (and $$$) of the 8th.

Reviews.Title: “Location, service, and cost”
Reviews.Author: tyst
Reviews.Content: This is actually my second stay in this hotel. Last time it was in 2009. During two years , I also happened to pass by Paris for a couple of times, and I have tried to stay in different hotels. None of them can beat this one, in terms of location, price, and service. Relais bosquet is within walking distances to many restaurants and the the tower. The elegant Rue Cler is just behind the hotel. This hotel is also trying very hard to renovate, at this moment the second building is under renovation. I suppose travelers can book it in the summer. Room is relatively spacious in paris standard. One little small complaint is the bed is not supportive, probably due to it's age.

Reviews.Title: “5 Days in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Sarah V
Reviews.Content: Loved, LOved, LOved Hotel Relais. Fantastic location with Great Staff. Spacious and cumfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: ItsAboutTheTravel
Reviews.Content: Great Location in a quiet neighborhood in Paris. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable with plenty of space to move around. The front desk staff was helpful with the exception of the day we departed. We prepaid our stay, but the front desk agent held me in line saying I had not prepaid. He pulled my paperwork and realized I had prepaid, but it added a good 15 minutes to our taxi meter that was waiting with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Rowersue
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at Hotel Relais Bosquet in December. Hotel was great and in a great neighborhood. We had a good sized room with a good bathroom, closet and desk. there was a small frig that allowed us to keep milk, cheese and juice in our room. front desk was helpful with dining suggestions. hotel is close to subway and close to eiffel. we did our morning jog around the champ de mars and eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: Hazel B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week in January. Our trip was in celebration of our 25th wedding anniversary and we had planned and looked forward to this trip for a long time. It was a dream come true. The hotel was a delight, comfortable and relaxed with a friendly, helpful staff. Our room was clean, bright and very quiet; we were delighted to see the Eiffel Tower from our window! The location is very convenient, minutes from the Seine (on foot) and close to the metro and bus stops. We highly recommend the Relais Bosquet and look forward to returning for a visit as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Superior customer service”
Reviews.Author: WatermelonMan
Reviews.Content: To start with we had a problem in our room which could have been a potential negative review, but the management when informed, handled it immediately and apologetically, which we appreciate, having stayed in hotels where if you have a problem they consider it YOUR problem and don't show any concern for their guests. Further, they called us later and said there would be a free breakfast for both of us in the morning. We were impressed in their professional way of taking care of us. We also enjoyed the electric shutters, which kept out the light, but also seemed to keep out noise. We too enjoyed strolling through the market, picking up bread, cheese and champagne to take back to the room and enjoy as we watched the Eiffel Tower twinkle at night. Our room with a view of the tower was meant to cost extra, but as we checked out at reception we were informed we would not be charged the extra cost for the two nights we were there. Now that's customer service!! We will stay again and we do go to Paris yearly as we travel from Africa, where we work, to the U.S., where all of our family lives.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, bit dated, but good price/location”
Reviews.Author: olfrog
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel - the location was good (two blocks from Eiffel Tower park) and it seemed a very clean and pretty area. The rooms were the usual Paris size. I felt that mine was a little dated however - those little bits here and there that make it a little in need for renovation. Oh, and there was a tea and coffee maker in the room ;)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: streamtheworld
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother in September 2011 and enjoyed every minute of it. The staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. The rooms were spacious and allowed for my mum and I not to cramp each other. It is in a cute neighbourhood with restaurants and food shops close by (at the end of the street) and is about a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tour which was teh closest stop for the Big Red Bus tours.

Reviews.Title: “Superior room ticked all the boxes and Coco came too”
Reviews.Author: globalcoachtours
Reviews.Content: We choose this due to great reviews and I have to agree. Plus our labradoodle was made welcome too. Quiet rooms and large comfy bed gave us a good nights sleep in room 32. Very warm even in January so we chose to have the heating off. Air con unit present for the warmer seasons. Excellent free wifi that allows Skype calls. Some hotels block Skype access! Massive flat screen TV with some HD channels. Some of the films you could choose your audio in other languages. iPod doc useful. Fridge/mini bar, safe, tea/coffee. Pleasant and efficient staff. The Eiffel Tower is just under 5 minutes walk two streets away and then you can see it. Then a few more minutes stroll along the Champs de Mars to the base. A popular place for locals to walk their dogs any time of day. Another reason why the location worked well for us. We didn't have breakfast here as it seemed a little pricey at 14 euro each, but it looked very good. There's a great bakery next to the hotel on the corner. A pastry and coffee in the room got our day off to a great start. There was building work going on at the back of the hotel in another annex, but this caused us no disturbance whatsever. We arrived by car on a Thursday. I had pre-booked secure parking for only 10 euro per day with Q-Park Etoile through Smart Parking. It would otherwise cost 35 euro per day. About 20 min walk back to the hotel which was very pleasant. Took the car out Sunday evening and parked in the street near the hotel for free until 9am next morning when we returned to England.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bettye_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. Location is excellent for dining, shopping, easy metro access and walking to Eiffel Tower. The staff was helpful and courteous, just wonderful people. The rooms are very clean and have ample closet space, a bathroom with two sinks and separate toilet area, and amenities such as mini frig, safe, flat screen TV, black out blinds, tea/coffee and other nice touches to make our stay comfortable. We would definitely book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “amazing......”
Reviews.Author: ffairfield
Reviews.Content: Where do I start???? Location - perfect, 5mins walk from metro at Ecole Militaire. Rue Cler was fantastic, loads of pubs, eateries, fresh fruit and veggies, fresh fish and the best of cheese you will ever find. Hotel - reception staff very friendly and helpful. Room was huge although I did book a superior room with massive walk in wardrobe, separate toilet, lovely bathroom with large shower and his and her sinks. Huge bed with massive plasma tv. Also, electric shutters which meant that you had a great night's sleep. We stayed in room 33 which had the added bonus of a view of the Eiffel Tower! At night we ate in the Cafe de Bosquet across the road from the hotel and then also a Thai Restaurant, Jade something.....both very good service and reasonably priced. All in all the area is perfect for food and drink and everyone was lovely natured.....will defo be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: phillyvisitor
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights on a recent trip to Paris and was very pleased. The desk staff all speak fluent English and are very helpful and friendly. I was in a Superior room which was plenty big. The bathroom was also very large and was fully stocked with slippers and complimentary toiletries. The breakfast buffet is great. A bit pricey but tons of options: Eggs, bacon, breads, pastries, yogurts, cheeses, meats, etc. Also this location can't be beat. You have Rue Cler at your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: travelbugslc
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Paris, planned over New Years so searching for good accommodation needed alittle bit more research. After reading reviews for this hotel and comparing them to other similar 'star rated' ones, I decided to book with Hotel Relais Bosquet and am so glad I did. Everything is excellent - the location, the accomodation, the service. To reveiwers that say they expect more for what they paid - THIS IS PARIS, of course it is abit more expensive to alot of other places. Just like visiting New York, Sydney, London: expect to pay alot more than what you'd get at 'home'. We've stayed at many Ritz Carltons and Westins, but we were still impressed with Hotel Relais Bosquet. This is a nice, small, quiet hotel in a safe, convienient location. We booked the superior room with the Eiffle view as it was our first visit to Paris and we were celebrating my birthday as well as New Years. Because we later extended by 2 days, we had to move to a no-view superior later which didnt bother us. The staff made it easy by allowing us to leave our luggage in the room and moving it for us when the 2nd room was available. We found the superior rooms to be comfortable and spacious for our short time spent in the room. It was nice having the Eiffle view but it really is no biggie as you will hardly be in the room. Also liked having a separate toilet to the shower. The 1st room had the shower head on the side of the bath which was abit arkward but nonetheless not a big deal. Superior room bathrooms are big. Housekeeping always did a good job at cleaning the room daily and replenishing toiletries and towels. Also liked that the rooms had slippers (usually only find these in 4-5 star hotels). The rooms are also equipped with a safe, blackout blinds, tea/coffee, mini fridge, iron, reading bed lights and flat screen tv (yes I found a few places with box tvs still and not all these amenities). The room also has a heater and a separate air con unit. The air con unit is however turned off during winter so if you are like my husband and still sleep with the air con on during winter, then you will have to open the windows. Luckily even during NYE celebrations, the area was still quiet at night for a sound sleep. Another plus is the free wifi you get in the room. Not readily available in public areas as you may be used to from home. Location is safe and excellent - bus stop and metro a short walk away, the Eiffle tower about 10 mins walk away and so close to many good restuarants, bakeries and shops. Service - the staff are all so excellent. All very helpful, friendly and patient, even the grave yard shift staff. You tend to be abit more 'free' whilst on holiday so it was good when theyd remind us of safety: pickpocketers, late night travel on the metro etc. They made our stay alot easier. I wish I knew all the monsieur names to mention them. It was nice knowing at the end of the day, we were returning to a quiet, comfortable, clean hotel with friendly staff in a safe, convenient location - we will definitely stay here again. Thank you Hotel Relais Bosquet Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Apartment Rental”
Reviews.Author: Severine66
Reviews.Content: This is a review of the hotel's apartment "Studio Valadon." I did not stay in the hotel so cannot comment on that, other than the front desk staff who were very welcoming and helpful. This apartment was in the perfect location, just one street over from Rue Cler, which is a wonderful neighborhood. The price was very reasonable considering we had an entire studio apartment to ourselves. The apartment was very clean and had a full kitchen (no oven) with washer/dryer and Murphy beds. Internet/computer was included in the cost. The shower was a bit tricky and the floor was a bit slippery so you had to be careful. The apartment looked into the courtyard of the building and the other apartments so not much of a view, but it is Paris after all so it's not like you want to spend much time indoors anyway! The hotel is always available if you need them for anything so you don't feel entirely alone. I would highly recommend renting this apartment if you want to experience life like a true Parisian!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PetaMay
Reviews.Content: Located just ten minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. Also at the end of your street is some great restaurant and bars. Metro stop is very close also. Easy to get to and from airport, take Metro nearby 5 stops to Opera and jump on the bus just outside the tube station for 10Euro. Staff are wonderfully helpful, nothing was too much trouble. Free Wi-fi in your room, unlike some places that make you sit in their reception. I did however find breakfast a little overpriced. And I wouldn't bother paying for the "Eiffel view".

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bellosguardo
Reviews.Content: 40 room, reasonably priced, comfortable hotel. Friendly helpful staff. Very nice bathroom, toilet separate. small but fine room, bed too hard for us (seniors), quick elevator, Metro close and Rue Cler a block away. Enough close-by restaurants to last a year! Stayed 4 nights, will return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: MPH27
Reviews.Content: Lovely small hotel in a great location. The reception staff are very friendly and attentive and we thoroughly enjoyed out stay for New Year. We were fortunate enough to have a room at the front of the hotel with a tower view and were pleased with our room - it had everything we needed and toiletries, towels etc were replaced every day. Only a few streets away from the Eiffel Tower was fantastic especially on New Years Eve as we were able to celebrate in the park infront of the tower avoiding the more crowded areas and travelling across Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel...”
Reviews.Author: SVSAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on its high rating onTripadvisor, and were not disappointed. We spent four days there around Christmas, and it was excellent. Firstly, the lady who checked us in on arrival was super helpful - we arrived early, but she had the room ready so we were able to freshen up before heading out to the city. Furthermore, she also helped arrange our tickets for Moulin Rouge, and adivised on a place to buy Louvre tickets in advance and avoid the long lines. I refrained from complimenting her too much as the wife may not have been very appreciative of that, we were in Paris for her birthday! The other staff was also very friendly and always willing to help with directions and any other queries. The room was very clean, comfortable and cosy, overlooking a courtyard, with motorized blinds on the windows to keep out the light. The bathroom was decent, except for the european style of half-size screen doors for the shower, which sometimes lets water splash out, and the shower being mounted on the side wall (instead of at the end), which can be an awkward angle at times, but not a big issue as such. We had the breakfast once, and it was excellent quality, though not a bargain. As noted by many other visitors, the location is super - the Ecole Militaire metro stop is five minutes away, there are two bus lines two minutes away, and the RER rail line that goes direct to Versailles is under ten minutes. There is a small convenience store two buildings away, and a small Carrefour supermarket a block away. The Rodin museum is a ten minute walk, as is the more popular Eiffel Tower. On the adjoining main street there is an excellent Chinese/Thai restaurant called Jade Fountain, we had dinner there twice. Overall, we had a great stay and would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, good service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Fahim S
Reviews.Content: This hotel at the time was rated 3 stars hence, I was reluctant but took a gamble which turned out to be a great choice, I will rate it 5 stars without the fancy amenities which we never use anyway. The layout of the room was well designed, the room was well kept and clean, no peculiar odors. Service from the front desk to room service was great and very friendly. The location is good: 4 blocks to Eiffel tower, super market and bakery practically next door, restaurants close by, and underground train station about a block and a half away. I highly recommend it and it would be my first choice again next time we travel to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jlp913
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location, near the Eiffel Tower, and only about a block from Rue Cler, which has some great shops and restaurants. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There was also free wi-fi. Hotel Relais Bosquet will be first on my list for my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, sweet, Parisian slice of heaven!”
Reviews.Author: megfrances
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Thanksgiving and would stay here again in a heartbeat! Perfectly located walking distance to Eiffel Tower. Awesome restaurants in the area...bakeries...very safe. Clean rooms, great staff. Cozy, comfortable. Just perfect for us! I could go on and on....highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zara R
Reviews.Content: Great location, restaurants, bars, shopping etc. The hotel staff were the most helpful I've ever had the pleasure to deal with, nothing was any trouble to them. This hotel will become my regular hotel whilst in Paris. It's great to stay in a hotel that is exactly as it's website.ZR

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will go back”
Reviews.Author: SnirK
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small, but cozy. Some superior rooms have Eiffel tower view. Our balcony (pictured in this review) had an Eiffel view. Hotel is walking distance to the Eiffel tower and nearby one of the nices streets of paris ( Rue cler ). There is a metro station nearby that can get you everywhere else. there is Internet service in the room , you just need the code from the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location & staff”
Reviews.Author: VA-Panache
Reviews.Content: Enjoyable stay with family last week. Convenient to market, metro and taxi. Staff was helpful and polite; Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Roberto C
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Relais Bosquet for five days in early December. The hotel has a great location with bakeries, cafes, cheese shops, pizzerias, etc. nearby. It is a charming area to walk, as it lies within blocks of Champs de Mars/Eiffel Tower/Trocadero. The staff speaks English well, and are quite helpful and polite. The room (standard double) is comfortable, if not roomy. The only problem is that the beds are 'pushed together' and tend to separate. The elevator seems fairly new and is fast. The stairs are spiral and not easy to climb, as the steps are narrow. I encountered very little street noise in the 4th floor (5th floor in US), and the electric outer window shade kept out all light and, I assume, most of the noise. All around, this is one great little hotel and I would not hesitate to stay there again. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, stylish, charming - and spacious!”
Reviews.Author: shermok
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights end Nov/beginning Dec. The location is terrific, right on the edge of the charming rue Cler market. Great cheese shop across the street and two of the nicest bookstores (one for adults and one for children) just next door. The staff at the hotel was welcoming and helpful without being intrusive. The rooms are surprisingly large for Paris and I had a separate bathroom (which was also very big with two sinks!) and toilet. Everything was immaculate and modern, in a nonetheless very charming atmosphere. I didn't have breakfast as there are so many nice cafés around but it looked fine. I had a coffee and croissant one morning in my room (only 6€) and it was good. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: trish_oleary
Reviews.Content: I would not hestiate in recommending this hotel.. very central... very clean.. Staff very helpful and metro a few minutes walk away!! Had a great weekend and would return..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lori P
Reviews.Content: We, my husband and I, spent 3 nights in November 2011 at the hotel and had a great stay. The superior rooms are very large and the bathroom with double sink was nice. Rooms were clean, staff was very pleasant and helpful, location is great. We would recommend this hotel as it is reasonably priced, in one of our favorite parts of the city - 7th Arrondissement, and the kind staff make for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, comfortable accomodations and great location.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingfromMemphis
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights in Paris (Nov 2011) and was very pleased with this hotel. The room and bath were very large and well appointed. I was a little concerned about having a room facing the street, but there was no noise and the room had automatic shades that you could use if you wanted to block out the outside lights. Double sinks in the bath (tub with shower), separate room for the toliet. The staff was very helpful pre and during the stay. The hotel is walking distance to numerous resturants, and shopping. Just a short walk to metro. Elevator if needed for luggage. I like to go out for breakfast so I did not eat at the hotel, but the eating area looked very nice. They also offered room service for breakfast. Lovely lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience”
Reviews.Author: Dianne L
Reviews.Content: From location, staff, breakfast, room...everything was simply outstanding. My wife and I arrived in the early morning after a redeye flight and the staff were very accommodating...breakfast, coffee, wifi, tips as to where to kill a few hours until they could have our room ready. We stayed four nights and highly recommend it...great hotel and staff in a very tourist friendly neighborhood...very Parisian. Definitely on top of our hotel list next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hitherejimbo
Reviews.Content: First, the location. The hotel is in the upscale 7th arrondissement which is elegant and largely residential unlike the noisy tourist-infested 6th. A metro station is around the corner (also a post office) and Paris' magnificent metro system can take you everywhere. It is a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and one block to Rue Cler, the traffic free "walking street" lined with cafes, boutique stores, and markets. There are several excellent restaurants within walking distance. Now the hotel itself. Unlike so many reasonably priced Paris hotels, which show their age, the Relais Bosquet is modern in every respect (air-conditioniing, elevator, automatic blinds, etc.). The rooms are spotlessly clean and spacious (recommend the Superior ones) as are the bathrooms. The beds are comfortable and the housekeeping service excellent. The hotel staff is friendly, efficient, and very helpful.- always ready with advice on sight-seeing, restaurants, etc. There are two computers in he lobby for free use by guests (but good luck on mastering the French keyboard). An excellent breakfast is served.. Finally, in a city where hotel prices are high and sometimes stratospheric the prices at the Relais Bosquet are reasonable. I have visited Paris many many times and have tried numerous hotels but never found one I would return to next time. Now I have found THE place. Vive l'hotel Relais Bosquet..

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay in Rue Cler Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: YolandaGolightly
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of the hotel was the professional and helpful staff. My husband is in a wheelchair much of the time, and the considerate staff quickly moved us from a 2nd floor room to a roomier one on the ground floor. From that first few minutes, we were very pleased with our choice of hotels in Paris. The Rue Cler neighborhood had become a special place for us a year ago on a visit to Paris, and the hotel is convenient to the cafes, shops, and markets in the area. The room-darkening shades were a plus, and the breakfast buffet was full of delicious, nutritious items.

Reviews.Title: “Super Cute Hotel with Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: GroovyChick54
Reviews.Content: The staff are amazing; very helpful, very friendly. Very charming hotel. Good location. I definitely enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 1st time stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Robin H
Reviews.Content: Like others that have posted my husband and I had a wonderful experience our three nights at the Hotel Relais. The darken shades I think was our favorite as it allowed us to sleep in and catch up on the sleep we lost on the plane ride over and recuperate from all the walking of Paris during the day. The staff was always helpful,very attentive and pleasant, and spoke English. We mentioned Rick Steve's book and we received a 10% discount on our total bill. There is so much right around the hotel (not even a five minute walk) that you could want for nothing...excellent restaurants, bars, supermarkets, boutiques ...and we could see the Eiffel Tower from our room #25. It was a great vacation and we couldn't have been more pleased with our hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's true...”
Reviews.Author: jim9013
Reviews.Content: It's all been said, it's all been written. The place is really a great location in Paris. No surprises, no drama, no disappointments. Quiet, clean, comfortable...very patient and friendly staff at front desk as well. I'm all in with Relais Bosquet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: HappyBCTravellers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and it was a great place to stay for the final nights of our 3 week stay in France. The hotel and service were excellent and the location was perfect for sightseeing (walking). We would hightly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in the 7th!”
Reviews.Author: LoisOttawa
Reviews.Content: We chose all of our hotels on our recent vacation using Tripadvisor and were delighted with all of our choices. The location can't be beat--close to the Eiffel Tower, and Les Invalides; we were even comfortable walking to the the Arc de Triomphe,Place de la Concorde and the Louvre. There are great bistros within easy walking distance. Rue Cler is a treat. We booked a superior room which overlooked a small courtyard, so there was no view, but it was quiet,and this is important to us. The blackout shades were great. Loved the smell of the linen! We had ample drawer and cupboard space,and appreciated the mini-fridge and kettle. The staff were friendly,professional and booked our restaurants in advance of our arrival. Thank you,Christian! We enjoyed our stay very much and are already planning our return next fall. Booking tip: I would suggest booking directly with the hotel for a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - boutique hotel feel”
Reviews.Author: Erica W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 days and it was a Perfect spot. Great location, walking distance to Eiffel Tower. Friendly staff and fluent in English which was very helpful. I highly recommend this hotel if you are seeking a boutique feel versus a large chain establishment. Fabulous restaurants just around the corner- great neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jpmcdonough
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Relais Bosquet in October, and enjoyed it thoroughly. The hotel is immaculate, rooms recently updated, the lobby is updated. Excellent breakfast. Good location, short walk to the Metro and to Rue Cler. Lots of good dining options close by. The staff are very professional and polite and the front desk staff all speak English quite well and are very helpful. Our room faced Rue Champs de Mars and was a little noisy, but we had earplugs, always recommended to have when traveling anywhere. The rooms have a mini-fridge, but we just put our own stuff in there as we needed to. Glasses are provided and there is a kettle for making tea or coffee (both are provided).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: chochee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Relais Bosquet for three nights with my sister and cousins (six of us). This is a smaller, charming hotel in a great location: Rue Cler, just around the block, is packed with little restaurants, cafes, bars, a supermarket, cheese shop, bakery, etc. The Eiffel Tower was a short walk away, and the metro station (Ecole Militaire) is about a block and a half away. We took the metro everywhere (museums, Sacre Coeur, etc); the metro was fairly easy to figure out, but when we were confused, the people of Paris were so helpful, stopping on their own to help us when they saw us looking at the metro map in confusion. The Hotel itself is a wonderful value, very clean, with the most comfortable bed and pillows (very important to me). The rooms had everything we needed (flat screen tv, a/c, electric window shutters, safe, etc. The hotel even had free wifi service in the lobby. The staff was very accommodating both before and during our trip. Christian and Frederika answered all of our questions via e-mail before the trip; Frederika arranged shuttles to pick us up from the airport and then to the TGV station when we departed. We walked to the Eiffel Tower twice, once on the first day we arrived and later, on our last night in Paris. We took a boat tour (starting near the Eiffel Tower) that takes you down the Seine at night. It was a magnificent ending to our trip, seeing all the lights of Paris, and especially seeing the Eiffel Tower all lit up at night. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel because of its cleanliness, comfort, and location. I would definitely stay here again if I ever return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in the 7th”
Reviews.Author: ViviColumbiaMaryland
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended the Hotel Relais Bosquet and it proved to be just what we are looking for - small, intimate and quite "français". They were friendly, helpful and very accommodating. I asked for a room change because our first one was small and dark and they gave us another larger room which had a view of the Eiffel Tower! They arranged transportation to the airport and even provided us with croissant and coffee at 7am as we waited for the van. It is well located in the 7th arrondissement where many very nice restaurants and shops are located not to mention the Rue Cler where food vendors display their delicious "traiteur". We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the seventh”
Reviews.Author: dcgagnon
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our one-week stay at the Hotel Relais Bosquet. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are well appointed; free wifi and a good shower, two things which matter to me. A very convenient ice machine near the lobby. Breakfast delivered in bed with a nice morning smile! The hotel is very close to rue Cler and the metro, making it a most convenient place to stay. The only two things we noticed were: no bathrobes in the rooms, and the bed mattresses are very hard, something not everyone may like. Overall, I dont know of a better three-star hotel in Paris, and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and well-located boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rita G
Reviews.Content: Quiet, well-situated hotel within walking distance of the rue Cler, the Eiffel Tower and a metro station. My daughter and I stayed for 3 days and loved it! We booked a larger room so we had plenty of space. The room was well-appointed and included free wi-fi. The staff spoke English and was very helpful and accommodating both prior to and after our arrival. Wouldn't think twice about staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Paris and Provence”
Reviews.Author: pgk81541
Reviews.Content: We had 6 nights in Paris and 3 in Provence. We planned our own trip, bought our own tickets (air and rail), and, with advice from friends (local and those good advisors on TripAdvisor) made our own hotel reservations. The Relais Bosquet was excellent in every way. (We did choose the deluxe - or larger - room size and glad of it.) We managed to see many of the museums and churches we had wanted to see. And we did take a day trip to Giverny - easy and worth doing. We also enjoyed walking around and dining in the Rue Cler area (where the Relais Bosquet was located). Our only difficulty was with the travel in country, and if I'd asked more advice from Trip Advisor, I probably would have spared us some anxiety (I didn't know how to find the right rail car when we took the train from Paris to Avignon, for example.) We managed the local transportation well. The buses are convenient and we used them quite a bit. Taxis are expensive, but we used them a good bit, as well, since my wife has knee and foot problems. We usually had very little trouble getting cabs - and only one really surly cabbie. We took a very expensive dinner cruise on the Seine. Next time, I would skip the dinner cruise and take a late afternoon/early evening cruise so to see the sights better and to see the lights come on. Dinner was excellent, but detracted from the sightseeing. We did take in a concert at St. Chappelle - a beautiful church/stained glass. Worth doing! We rented a car in Avignon and drove to St. Remy - a charming town. We stayed at L'Amanderie in St. Remy when we were in Avignon. It is not nearly as fancy as Relais Bosquet, but it was quite adequate. The hotel Trip Advisor recommended in St. Remy was full, which is why we stayed where we did; next time I'd try to stay right in downtown St. Remy - lots of very good restaurants. A HIGH POINT of our trip was hiring a tour guide for an all day excursion around Provence. Our guide was Laurent Catoni (<allprovence@gmail.com>). He picked us up in his van at 9 am and dropped us off back at our hotel at 6:30 p.m. We saw, among other things, the Pont du Gard, Avignon (center city, Pope's Palace, etc), Rousillon, a paper mill on a river which produced 'hand-made' paper from old cloth - a wonderful day. Laurent is very pleasant, knowledgeable, and accommodating. His English is excellent. We could not have seen and done all we did in Provence without him. We did manage on our own to tour Arles and we also found an olive grove and press business driving around on our own and had a tour of the whole place. A GPS in the car made that all quite easy. Advice from Trip Advisor travelers that we get to a hotel near the airport the night before our noon flight back to the states was very good advice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Rickster63
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in late September. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and spoke English. Our room was nicely appointed but had several technical problems: the new TV didn't work initially, and the safe repeatedly malfunctioned (ie useless) despite several attempts by the staff to fix it. I was told this new equipment was several months old and had already been unreliable. The a/c in the room was nice, as it was unusually warm when we were there (low 80's). We usually ate breakfast on Rue Cler, which is 1/2 block away. It's a great road for "people watching".

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to our "home" in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Laurie972
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Relais Bosquet for 5 nights to celebrate our anniversary before moving on to Disneyland and London via Eurostar. We wish we could have been here the rest of our vacation too! From the time I booked, the staff was extremely helpful and kind offering to make dinner and show reservations and offered help with directions and recommendations while we were there. When we arrived from the airport via taxi, we discovered that our driver did not accept credit cards. That was no problem for the helpful staff who came out with cash and paid the driver and just added the fee to our bill. Bertrand told me not to worry and that I was "home" and it really felt that way during our entire stay. We enjoyed the electric blinds which were amazing for quick afternoon naps, and having air conditioning in unseasonably warmer weather for late September was a plus. We didn't really use the huge flat screen TV, but it was there if needed. The Wi-Fi worked perfectly for checking our e-mail and planning routes for the next day. I found the room to be the perfect size with plenty of room for us to unpack our clothes in both a wardrobe and dresser. Lots of shelves in the bathroom too! We didn't have breakfast at the hotel because there are lots of bakeries, restaurants and grocery stores right next door and around the corner on Rue Cler. Our room had a refrigerator too, so we were able to buy food for picnics on our daily outings. The location is super close to the École Militaire metro stop, bus stops, within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and other points of interest, as well as a short walk to a BNP ATM (sister bank of BofA). I especially enjoyed and appreciated the upgrade to room #44 with a view of the top of the tower. I watched it twinkle from bed each night. Magical! I cannot wait to return and have told everyone I know they must make Relais Bosquet their "home" in Paris too.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: veneziaamore
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel in Paris and have been here many time through the years . Each time I have found the staff very helpful . The room is small but has all the amenities I would like: a comfortable, clean room, free wifi, flat screen tv, electric water kettle. It is close to the Ecole Militaire metro stop and close to restaurants, shops and has a wonderful street market. It is one of my favorite hotels in the Rue Cler area.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Cass2007
Reviews.Content: If the Relais Bosquet is in your price range, don't hesitate, book it! We just had one night but were treated like old and valued customers. The Reception team are outstanding. Ask them for their recommendations before you do ANYTHING! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Relais Bosquet-an excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: DonW536
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed 8 nights at this hotel. All the research that I found beforehand on this hotel, including Rick Steves' recommendation, proved correct. The Hotel is a great value as it has a professional & helpful staff, very clean, comfortable & quiet rooms, and is located in a very charming neighborhood with many wonderful restaurants. The staff makes you feel very welcome and is interested in assuring that you have a thoroughly enjoyable & pleasant stay. The central location of this hotel with easy access to the Metro subway, buses and a RER stop ensures that you can spend your days touring Paris, yet return afterward each time to a friendly & safe area and enjoy a great meal. Treat yourself to a excellent stay here, and you will have a memory to last a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: TMKMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed for 3 nights. We chose this hotel based on a Rick Steve's recommmendation - received a discount - and were not disappointed. The Rue Cler area was great and the Metro stop is very close. There are many great restaurants in the area. The Hotel itself is a wonderful value and very clean and even offered free in-room wireless access for one mobile device. The hotel staff was incredibly accomodating both before and during our trip. Christian answered all of my questions via e-mail before the trip and made our dinner reservations. Staying at the Hotel Relais Bosquet made our wonderful weekend in Paris even better!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: bill m
Reviews.Content: Location was great, staff was the same. Dont think twice - book it!

Reviews.Title: “As expected...”
Reviews.Author: mkarpoff
Reviews.Content: We got exactly what we expected when booking this hotel: Excellent location, free computer use, etc. One minor issue, however; the shower is a hand-held only, which I personally don't like. Weird how the Europeans like these things. Mention Rick Steves book, and get a real discount. The fact that the hotel is by Rue Cler is one of the reasons why we stayed there, and we were not disappointed. Rue Cler was great.

Reviews.Title: “In love with Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Hedvika
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Excellent service! Very helpful and very nice staff. We had a problem with our reservation, my fault - I missed a day in between our travel. The hotel manager took care of us even though they were fully booked. The hotel was very nice, the rooms reasonably large, comfortable, clean and quiet. The Metro station is very close, an excellent bakery next door and the Rue Cler with it's famous food, just behind the corner. Eiffel tower is a five minute walk, so you can have a picnic on the lawn and watch the lights on the tower go up. We had amazing time! Beautiful city full of culture and happenings, chic and sophisticated people. We are hooked like so many others... definitely want to come back!!! Thank you all in the Hotel Relais Bosquet for being a part of our great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ALBH
Reviews.Content: Great Location. This was a return trip after almost ten years and it is still a great place to stay. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan D
Reviews.Content: My dad and I just returned from a great stay in Paris and Northern France where we stayed for two nights at this lovely hotel in a great location in the 7th Arrondisement. We usually stay in the 6th Arrondisement when traveling to Paris but decided to try this hotel based on Trip Adviser recommendations and Rick Steve's recommendations. We were not disappointed. The room was very nice and had everything including kleenex tissues, wash cloths, a flat screen TV and was very clean. I can't say enough about the great service! We were waiting for our cab at 5:30 a.m. to go to the airport and were brought two cups of coffee in the lobby by the front desk attendant. Recommendations for restaurants were fantastic and the staff went out of their way to make sure we had directions to the Eifel Tower and all the other nearby attractions. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “As always, excellent”
Reviews.Author: judsongirl81
Reviews.Content: Love, love this hotel. Stayed here about 6 years ago. Even better now. Very friendly & helpful staff. Rooms have been remodeled and are very pretty and comfortable. A/C, room safe, 'fridge, room darkening "hurricane" (what can I say, I live in Houston) shutters ..... Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Goodplace; Great location”
Reviews.Author: Allen727286
Reviews.Content: Frankly the room had almost everything we would want. A/C, good bed, table w/chairs, bath/shower, huge flat screen. Men working the service desk were willing and able to provide everything we asked them for. Great location for our 3 night stay. I was concerned with the rate being so reasonable that the hotel might be lacking something important and it didn't. I'm pleased we stayed here and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: czechyourbag
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay for three nights. The staff was very helpful. We spoke a little French and they spoke English very well. They gave us complete directions for using city transportation, made dinner reservations and helped with any request. The location can't be beat. The Rue Cler markets and nice restaurants are steps away. The Metro and RER and cross town buses are very close. The room was clean and we were happy to have air conditioning on a very hot day. The bathroom was clean and well appointed. Breakfast was a nice selection of fruit, breads, cheese and scrambled or soft-boiled eggs. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and I would definitely stay here on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, okay for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: helenhin
Reviews.Content: With it's proximity to the wonderful Rue Cler markets, the Eiffel tower and the Seine this is a very good location for Paris. There are a couple of very nice restaurants within an easy walk, and of course lots of busy cafes. Room was pretty small but we didn't spend much time in it. I wouldn't want to stay here for more than a couple of nights. The staff was helpful when asked, but did not go out of their way to make us feel welcome. We arrived off the plane at 7 am and there was nowhere to put our luggage except under the buffet table in the dining room while we waited for our room to be ready at 2 pm. Everything was clean, Wi Fi was free, and the breakfast was typical mix of breads, cheese and sausages. Nothing special...

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: scodkokno
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. Yes the rooms can be small by american standards but you are in Paris so get out and enjoy it. The staff are super helpful the room was clean. The Rue de cler market street is steps away with all its wonderful bakeries and cafes. Eiffel tower is a short walk. This was our second stay and I would recommend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Darling10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June for the tennis championship . We had requested a room with a view of the eiffel tower but got a very cramped room by the lift with no chance of a change. We actually found the front desk staff very unhelpful and a little snotty . The hotel is clean and well presented and the breakfast was adequate but very expensive for what was on offer. We have had much better hotels in Paris for the price . We had our grandson with us for his birthday treat and did not find the hotel very child friendly. I sometimes think that unless you are American you get a raw deal in Paris - certainly do not have a French name !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: RockDiva
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days following a business trip. Loved, loved, loved this hotel. Stayed in a "superior" room, which was very spacious and comfortable, with a peek-a-boo view of the Eiffel Tower. Check-in was very efficient, I arrived a bit early but my room was ready so I was able to go right up to it. Bedding was comfortable. Carpet was a bit shabby but not really a big issue for me. Location is fabulous - Rue Clare is a block away with its wonderful shopping and there are lots of restaurants nearby. The lobby was light and bright, and breakfast was available in the mornings (though I didn't try it). Front desk staff were very helpful. Bathroom was sparkling clean with plenty of amenities provided. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: joelaws
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and loved our stay. The hotel is small and charming, very helpful front desk staff, comfortable and nicely decorated rooms and a great location. We had a queen room (31) overlooking a central courtyard with a lovel magnolia tree (I think!). Very peaceful. Large flat screen tv with international channels, air conditioning, free wifi, nice (if compact) bathroom, electric window shutters to keep out the light, mini bar and safe. All in all, everything we needed. The location was excellent. Metro station (Ecole Militaire) a 2 min walk away connected us to everything very efficiently. Even Montmartre was only a 15 min journey from the hotel. Rue Cler is right next to the hotel and is great to explore. Amazing food shops, great little brasseries and cafes and great atmosphere. It's about a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower which is very pleasant either through the backstreets or the park. All in all, Hotel Relais Bosquet provided us with everything we needed for a great little stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced 2 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: James R
Reviews.Content: We were prepared for the small rooms of Paris, and the high prices of going during high season, but we were disappointed with this hotel. The bed was incredibly uncomfortable, and the shower was so small you couldn't turn around. It was low budget all the way. We checked out the very next morning and found a 4 star hotel that cost less for the remainder of our trip. In all fairness, the staff was very courteous. They did arrange for transportation from the airport to the hotel, which ended up costing approx. 30 Euros more than when we hailed a cab to take us back to the airport from roughly the same neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel & staff, couldn't have been happier with it!”
Reviews.Author: TammyAndRalph
Reviews.Content: We came to Paris to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. Such an unforgettable trip! The entire staff at the Relais Bosquet was friendly and professional. Three stood out in particular: Bruno (usually at night) who was very kind and very quickly got us ice at the mere mention of it (merci encore!), the gentleman (aux lunettes) usually there in daytime whose name I didn't get (sorry monsieur!) and the young man in the kitchen area who always went out of his way to acknowledge us and wish us a good day. Housekeeping did an exceptional job daily. The Superior room we stayed in was wonderful. Spacious (plenty of room for 2 adults), quiet, clean and newly renovated. Air conditioned with a big, comfortable bed. We slept very well every night. We used the in-room fridge and kettle and greatly appreciated the complimentary coffee and tea. The bathroom was perfect, separate toilet, double sinks with vanity shelf, full bath and shower and very clean. Housekeeping was great and refreshed our towels even when they really could have lasted another day - that was very kind and appreciated. The location was all we could have wanted. Less than 2 minutes down the street to Rue Cler, 10 minutes to the Eiffel Tower and under 5 to the Ecole Militaire metro station, and quite an easy walk. The area was quiet and safe, we walked at night without a care and enjoyed the beauty of it in the day. Right at the intersection of the hotel's street and rue Cler are a grocery store, a patisserie and the Café du Marché restaurant - all very good and at decent prices. A word about costs - be prepared to spend more than you think you will on just about everything in Paris, compared to Canadian standards. It can be a costly trip if you don't try to find the more economical choices. That said, you are in the most beautiful and magical city in the world, so enjoy it! We can't comment on the breakfast as we had our own each day in our room - happily purchased the night before at the Leader Price grocery store on the corner. Yogurt and cereal is our standard and the room's fridge made it easy to do. Do try the italian restaurant Del Angelo at 6 avenue Rapp - it's not too pricey and delicious. About an 8 minute walk from the hotel on the way to the Eiffel Tower. Make sure to stroll down rue de Grenelle and rue Saint Dominique - lots of shops and food stops. Overall, a real value for the money and we can't say enough about the Relais Bosquet. We did a lot of research before booking our hotel and were very pleased with our choice. We would like to thank previous reviewers on TripAdvisor for their honest and accurate descriptions of this hotel. You helped us choose it and we are very glad we did. If we have the good grace to return to the amazingly beautiful city of Paris we will undoubtably stay at the Relais Bosquet again. One of our favorite hotels anywhere we've stayed in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, welcoming hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: midlandmusician
Reviews.Content: The hotel lies on a quiet street within easy reach of the Eifel Tower, the Seine and plenty of restaurants on nearby Rue Cler.
