Staff were welcoming and efficient and there is a nice seating area in the lobby. Our bedroom was clean, adequately furnished and air conditioned though the decor and bedding seemed a little dated and the colour scheme rather eccentric. The room looked out on to a peaceful inner courtyard. There are two parts of the hotel - the pricier rooms at the front and the standard ones (including ours) at the rear. Breakfast is served in a delightful room on the ground floor and, though there cooked items were limited, quality of food and presentation were good and imaginative. The cost of breakfast is extra, making this quite an expensive hotel for three stars, though Paris hotels are in price terms at the higher end for city breaks.

Reviews.Title: “We would be back”
Reviews.Author: LQGolf
Reviews.Content: I took my 11 year old daughter to Paris for a Mother / Daughter trip. The staff at this hotel was very good to us and our room was very nice. We would definitely go back if ever in Paris

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in France”
Reviews.Author: puzzeled
Reviews.Content: This charming little 3 star constantly calls us back. The rooms are cosy and clean. The furniture is old but charming. The staff is extraordinary. The Rue Cler neighborhood is a great area, with good food at reasonable prices. You can pick up lunch at the corner bakery and walk to the Eifel tower to eat it. I need to thank Christian for his kind assistance in helping me recover the wallet that I left in the cab that took me from the Hotel Relais Bosquet to the airport. His kindness in intervening with the cab company resulted in my wallet being found and delivered to me at the airport within 20 minutes of my discovering I had dropped it in the cab. Without Christian's help my trip would have come to an ugly end on the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Maine5577
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this hotel. I searched for hours to find a hotel with enough space in the room to move about, that was in a good location and that was updated. This was all that and more! We had a superior room with a view of the Eiffel tower. The furnishings were wonderful and it was nice and relaxing to come back to after a long day of walking. The size was perfect, much larger than most rooms in Paris. Linens were good. Closet was nice and big and the bathroom was also with double sinks. Radio in room was nice as well as the tray of goodies, stocked fridge (had to pay for these items) and the complementry tray of tea/coffee. Staff was wonderful., very helpful and friendly. We did not eat breakfast here even though it was offered. We chose to walk a few steps to the cafe's and bakery on rue de cler and sit outside and watch the early morning foot traffic. It was like a small neighborhood and you felt like you were part of it, just what we wanted. Airport shuttle service was great and overall everything was perfect. We would stay here again for sure. You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very nice French design of the room.”
Reviews.Author: ithaca12
Reviews.Content: Location is very good, walking distance the Eiffel tower. Also some very nice cafés in Rue de Cler, can just sit and enjoy people watching over a glass of wine, just at the corner street of the hotel. Hotel us very clean, loved the French interior if the room and the bathroom too. :-) highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We would certainly stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Johnston948
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be friendly & very helpful whenever we asked for guidance. The accomodation is within walking distance of Notre Dam, The Louvre & the eiffel tower. There are plenty of restaurants close by. All in all it was very convenient. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK location and price”
Reviews.Author: JaviesMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in May. We had a standard room on the 3rd floor. The room was quiet with no street noise and there are black-out blinds to block out light. The bath was clean and the room was superficially clean but could use a thorough, deep cleaning (crumbs on floor in corners, stains on upholstery, dust on furniture, etc.). Maybe the superior rooms are cleaner. We asked for two twin beds. The staff said the beds WERE two twins but the beds were “under one cover.” Sure enough, there were two beds with separate sheets and blankets under one cover. This was the only hotel that we stayed at in France where the hotel could not provide separate covers for two beds (we solved this minor issue by folding the cover onto one bed). The bedding was definitely clean but the sheets were so old and worn that there were small tears. The front desk staff was pleasant enough (the evening guy was particularly pleasant). The tea pot was totally corroded but was replaced quickly when we asked for a replacement. There are two bakeries within a block with fabulous treats. There is a Monoprix grocery store a couple of blocks away. This hotel is convenient to the Eiffel Tower but less convenient to other attractions (i.e. not easily walkable but easy by metro). One night we bypassed the crowds in the restaurants on the Rue Cler and walked to Chez Germaine for dinner. It is a small restaurant with a charming host filled with Parisians enjoying the good food at reasonable prices. Next time we will probably stay in the Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel feels like Paris!”
Reviews.Author: jonesmit
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times and have never been disappointed. The location in the Champs de Mars area not far from the Eiffel Tower is ideal, it is on a metro stop, the concierge and hotel help are outstanding and helpful and the breakfast is superb. The view of the Eiffel Tower out our window was magic and it had a light show for the holidays. One block from Rue Cler...a typical parisienne market street! We have also rented their apartment and studio.

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle”
Reviews.Author: LetsGetOut
Reviews.Content: Of just about everything. Easy to get to from the airport train to Eiffel exit then short ride to hotel. Walk to the Tower and Invaladies. Close to several subway stations. Don't be intimidated by looking at a train map. You'll go crazy. Once you get there you'll be able to figure it all out in about 15 minutes. Very easy and convenient. Get a rail pass for your entire stay. You will use it. Loved the Latin Quarter. Most of what you will like is here. The Louvre would take a week to get through and still not see it all. Took a side trip to Loire Valley. A great trip in the Castle Valley. It's a full day trip Price is about $300 each and well worth it. Includes the bullet train to Tours and back. Try to fit it in.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Raymond K
Reviews.Content: My return to Paris was made perfect by our choice to stay at the Hotel Relais Bosquet Paris. The entire staff from concierge to maids were more than just courteous, they were kind in every way. Everything was done so well, whether it was the grand informal breakfast, directions, wi fi, advise, and suggestions. The rooms were wonderful for our family of three. The neighborhood was excellent for restaurants, grocery and fresh produce, and shopping. On the 5th floor, we had a view of the Eiffel Tower which on Bastille Day became a visual delight for the fireworks at night. I came to see why Paris is called the City of Light in all its wonder. On my return to Paris in the future, this Hotel will be the place where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended - will stay again !”
Reviews.Author: BH_CH_2011
Reviews.Content: Firstly and most importantly the hotel staff are very friendly and helpful - a good introduction to Paris. The room we had, with an Eiffel Tower view on the top floor, was spacious and very comfortable with a decent sized bathroom. WIFI was free :) All that was great but as visitors we were out and about - the hotel is very central and a short stroll from a metro station on a main line and we had absolutley no trouble getting around. It's very close to a main restaurant avenue and the pastry shops are about 20 paces away from the door. But the best part on the location was the short stroll to the Eiffel Tower where you can sit on the lawn, drink wine and eat cheese and pastries watching the sun set and lightshow - and then have only a few minutes to get home. Cannot speak highly enough of the Hotel Relais Bosquet and it is our ONLY choice for our next visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beds In Europe! Get the Superior Room”
Reviews.Author: Travelwithnise
Reviews.Content: We stayed here June 2011 for three days over the Bastille Day Holiday! Check in was fast and easy, so we dropped our luggage and took the short walk to the Eiffel tower where we had printed off tickets online (recommended) then back to a restaurants on Rue Cler which is less than a block away from the hotel..many great eats, bakeries, and a convenient supermarket. Many tourist attractions within walking distance, and metro station close by. We took a superior room #11 which was just in front of the elevator. A little noisy, but the room was adequate in size compared to the room we left in Amsterdam which had the two of us climbing over the top of one another. The beds where heavenly...I have a bad back, and I loved these beds. We ended up moving to another hotel for a few days, and those beds sucked! The bath in the superior has 2 sinks, a lovely tub which I actually used, and a hand held shower with a partial swing door. The view from the window was into a small courtyard, and had electronic rolling blackout shades if you wanted to use them. The room comes with a safe, free wi-fi and 2 computers in the lobby. We did not eat breakfast, but like others had a small pastry in the am, so can't comment on breakfast. My only nit-pic - I was a little concerned about picking up the key at the desk after leaving each time- desk clerk just handed over the key. It was a little discerning when we first arrived I did not recognize the desk clerks...nor could they recognize me! I would recommend this hotel, for location. It is a bit more pricey than others, but it was very clean, adequate size, and those beds were fabulous! Get a superior room!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: REALNICE
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in the Rue Cler area of Paris. Convient to Metro stop and 10 minute walk to Eiffel Tower. Actually walking distance to many attraction. Friendly and accomodating staff at any time of the day. We had a superior room and it was adequate for the two of us, we had heard the regular rooms are a bit small, but that is more the norm in Europe at this price point. They have breakfat at the hotel for a fee but we preferred going ot the bakery right next door to hotel, they had the most mouthwatering pastries.Make sure to go early and try the mini croissants. We would get a dozen or two and snack on them throughtout the day. Many small grocery stores in a 2 block area. Also many restaurants on Rue Cler, try the little Crepe to go stand, you won't regret it. A La Mere De Famille is where you want to go for your sweet tooth. Friendly staff and plenty of free samples. You must try the Macaroons that are appearing all over Paris, but just try the small ones. they positivley melt in your mouth.

Reviews.Title: “It was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Junebugcares
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with our teenage son and thoroughly enjoyed staying at the the Hotel Relais Bosquet. The location is fantastic: safe, clean, near the metro, many great restaurants and bakery close by, but not so close as to be noisy. We were fortunate enough to get a room with a balcony and a view of the Eiffel tower where my son loved to hang out and people watch. The buffet breakfast was awesome since my son who eats enough for 3 could have a large and varied breakfast to start off the day: all included. All of the staff were very helpful, warm, and kind. It was spacious and clean with updated bathrooms. It was our favorite place to stay the whole trip!

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: vleblanc
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel just a few steps away from the Eiffel tower. Very quiet neighborhood. Staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. Buffet breakfast is awesome. Would definitely go back to this hotel, and would recommend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would recommend it to anyone”
Reviews.Author: LMGIllinois
Reviews.Content: Christian was very helpful and great to work with. The area is very nice with lots of cafes' and a very good bakery next door. The effiel tower is close. Walking in that city is easy. The hotel is very clean and the room rates are reasonable. The bathrooms are nice and clean. Our room was a little small, but fit our purpose fine. We were only in our room to sleep. The city has too much to offer, to stay in a hotel room and miss Paris. Christian is the one who is very delightful to work with and will offer his time always. We took the private shuttle from the airport to the hotel, which is well worth the money. We enjoyed working with Christian. We were celabrating our 10th wedding anniversary. We will definitely return to Paris and stay at the Relais Bosquet. We love Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We will certainly return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1952Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Great location close to Rue Cler market with many restaurants to choose from and within 10 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower. Hotel was very quiet, beds very comfortable with good quality sheets. Ali, the driver who picked us up from the airport, a wonderful first impression of Paris. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, wonderful location, comfortable room - happy to recommend to others”
Reviews.Author: tmorgan
Reviews.Content: This was a small boutique hotel less than a block from the charming Rue Cler area. The markets and restaurants on Rue Cler were very inviting and reasonably priced. The hotel is very small and in a quiet location, but is very near the Eiffel Tower and the Ecole Militaire Metro station so it is easy to get to anywhere in the city. The hotel staff was extremely helpful in pointing us to where we wanted to go and otherwise making suggestions or helping us with a cab to the airport. The desk staff spoke English quite well and could not have been more friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable and had all of the amenities we could ask for. The push-button exterior window shade was quite nice since it got light so early in the morning. We would happily recommend this hotel to others and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and will be back”
Reviews.Author: thenotGriswalds
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights at the hotel Relais in September. Our trip to Paris was a great experience and the hotel made our stay extremely comfortable. The location is fairly close to the Eiffel Tower. The metro was just a few blocks walk and we were able to go all over Paris with ease. The restaurants around the hotel are very nice with good food and service. We had the breakfast buffet each morning at the hotel and enjoyed the selection of food choices and atmosphere. We will be back in September 2011 to spend our 25th anniversary and are looking forward to staying at the Hotel Relais Bosquet again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: cvkevents
Reviews.Content: Background: My husband and I are in our mid-late 20's and we are well traveled. I have visited Paris twice before, but this is the longest I have stayed in the city. We really enjoyed this boutique hotel. There is just something neat about a small hotel with personalized service! My husband and I arrived from London on the Eurostar and were able to check into our hotel in the afternoon. It was a quick walk from the Metro, but be prepared to haul your luggage! As for the hotel, we stayed in a Superior Room on the 2nd floor (one flight of stairs). Room 11. The room was spacious enough for my husband and I and had a view of the courtyard in between the two buildings. The bathroom has a separate room for the toilet and was spacious enough for two people to move around. Being Rick Steve's readers, we were given breakfast each morning and it was very good. My husband enjoyed the coffee and the breakfast was filling. My only recommendation would be a rotation of items offered. The same food was a bit monotonous after the third day. However, there were a few goodies that we were able to toss in our bags as snacks to get us through the day. Many thanks to the staff for the breakfast each morning! The staff was very nice, spoke English and French. I tried my best to use my four years of French from college, but it had been a few years, so they were patient with me. Room 11 isn't the easiest to say in French!! As for location, we LOVED it! We were very close to great markets with fresh bread, crepes, patisseries and restaurants. We were repeat visitors to a restaurant about two blocks away that offered outdoor seating and caulk board menus. We also enjoyed our walk over to the Eiffel Tower in the evenings and for sunrise on my birthday. Spectacular! I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends that have the money to stay here. In American dollars it was rather expensive, but made it well worth our trip!!

Reviews.Title: “great people/great location”
Reviews.Author: thomas6782
Reviews.Content: From: tadeeble@comcast.net To: Bertrand Lemoine Sent: Sunday, June 26, 2011 6:14 PM Subject: Re: Many thanks from Hotel Relais Bosquet ! bertrand, our stay at your hotel was terrific--we had a great time your staff was "the best" especially, Christian, was most helpful when i called him several times from the states to make last minute changes i tried my best to speak french, last time 29 years ago, and all of your staff were most patient and helped me with my pronunciation your location is the best! we look forward to staying with you again and will certainly recommend your hotel to friends again many thanks, tom, judy, and chris

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: AmboyGlenn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a vacation to France. We found this hotel to be exceprionally friendly and accomodating. Upon our arrival our room was not ready but they held our luggage so we could go out and explore and still got us checked in three hours prior to the stated check in time. Our room did indeed overlook the Eiffel Tower which made for some great night photos of the tower. We split our stay at the hotel with a week long barge trip in the middle. The hotel readily agreed to hold some of our luggage while we were gone so that we did not need to take it on the barge with us. They also accomodated us upon our return by having our room ready early so that we could change for our lunch at the Jules Verne. Our first room was small but comfortable and charming with the aforementioned Eiffel view. Our second room was significantly larger and still very charming. The hotel is well located and the staff, especially Fredricka, was both personable and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: deedeignan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the start of our French vacation. I would highly recommend this hotel- walking distance to everything- Eiffel Tower, boat trips, metro and right in the middle of a wonderful neighborhood, with great restaurants, coffee shops, cheese shops, meat shops - you get the picture. Rooms are nicely decorated, modern and clean. My only criticism is that we paid for 3 people (child) and the two beds were really on top of each other. I know rooms are small all over Paris but it would have been nice to have had a bigger room when paying for 3 people in a 2 bedroom room. I did not try breakfast as there were lots of great breakfast places and cafe's that I wanted to explore in the neighborhood for a fraction of hotel breakfast prices.

Reviews.Title: “What's Not To Like About Hotel Relais Bosquet”
Reviews.Author: Bulls76
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our recent eight night stay at the Hotel Relais Bosquet. What's not to like about the following: 1. Great, welcoming English speaking staff. 2. Clean comfortable room. (We booked a superior room which was of decent size.) 3. Anything you can think of within walking distance. (supermarket, liquor store, trendy restaurants, fruit stands, ice cream vendors, phone store,metro station, bus stop and of course, the not to be missed boulangeries (bakeries). 4. Great, safe upscale French neighborhood with wonderful shopping. A Starbucks is even close by if you miss that big morning cup of java. You will love taking a daily walk along Rue Cler and snacking on the go. Make sure that you dine one night at La Taverna, a gem of an Italian restaurant right up the street from the hotel. Overall, the Hotel Relais Bosquet is a perfect base from which to enjoy a memorable vacation in the city of lights.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for a sightseeing base”
Reviews.Author: MTW77
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Rick Steves' book and it was right on the money. Clean, comfortable, and quiet, in a great location. The staff was polite and helpful. Rooms are small as expected but not too tiny and the air conditioning was great on a hot day. Lots of good restaurants and transportation nearby, and of course, the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in the heart of a quintessential Parisian neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Bleeker79
Reviews.Content: Our experience at this hotel was a pleasant one. The hotels greatest asset is its location in the heart of the 7th arrondissement, which is the quitessental Parisian neighbourhood. Located within short walking distance to some of the best markets (Rue Cler), boutique shopping (Rue de Grenelle) and restaurants (Rue Saint Domonique), plus of course the cities landmarks, like the Eiffel Tour which is about a 300m walk from the hotels front door. The service we received upon our arrival we very pleasant. The staff were attentative, informative, friendly and very helpful. The hotel does offer a basic continental breakfast, but with so many boulongeries, patisseries, cafes and fruit stalls within 100m, you would be rewarded for skipping the hotel breakfast and seeing what the neighbourhood has to offer. You won't be disappointed... Like most 3 star Parisian hotel rooms, ours was quite small, although larger than others we have stayed in during provious visits to Paris. The rooms are a little dated, but are clean and tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: NQRose
Reviews.Content: Let's face it, Paris hotels are expensive. But Hotel Relais Bosquet provides good value for money - quiet rooms, great service, a good location, and good in-room facilities (iron and ironing board, tea and coffee-making facilities, bar fridge, bath). The rooms are small for two people, but that seems to be quite common in Paris. They are nonetheless very comfortable. The Rue Cler markets are just around the corner, there are plenty of cafes and restaurants, and supermarkets and laundrettes are nearby. We would very happily return.

Reviews.Title: “6th stay at relais bosquet”
Reviews.Author: 186419Alison
Reviews.Content: Just think this is the best hotel in paris for the money - don't even think about anywhere else. Our room on the 2nd floor was spacious (not sure what other reviewers think is small!) and no street noise. Well fitted out with mini bar and free tea and coffee; great breakfasts; staff wonderful with restaurants tips and bookings and travel advice. the area is fantastic with Rue Cler street stalls, shops and 5 mins to ecole militaire metro and a short walk to the Champ de Mars park around the Eiffel Tower. what more can you ask for??!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at a strategic location”
Reviews.Author: Moritz73
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in an excellent location in Paris. It is a 5 minute walk from a metro station, and a few steps away from the École Militaire and the Eiffel Tower. In fact, I could see the tip of the Eiffel Tower from my room. The room itself wasn't as small as hotel rooms in Paris often are, and nicely decorated. The bathroom was also very good. Service was more than correct. Although free WiFi was included, a computer with Internet is also available in the lobby. The breakfast (I don't remember whether it was included in my rate) was excellent, with good fresh fruit among other things. In summary, although not very cheap, I find Relais Bosquet highly recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Zoidberg_11
Reviews.Content: We are just coming to the end of our stay here. My (grown up) kids shared a room while I had one to myself. The rooms are small, but frankly, this was not a problem, as we were out of the hotel all day, every day. There are several places immediately down the road for breakfast if you prefer to eat out and watch the world go by. The staff on the desk were universally helpful, and the air-con coped with temperatures approaching 38'C. Given its location, cleanliness, and the efficiency of the staff, this is a real bargain. And the free wifi was very useful!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an even better location”
Reviews.Author: Rimma10
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful 3 night stay at the Hotel Relais Bosquet recently. The superior room was quite large and comfortable (by European standards) and well laid out. The view of the Eiffel tower from the room window can't be beat. The staff is incredibly helpful with any request you might have and the hotel is small and intimate enough that you feel like you are getting a true Parisian experience. The free high speed internet also makes it a great place to stay for either business or pleasure. I can't say enough good things about the hotel's location - within a 2 minute walk of a metro stop, a boulangerie, fruit market, restaurants, patisserie and anything else you might be looking for while you are in Paris. The neighborhood is quite safe too. I walked home late at night twice and felt quite at ease. I would stay here again next time I am in Paris (which is hopefully soon)...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: flabrit
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Relais Bosquet. The hotel is centrally located near the Eiffel Tower and is surrounded by shops and brasseries. The staff were very friendly and helpful (unlike most of the other Parisian service providers that we encountered) and the rooms were very comfortable and well appointed. We will definitely stay at this hotel during our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Burt1229
Reviews.Content: Room was perfect but even better was the help provided by the front desk. Location is great as the Rue Cler area is beautiful, also convenient to the Metro. We would stay here on any future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt Be Better”
Reviews.Author: itsj0nathan
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in a perfect location next to the rue cler. The rooms are suprisingly large for european standars and very clean. The blackout shutters are fantastic after a long day of walking throughout the city. Location is perfect, breakfast was delicious and staff were very helpful. Next time Im back in Paris I will definately stay here again. Dont forget to try the pastry shop at the corner, the most delicous fresh baked bread ever.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel and neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: shanson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and the location to the metro, restaurants, grocery stores, and the market at Rue de Cler was superb! We ate at Le Bosquet 2 nights for dinner and every morning for breakfast. Service was fantastic and the food was wonderful! And our dinner at La Taverna was wonderful homemade italian and was also delicious. We loved that these restaurants and many others were in walking distance from the hotel since we were always tired from sightseeing all day we didn't have go far for a wonderful dinner. There are many wonderful little shops on the Rue de Cler. The hotel staff was helpful and our room was nice too, decent sized room for Paris and it was very clean. We will stay here when we return next June!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: sarahvix
Reviews.Content: A fantastic location. Just around the corner from the Eiffel Tower and the lovely park area that surrounds it. Also on the street the hotel is on there are lovely cafes/bars/shops so in the evening you don't have to go far for a nice dinner followed by a stroll around the Eiffel Tower- lovely! It was a very small room but this is Paris so what else can you expect? Black out shutters were great. No noise from the outside but a little noisy inside as we were near the lift and other hotel guests seemed to enjoy chatting outside it - not hotel's fault though that people can be inconsiderate! Nice staff - some exceptionally helpful! All spoke good English. Guidebooks available in hotel as well which is useful. Good bathroom -small bath but still lovely to relax in after a day on your feet sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: PeterW63
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights (two adults and two teenagers) and had adjoining rooms. Rooms very clean and comfortable. They are a bit small but probably par for the course in central Paris. We enjoyed the location and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We ended up switching hotels”
Reviews.Author: cma5110
Reviews.Content: I hate to be the one adding a a review that does not recommend this hotel but I do rely on TripAdvisor reviews heavily and would like to share our experience. We were lucky enough to spend 10 nights in Paris and due to TripAdvisor reviews we booked this hotel for our entire stay. Since our stay was 10 nights, we made sure to book the largest room. Well unfortunately that room was very tight for our 3 suitcases and bags. There is just enough room to walk around the bed to the toilet which is not actually located in the same room as the sink and shower. Now, I do know that is very common in France but to Americans to walk across the room to wash your hands is a bit unappealing. Yes, the room darkening shades are a nice feature but there are some draw backs. You can sleep forever and not know what time it is unless you set your alarm clock (who wants to do on vacation!). And when you do sleep in later housekeeping keeps knocking on the door and actually once opened the door even though we had the privacy sign out. Lastly, you cannot control your own room temperature so when you close the room darkening shades no more fresh air is coming in and the room was very stuffy. Also, we did not find the bed comfortable. I continued to wake up with a bad back. We did pay for the breakfast and wish we did not. It was just breads, with no toaster, and some cheese and cold eggs. We did go to the cafe next door which had many pastries but can be a bit too heavy to have day after day. On to location. Yes it is great to be close the Eiffel Tower which we walked to frequently. In addition, we loved the restaurant Tribeca right around the corner. The waitstaff was great and food delicious. We went a few times!! The hotel is also close to Rue Saint Dominique which is a great avenue (has a Starbucks when you just need a little taste of home). A plus was free internet and good connection! However, since I had not been to France before we did not understand how important Left Bank and Right Bank position was. We were daily crossing over to the Right Bank where the Champs d'Elysee, Opera, Arc di Triomphe, and Sacre Couer are. So after four nights in this hotel we decided later in the day it was time to make a move to a hotel room that was larger, with a better bed, a more American style bathroom, individual room temp control, room service, American style breakfast, and most importantly, a location of the right bank. Since we were leaving later in the day we did get charged for another night since we did not give 24hrs notice but we did appreciate the staff not charging us the full price or the days we did not have breakfast, We were also packing so quickly that we forgot a few items in the desk and the staff thankfully held on to them for us! So when it comes down to it. Staff was great and helpful and for 10nights in Paris we needed a room that had some room! and on the Right Bank. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Paris”
Reviews.Author: awful_in_aqua86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner in late May and we were really happy with it. The room was bigger than we expected for a hotel in Paris and a close walk away from the Eiffel Tower. There was a metro station just down the road. Breakfast wasn't included in the price which was a bit of a downer, but there was an ok boulangerie just next-door. Bed was comfortable and the shower was great. The staff were friendly and helpful and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: KristinO
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights here last month. The hotel is very clean and the staff is very friendly. Rooms are quite nice, and spacious for Paris. The location is great - walking distance to many things, very near a metro stop, and with lots of cafes and restaurants around it. I found the bed a bit hard for my taste, but that was true in all the hotels in France we stayed in. The blackout shades were a nice treat for the afternoon jet-lag nap that was sorely needed our first day there. I would generally recommend skipping the expensive hotel breakfast and just go around the corner to the patisserie or a cafe. Overall, we had a really nice stay, and this is a great option in a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed a few years ago - very nice”
Reviews.Author: oxfordmark1
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner started here a few years ago. Such a nice hotel. Great location 5 minutes from the Tower so a nice walk at night to see it all lit up. I'm didn't use Trip Advisor back then and want somewhere to log my stays.TA doesn't go back that far so I have had to make up a date.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as previous times”
Reviews.Author: Couple025
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on 2 previous trips to Paris. They offered the standard double rooms with views of the Eiffel Tower for a double rate. When I booked the hotel in January I saw they asked an additional 30 euros for those rooms. I decided against paying that price and reserved a double room. When we arrived at the hotel they gave us the worst possible room on the ground floor next to the door with the annex which would have banged all night. I asked at check in to be on a higher floor but they said they were booked. When we complained about the ground floor room they moved us up 1 floor to a room that was fine. I do not understand why they gave us the worst room when we booked months in advance and stayed at the hotel twice before. Outside their front door they had the trip advisor rating so I can only imagine that they do not need the business so there is no reason to satisfy returning customers. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Milwaukee-Mike12
Reviews.Content: One of the best combinations of value, location, and service I've found in Europe. I loved being able to walk to the Eiffel Tour and being near the Rue Cler area and a Metro station. There are a lot of excellent restaurants nearby. Service would have been rated a 5 if they didn't forget our wakeup call on our last day. They also forgot to call another family member who was traveling with us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovif
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a European vacation that included a stay at this hotel while we were in Paris. We spent 4 very pleasant days at the hotel. The hotel is very well located - in a pleasant neighborhood, convenient to transportation, dining and sites, but at the same time it is peaceful and not in the middle of the big tourist blocks. It was nice to be able to get away from the congestion at the end of a busy day or evening. The room was comfortable and clean- a decent size particularly for Europe. The bathroom was a good size and there was good storage space with both a wardrobe and dresser. The staff were friendly and helpful. We did not have breakfast at the hotel so I can't comment on that aspect of the service. The hotel is comfortable, but not at all fancy. The lobby area is pretty simple. There are computers in the lobby, but were unable to access e-mail accounts through g-mail and aol on one of the computers and only were able to get aol on the other computer. I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and was pleased with my find. I would recommend it to other travelers who are looking for a comfortable, well located hotel. As others have said, if room size is important, stay in a superior room. We were in the superior room and the room size was fine for the 2 of us.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: BHLinCT
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel close to The Eiffel Tower and specifically chose this one because of the high ratings the staff received. We were not disappointed. The concierges could not have been friendlier or more helpful. They spoke excellent English (important for us as our French was very limited); provided worthwhile information on restaurants, tours, etc.; and booked our transit to/from CDG as well as arranging for several tours. The rest of the hotel lived up to our high expectations too. Our room was clean, well maintained and nicely decorated. Though it was somewhat small by U.S. standards, it was well laid out and didn't leave us feeling squeezed for space. Though this isn't as fancy a hotel, it lived up to it's high rating. We'd willingly return any time.

Reviews.Title: “Week to Remember”
Reviews.Author: SBG1957
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I took a spur-of-the-moment trip to Paris when her Spring Break plans fell through. We stayed on the sixth floor in a "room with a view" of the Eiffel Tower. It was a very special trip. She turned 22 while we were there; watched the Tower sparkle at midnight on her birthday. We loved the room and the location. The L'Ecole Militaire metro stop is right around the corner. Bought our daily baguette, cheese, and fruit at the Boulangerie, Fromagerie, and markets on Rue Cler, and felt like Parisiennes for a week. Enjoyed le petit dejeuner at the Hotel Relais Bosquet during our stay. Truly a wonderful trip that I will always treasure.

Reviews.Title: “It couldn't have been more perfect!”
Reviews.Author: willie92130
Reviews.Content: Everything we wanted and needed for 5 nights...spotlessly clean, refrigerator, coffee/tea maker, reading lights, 2 sinks, separate room for commode, washcloths provided, rolling black-out shades, ice machine, free wifi, view of Eiffel Tower from window. Each and every staff person with whom we came in contact was professional, kind and helpful. 10% discount with Rick Steve's book. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with clean, large room and friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: jackieput
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Relais Bosquet. This time we booked a superior room and it was fabulous. It was large, clean with a large closet that had shelves, a separate bathroom with 2 sinks and a shower/bath, then another small room for the toilet. The room was bright and cheerful. As before the staff was always helpful in finding restaurants, figuring out how to get to any location and making any necessary travel arrangements. Love this location as it's near so many good restaurants, patisserie and Rue Cler. An easy walk to the Eiffel Tower where you can enjoy a picnic in the park. It was nice to come back to a less crowded and hectic location after visiting some of the more well populated tourist areas. We will be returning to this hotel the next time we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, wonderful location, excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: SZENZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed this hotel. It was very clean and the blackout blinds were a huge bonus. The location was perfect, less than a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, close to the Metro, and off of a darling Parsian street with restaurants, bakeries, and much more. The concierge was extremely helpful with directions and recommendations for dining. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ChevyCamaro
Reviews.Content: Tonight is our last night of 13 nights, and we hate to leave! The staff was just stellar, and helped with reservations at restaurants when asked. We had a superior room, and it was everything we needed. Great climate control and the blackout shades let us sleep as long as we wanted without being awakened by daylight. The room was a good size by Parisian standards, and had a nice bath with a separate toilet compartment. The location is perfect, in the little Rue Cler neighborhood, near boulangeries/patisseries, and good restaurants, not to mention being a stone's throw from the Eiffel Tower. We can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: magshapiro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Relais Bosquet for 5 nights. The price like all Paris hotels is on the higher side but if you book online there is a discount offered. The staff speak English and are super helpful. Breakfast includes breads, cheese, cold cuts, cereals, butter, jam, yogurt, scrambled and soft boiled eggs (a full breakfast). If you book directly and mention Rick Steves, either breakfast is included (for two) or there is a 10% room discount offered. There are bistros nearby that serve adequate breakfast for less (but not a full breakfast). The rooms are very clean as are the bathrooms which are spacious with plenty of storage areas/space. The rooms are nicely maintained and the towels are changed daily. There is free wifi in the rooms and access to two computers in the lobby. Just down the street is the Rue Cler area with several bistros and one of the best gelaterias around-Amorino. Great flavors and you can sit inside or out. The Ecole Miliaire metro stop is about 5 minutes or less walk. We love to walk and you can get to the Louve, the Musee D'Orsay, etc in about 15 minutes walk. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: WeLove2TravelMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the end of March. This was our third trip to Paris, but our first time at this hotel, and we will stay here again on our next trip. The room was not large, but the available space is used well. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet, and we could see the top of the Eiffel tower from our window. The metro stop (Ecole Militaire) is close by and there is a wonderful patisserie next door. Anyone who has read Rick Steve's Paris guidebook knows about the rue Cler, and it is literally steps away. The staff at this hotel were always very kind and helpful. They do ask that you return your room key to them when you leave the hotel, but we found this to be true at most of the hotels we stayed at in both France and Spain as most of them have electronic keys which are probably expensive to replace. The one time we encountered someone who was not on duty when we left did ask us for our name before handing us our key. We would recommend this hotel without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: cm8dj6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of the Rue Cler & just around the corner from all your needs. Wonderful bakery, cheese shop, restaurants, grocery, Metro stop, etc. Very clean & modern, good (but expensive) breakfast buffet, quiet (black out blinds), free wifi, free safe, fridge, TV, coffee maker, robes, elevator & computers in lobby (though no printer, had to use the front desk to print boarding passes, etc.) Staff was pleasant but formal. One was a little curt with my niece when her key was misplaced. None of us liked that you had to hand in your key as you left the room. We kept forgetting and it was a pain. We had a fairly large suite with a cot for one night for my nephew & stayed a total of 3 nights. Niece had a very nice single on the same floor. Would definitely stay here again. Kind of expensive, but worth the price. Would highly recommend Cafe Constance which is a 10 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL RELAIS BOSQUET IS THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: kemorantes
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is wonderful! Walking 10 min to Eiffel ower, sceine river and a very safe upscale area one block from Rue Cler . The staff is exceptional and remember your requests and promptly take care of it. A must if this is your first time in Paris , is to arrange for the hotel to send, Ali the private driver, to meet you at the airport. It is worth the $75 euro for having a person meet you at the exit of baggage with your name on a sign, and navigate you thru the airport and take you to the hotel . He narrates the city along the way in perfect English. You can take a Taxi for $55 Euro back to the Airport. But, really a good value for less stress having someone meet you at the airport. Safer too. Frederika was outstanding at the hotel. She was always smiling and the staff were happy. Al the staff were terrific and speak fluent English. Very friendly. My husband made an email request for flowers to be in the room for my birthday. It was perfect! A dozen pink roses in a vase waiting for me. The room is good size by Europe standards. Very clean, great linens and large bath towels. High end soap and shampoo. Get the breakfast in the morning. It was delicious. Linen tables, pretty tea and coffee cups. Quality meets, cheese, outstanding bread, coffee tea, eggs. It was so good to wake up and go to breakfast in the hotel as it saved time looking for a place each morning. We needed to get early starts to the attractions that open generally at 9AM. here is a small refrigerator in the room. hairdryer and a separate water closet (toilet) . Get the supreme room for only a few euro more. It is bigger and very quiet hotel. Beds are quite firm but comfortable. When we return to Paris, this is the only place we would stay. What a great location. Close to Metro, bus and RER (Train stations) . The cost of transportation in Paris is outstanding and reasonable. The hotel is good value and we were 100% satisfied. Thank you to the other travelers before us, who posted their experience as this helped us to make the decision to book this hotel. Side note: Paris really is a friendly place to visit. We had heard that the people in paris were rude. I truly believe if you are a happy friendly and polite person, you get back what you give. I now understand that being polite when asking for something is to say please first then ask for what you want.....in America we say thank you at the end of a request, but in Paris, the people and the children are so polity. They are respectful of each other and the children say excuse me and thank you when asking for something. I had a wonderful experience at a bus stop. The bus we were on came to the end of the line and everyone had to get off and wait 5 min for the next bus. A very nice women waiting next to me smiled and I did too. SHe asked if I spoke French, I said very little and asked her if she spoke English. She said no, but tried to communicate that is was a beautiful sun today. Now the next bus arrives and our tickets should have transferred to continue on the next bus without paying. When the next bus came and we got on , the driver wanted to charge again. She saw we did not understand that we did not have to pay and she spoke in french to the driver to help us out telling him we don't have to pay. It was a transfer. That was the best experience ever. We love Paris! Can't wait to tell all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: riverpark10
Reviews.Content: We were at first a bit disappointed with our superior room - it seemed rather plain compared to the photos on their web site. But by the 2nd night of our 7 night stay, we were more than happy. The room was clean, the bed and pillows very comfortable, frige and coffee/tea setup in the room, and great blackout shades. The only noise we ever heard was when our next door neighbors knocked on their door or spoke loudly when arriving at their room. And the location is just perfect - 2 blocks to a Metro stop, 5 minute walk to the Bus #69 stop, 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, and 20-25 minute walk to all the major museums, Champs Elysees, Arc de Triomphe and Notre Dame. The staff was very pleaseant and helpful - directions to bus routes and Metro stops, restaurants and shops. Free computer/WiFi in the lobby, 15 euro breakfast which we skipped - excellent bakery just at the corner, grocery story 2 doors down, and lots of shopping/eating options in the Rue Cler a half block away. It was early April - when the A/C is never on - and a heat wave hit Paris. We returned to our room, sunburned and hot, and found the A/C blowing wonderful cool air! The rest of our stay the A/C stayed on, keeping us nice and cool in the unexpected heat. Restaurants we would recommend include the brand new Cafe Central that opened while we were there (corner of Rue Cler), the Cafe Bosquet (across the street), and La Billeboude and Le P'tit Troquet, both on Rue de l'Exposition about 3 blocks away. If we are lucky enough to return to Paris, we would definitely stay at the Bosquet again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: saebarrett
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at this hotel. The location is great, room clean, the staff very helpful, and had a very good night sleep. I will recommend this hotel to friend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Risuena
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time reviewing hotels based on location, price and service. I was extremely pleased with this hotel. The room was spacious as far as European hotel rooms go and it was extremely clean. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful with recommendations for dinner and tours. It is a quick walk to the Eiffel Tower and the river. This is a delicious bakery right next door and a wide away of cafes, restaurants, cheese, meat and wine shops just steps away. The hotel also provided free wifi and there were computers available for use in the lobby. This was a wonderful location and hotel and I plan on staying there again, next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Parisian Hotel in 7e”
Reviews.Author: psbradys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of a 2+ week business trip in Europe, so we were looking for some quiet relaxation. This hotel was one of the better ones we have stayed at in Paris. Hotel staff very nice and helpful. The room was spacious for Parisian standards and bathroom was good including the shower. We liked the Rue Cler area, definitely a fun place for foodies. There's a great boulangerie, Pain d'Epis, around the corner on Avenue Bosquet and we picked up breads and quiches there during the 3 days. Two grocery stores nearby and little fridge in the room added to the comfort of our stay. February is a little cold and grey in Paris, but we enjoyed taking it easy. Cafe Roussillon was a nice spot for coffee and good bar. We had the "steak for 2" (chateaubriand) one night and was delighted with it. Visited Rodin museum which is nearby. Overall Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value”
Reviews.Author: JJudy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my daughter in March 2011. The location is excellent, right near the Rue Cler, which has great shops and cafes and close to the Ecole Militaire metro stop. The staff at the hotel was friendly, the room was very clean with a large bathroom, and the price was reasonable. Outside the hotel was a little noisy at night. I recommend the hotel as a comfortable, if not luxurious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “smashing hotel”
Reviews.Author: ishmaelwhale
Reviews.Content: lovely clean rooms, pretty quiet considering it's location. the staff are friendly, helpful and speak excellent english. it's two minutes walk to the champs de mars, two minutes to a decent metro station, there are great cafes and bars right outside. really couldn't ask for more from what is a boutique hotel, really. if you want swimming, gyms, saunas etc then look elsewhere, but as a place to sleep, relax and plan your time in paris the bosquet can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great enough to recommend”
Reviews.Author: redcyclist
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five nights. At check-in, we were shown our room and I knew that it wasn't the one that I had booked- it was dated and small. So I inquired at the front desk and asked them about it and they confirmed it was the one I booked. So I logged onto the website and showed them that I had booked the superior room at that off season price and that it was the 153euro that it was being advertised. Their response was that prices change daily (never heard of this one) and that they were fully booked for the superior rooms. Then they offered to talk to the Manager about the situation- needless to say - I never got a response and ended up paying 153Euro on a standard room whereas I could have cancelled my reservation and rebooked the same room for 120Euro. I cannot recommend this hotel after this treatment. Positives: clean room, great location, blackout shades, location Negatives: poor handling of booking, breakfast at 15euro, small -dated room, no concierge service, expensive Po

Reviews.Title: “If I could give it six dots, I would!”
Reviews.Author: tripdenver
Reviews.Content: This was our THIRD stay at Relais Bosquet and it is perfect every time! This place is our go-to hotel in Paris now - it does EVERYTHING right! Very reasonable rates, terrific location near Rue Cler and Metro, nice clean rooms, generous breakfast, free WiFi and friendly staff (I will miss Frederika and Abdulnar.) Next door is one of the best bakeries in Paris. I also viewed one of their studio apartments around the corner - what a pretty place for a longer term stay! You will always be happy at Relais Bosquet- I wish I could live here!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: newberries
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location...easy walking distance from Tour Eiffel and Invalides and two blocks from Ecole Militaire Metro stop. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful...let us try out our French, but easily switched to English when necessary. Room was spotless and the bed was comfortable. Many amenities that we are used to in the US but don't always find in Europe...mini-fridge, in room safe, giant towels AND face cloths! We will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and stay here when we return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Usachan525
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is quaint in size but service is top notch and quality is good. We got upgraded to a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower and it was amazing to be able to lay on our bed and see the tower, best view ever. We also had our Rick Steves book and therefore got their buffet breakfast included in our stay, I would say it's not worth it to pay for, but included, it's nice to have. I still walked next door to this amazing pastry shop on the corner every morning, that's usually got a little line but worth it to grab some yummy pastries on the go. The hotel is located in a perfect area, safe and quiet, no night life if you're looking for that, but restaurants surround it so dinner is easy to find and the Metro is 5 min walk with the Eiffel Tower just a 10 min walk from hotel. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel to everyone planning on staying. We felt it was worth it because we booked early so locked in a really low rate. The only complaint my husband had was the bed quality, of course typical European style it's 2 full beds pushed together and he's a tall guy (6'4") so he didn't fit quite right and they aren't the most comfy beds but I didn't mind.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Gottago2011
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel with my family. We requested 2 rooms close together, one with a large bed and one with 2 twins. Our request was fulfilled perfectly and one of the rooms had a view of the Eiffel Tower - a real treat for a first visit to Paris. The rooms were clean and well appointed including towel warmers in the bathroom and a pants press in one of the rooms. The best feature might have been the electric window covers that you can put down at night for a great night's sleep! The location in the Rue Cler neighborhood is great. Close to Eiffel Tower, Metro stop and other museums etc. The staff is friendly and accommodating. A wonderful first experience in Paris! Would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jwalsh830
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Relais Bosquet for 5 nights in early March. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. The restaurant recommendations were right on. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet each morning and it was a special treat to wake up to with a wide array of choices and great service. Our room was very clean and quiet and we expecially liked the window darkening shades that helped us to adapt to the time change very well. We would highly recommend the Hotel Relais Bosquet and would definitely stay there on return trips to Paris. The neighborhood offers everything from good restaurants to nice cafes to excellent transportation connections. An outstanding stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a quiet location.”
Reviews.Author: SouthgateFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in March 2011 for €165 per night, the room was at the back overlooking the courtyard. The room was big enough, although not huge. The bathroom was fine, the shower was effective and reliable. The staff were all charming and helpful. The bed was comfortable and we slept late with the shutters down. The area is quiet at the weekend, but has a number of good local restaurants, we ate in the Restaurant Mariette and La Billebaude both of which were excellent. There is also the Cafe du Marche at the end of the road which was the best value bar/cafe/restaurant that we found in Paris, breakfast (Croissant/Coffee/Juice) for €5.50 is fine if you don't want the €15 hotel buffet. You can easily walk to the Eiffel Tower or the Musee D'Orsay from here, and in fact we walked to most places in preference to taking the Metro. All in all it made for an good base for a city break and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A gem near the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: retepSF
Reviews.Content: Hotel Relais Bosquet is a fantastic hotel in a great location. Located near the Eiffel Tower, it is situated in a wonderful Parisian neighborhood. It is steps from Rue Cler which has the most wonderful markets and food options. The hotel is excellent with clean rooms, excellent service, and is a great value. The area is quiet but close to transportation and some excellent bistros (e.g. Fontaine de Mars, L'ami Jean, Le Petit Troquet)

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: KML1946
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful Boutique Hotel in central Paris with a view of the Eiffel Tower. Our room was lovely, pretty & clean. The bathroom was modern with double sinks, not large but more than adequate. The location is perfect with many restaurants, shops, grocers and access to public transportation. The reception staff are helpful and willing to assist with any questions or difficulties you may have. The only difficulty we had was with a couple of taxi drivers who weren't the most pleasant, that has no reflection on the hotel. We look forward to visiting Paris again and wouldn't think of stayling anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “My son's favourite hotel over the course of our entire European holiday”
Reviews.Author: SJCBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for our family of four including our 12 and 14 year old children. The hotel was comfortable and really well-located. The service was efficient and friendly and the breakast was a really lovely french experience. We would definitely recommend to other travellers to Paris. Positives - in the midst of the market stalls, bakeries and cafe's on the Rue Cler, easy walk to Eiffel Tower, close to Metros, comfortable bed, good service. Negatives - Nothing of note for your average traveller. Having said that we did have an interesting experience on our first night when the fire alarm went off whilst we were fast asleep. We had left the doors to both apartments open for easy access between the rooms and locked the external hall door that enclosed our 2 apartments. In our disoriented and anxious states we were unable to unlock this external door (a lock that we would normally have negotiated quite easily) and were convinced we were going to have to exit through the windows (several floors up). We did eventually unlock the door but were not given an explanation for the fire alarm or any sort of apology.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to my hopes!”
Reviews.Author: arezzo1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading trip advisor reviews. The location is perfect, and Rue Cler on New Year's Eve was a fantastic place to be,hustle, bustle, wonderful foods, flowers etc. everywhere. There is also just about the best cheese shop in France right across the street from the hotel as well as a Master Bakery on the corner. I had booked two rooms at separate times and the receptionist made some considerable effort on our arrival (this was new years eve) to rearrange his room plans to enable all of us to be on the same floor, the 6th in the front building. We got a room with a view too. The rooms, especially the bathrooms are a little tired but I thought this hotel was far better than other small French hotels that I have stayed in. The free wifi was an added bonus and we could mostly get that in our rooms, via routers on each floor. The rooms were clean and I had not expected tea/coffee making equip, iron/ironing board and very good toiletries in a 3* hotel. The quality of breakfast, with fresh orange juice was good. Contrary to a previous reviewer we found many local restaurants and we ate so well for considerable less than expected. 25 euros for a 4 course meal including duck breast etc. is good value. They also allowed us a late checkout., would I stay again,,, I can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Ok.....Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: annie-katie
Reviews.Content: I booked a standard room here following the glowing reviews on trip advisor .I have to say I was rather underwhelmed. Arriving at 8.30pm, I was shown to room 8 on the ground floor which was unbearably hot..A second room was just as hot. After much insistence on my part, and reluctance on the part of the receptionist, I was finally moved to a cooler room. Not a great start after a long tiring day. All of the rooms I saw were small. I accept this as the norm in any capital city. However they were also looking tired and dated. A very basic 3 star standard in my opinion, and although I received a special internet rate of 144 euros per night room only, I felt this was not particularly good value, The area is quite smart, but unlike other reviewers, I do not agree that there are good restaurants nearby. You will not find a cosy,proper french bistro . I ate out twice , and the food was very average( and expensive). Plenty of lively cafe bars though! IN A NUTSHELL; Pros.Clean.2 minute walk to metro Ecole Militaire. Electric blinds on windows. Free internet in lobby. Close to great bakery. Cons. Basic stuffy rooms. Poor shower water pressure. Poor sound proofing (take ear plugs if a light sleeper!)

Reviews.Title: “Remains Excellent”
Reviews.Author: never2late
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel Bosquet and it continues to be an excellent small hotel situated in a pleasant and convenient neighbourhood. Comfortable and clean. Our only criticism is that we felt they should offer a rate including breakfast - otherwise the local bakeries are too good and cheap for them to compete!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't have had it any other way.”
Reviews.Author: suyeda
Reviews.Content: A cliff notes version for those who are in a hurry to book a hotel in Paris, France: Pros: Clean, friendly staff (English/French/I'm sure other language speaking), free wi-fi and computers in lobby, quiet, ~5 minute walk from Eiffel Tower, ~3 minute walk to Ecole Militare metro station, many grocery stores nearby to save money and eat in hotel (sandwhiches, cup noodles, cereal, etc etc), several cute boutiques, bakeries, and restaurants, literally right around the corner from the Rue Cler which is filled with cafes, restaurants, boutiques, little bookstores, and much more. Cons: The double bed was two single beds put together and questionable method in regards to leaving/picking up in lobby. I will go into more detail about this subject later in my review. In a little more detail of my 3 night/4 day stay at Hotel Relais Bosquet Paris: Upon arrival, we were welcomed and greeted by a friendly staff. We arrived early, but the room was ready to go. As you may already know or have read, a lot of the hotels/apartments/etc are generally small in comparison to what we are used to in the states, but my girlfriend and I found that Hotel Relais Bosquet Paris accommodations, in regards to size, was more than enough. Large double bed (two (2) single beds put together), large and spacious shower/bath and bathroom sink. Hair dyer, iron, television (with several stations in many different languages), mini bar, and electric shade to cover the bright sun from those days you want to lounge around. After you receive your key, you'll have been told by the staff that they would appreciate (and it would be ideal) if you dropped off your key every time you decide to depart from the hotel. While I understand that this is probably for security reasons and to make our experiences more personal with the Hotel Relais Bosquet Paris staff, but there were times when I arrived at the hotel and asked for my room key (from a staff member who I have never seen there) and they just gave it to me. No questions about who I was and such. Now I understand that this would be acceptable if the person I had given my key to was there, but I had never seen this staff member before and he was more than willing to just give me my key. Maybe there is something behind the scenes that I didn't know about that helped them identify us and our rooms, but it made me feel a little uncomfortable at the idea anyone could ask for my room key and get it. Hopefully, the manager/owner of Hotel Relais Bosquet Paris will read my review and address this to clear up any confusion/misunderstandings I have. As far as location, this hotel is perfectly located (in my opinion). While it is not in central Paris, it is only a short walk (~2-5 minutes) to the Ecole Militare metro stop. There are a number of restaurants near by, which all vary in cuisine (French, Italian, Japanese, Chinese, Vietnamese, and more). Don't want to eat out all the time? There is a small, quiet grocery store just a few buildings down from your hotel. Is that closed? Doesn't have what you're looking for? There is a larger grocery store right near the Ecole Militare metro stop. Need money? There are several banks nearby including Bank of America's sister bank, BNP, which is great for those who bank with BoA. No international fee of 1%-3% every time you withdraw money (ideal way of getting money -- don't use those conversion places unless it's an emergency). Also, the Eiffel Tower and the nearby park is a very short (~5 minute) walk away. It was nice to step out of the hotel, step into the bakery at the corner and buy a baguette from the friendly of Boulangerie Artisanale, and then take a stroll in the park towards the Eiffel Tower. Sit down and just admire the beautiful monument at night or just people watch during the day. Don't forget to leave time to visit the Rue Cler that's right around the corner. Many cafes, restaurants, little shops (bookstores, shoes, chocolate, macaroons, jewelery, etc), and much more. Busy throughout the week, except Mondays where it is a little slower. I highly recommend this to anyone looking to visit Paris in the near future. Not only do you have easy access to the metro stop (order a "carnet" if you plan on using it often), but you get to experience a more Parisian lifestyle (aside from being in a hotel). If you have any questions regarding nearby attractions or anything else about the hotel, feel free to drop me a message. I hope you just as an enjoyable stay in Paris and at Hotel Relais Bosquet Paris as my girlfriend and I did.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with view of Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: BobO1966
Reviews.Content: We spent Chistmas and New Years 2011 at this beautiful boutique hotel. The staff were wonderful and our room was great - larger than expected and a large bathroom. Convenient to the Metro and bus routes. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JuttaHeider
Reviews.Content: My 8 year old son and I stayed here for a week in Dec 10. We loved every minute of it. 2 minutes walking distance from the metro, 1 min to rue cler with lovely restaurants and shops and only a short walking distance from the Eiffel Tower. who would want to stay anywhere else? The room was clean, bed nice and firm and the staff very friendly. We had breakfast at the hotel every morning as it was very convenient and inexpensive, especially when you consider that an 8 year old is more than happy with cornflakes and there is not much point taking him out for fancy breakfast every morning to a cafe. Good selection of jams, meats, cheeses, yoghurts and eggs, of course croissants and bread rolls. I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best in the Seventh”
Reviews.Author: THOMASWILLIAMS
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Rlais Bosquet. A great value in a godd neighborhood.All the staff were very well informed and helpful (knowing the bus alternative route for a Metro destination that has more to look at). And did I mention friendly? It's a block to the Ecole Militaire Metro and half a dozen busses to everywhere in teh city pass by every few minutes. Or walk over to the Tower on the hour. This is the best hotel from our eight visits to Paris. Tom

Reviews.Title: “Could not have picked a more perfect hotel for our time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: noworries1981
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Relais Bosquet. It was a lovely hotel, the staff was very kind, everyone spoke English fluently, they had two computers in the lobby for free use, free wifi, and several cafes, restaurants, and open air markets and shops one block away. The metro station was very close (3 blocks) and I could see the top of the Eiffel Tower from my bed! Easy walking to all the hot tourist spots, but not in a overly touristy area. But the best part was the bakery 3 doors down. AMAZING. We ate croissants twice a day. Delicious. We could not have picked a more perfect hotel. We were stranded in Paris for 3 extra days due to the snow storm that paralyzed Europe this Christmas. Hotel rooms were sparse throughout the city, and we were so fortunate that they were able to rebook us for 3 extra nights at a lower rate. A very nice treat to a very stressful and frustrating travel situation.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: lika_28
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December 2010 for four nights. The hotel We arrived in the early evening on the first day and check-in was smooth and the room was lovely. We were in a superior room (room 53) on the fifth floor. The room was much more spacious than I ever would have imagined for Paris and we could see the Eiffel Tower from our window. The road is quiet so no traffic noise and for those who like complete darkness (and I do mean complete darkness!) the electric black-out blinds were amazing, personally the complete darkness in an unfamiliar room didn't suit me but the curtains did a brilliant job of blocking out the light. The guidebook in the room was a nice bonus for those who weren't prepared with guidebooks. The bathroom was lovely with his and hers sinks and a nice set of toiletries and slippers to use. The hotel offers free wi-fi access which I found really useful (although there is internet access in the lobby) and a nice bonus as many hotels are all too keen to charge for it. The staff were all lovely with excellent English and were only too happy to help, whether it was recommending a restaurant on our first night or calling us a taxi on our departure, they were brilliant. The hote also offers a left luggage facility which allowed us to enjoy a full last day in Paris without worrying about dragging stuff round. Unfortunately I can't comment on breakfast though as we didn't try it. The location The hotel is fantastically located on a quiet street which leads onto Rue Cler with its restaurants and markets. The hotel is only minutes away from the Eiffel Tower and between two different Metro lines. The hotel is surrounded by restaurants and only minutes away from a supermarket, with a bakery selling fresh bread and pastries right on the corner. Everything that you could possibly need is nearby. Could not recommend the hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, great location and excellent room.”
Reviews.Author: John_Henry1975
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Well decorated room with excellent electric roller blinds that meant you had no idea what time of the day it was. Great service from the front desk. Didn't eat there as the place is surrounded by cafes. Shower could have been better and there was a faint cheesy smell - i did look for cheese but couldn't find any!

Reviews.Title: “reasonably priced hotel in lovely 7th arrondissement”
Reviews.Author: BillHandBeckyS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights (18-22Nov2010) in this Rick Steves-recommended three star hotel located only blocks from the Eiffel Tower. Our comfortable and clean room two floors above ground level was the larger of two “double” sizes offered in the hotel, with two twin beds, mini-bar, room safe, bathroom with dual sinks and tub/shower combination and a closet separate from the bathroom containing the toilet. The room was very reasonably priced in off-season November, particularly when combined with a free breakfast deal obtained by mentioning Rick Steves’ name when booking. The buffet breakfast, available in a large public room, was English or American “style” with scrambled eggs, sausage, cereal, fruits, and juices in addition to the traditional French breads/rolls and coffee. Vacated dining tables were quickly cleaned and place settings replaced by the hotel staff. The hotel had a small elevator for schlepping suitcases, a “common” room near the front desk with several computer terminals providing internet access, an effective housekeeping staff that kept our room spotless and bathroom sundries replenished, and a welcoming and helpful, English-speaking, “front desk” staff. If there was one small flaw in this fine hotel, it was that one could easily hear hallway conversations, knocks on doors, etc., through the doors into the rooms. Fortunately for us, neighbors on our floor were quiet. In light of less than glowing comments in TripAdvisor about other similarly priced hotels, Hotel Relais Bosquet seems to be a true “find.”

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: LouTGA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Relais Bosquet many times. It is a nice hotel with friendly staff in a very good location. It is convenient to the Metro, and is located in a pleasant neighborhood near the Eifel Tower. It is not an ultra-modern international hotel with "everything, but nothing": it has French character and a few quirks, but it meets my needs very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: ihearttravel247
Reviews.Content: We first found this hotel in 2005 and have been back every year since. Similar to previous review, we discovered they have apartments and since 2008 have stayed in their one bedroom studio. It is located only one block from the hotel and reception. We've stayed in this apartment anywhere from 3 to 7 nights. It has a computer which is great to check your email (but you can't download your pictures from your camera). The kitchen had all the dishes/cutlery and washing machine also. They only clean it every 3-days buts give you plenty of towels. The murphy beds (fold up to the wall) are a great use of space. The TV and DVD player is great (but you need to get movies from europe since they are in a different zone). The shower area with sink is small and water pressure is just okay. We love this area and the proximity to Rue Cler. Subway only 2 blocks away. The best bakery is at the corner near the hotel reception. We will be returning again in 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, quaint rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Jacq_Nai
Reviews.Content: We just spent our first night here and the service and location is really excellent. When we checked in, we were greeted by the really friendly and helpful staff here. While the room was a little small, it gave a very homely feel. What we love about this hotel is its location. It's never too far away from the main attractions in Paris! It's near the supermarket, metro, Eiffel tower. Oh yes, the staff also gave us a room which gave us a view of Eiffel tower even though we didn't request for it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! Quiet and close to Eiffel Tour.”
Reviews.Author: erebec11
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a wonderful part of Paris. Located away from the busy tourist areas, but within a ten minute walk to the Eiffel Tour. Close to cafes, markets, shops and restaurants...an area heavy with locals. Hotel Bosquet has a gorgeous lobby and a complementery breakfast. They offer free tickets to the Lovure or a boat ride on the Seine, and discounted tickets to the Palace of Versailles and top of the Eiffel Tour. They even brought us a bottle of champagne because they had a technician checking the appliances, and he wasn't finished at the time we arrived. In addition to their suites, the hotel also offers apartments for your stay. The apartments make you feel like a true Parisian and are fully furnished and spacious. They also include a washer/dryer which is nice for travelers staying a while. We thoroughly enjoyed the apartments and will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “HRB Apt - Perfect In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: 2Pugbabies
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I chose this hotel after researching for weeks where to stay ; and we are so glad we did! When looking at their website we noticed that they offered an apt and several studios. The 1 bedroom apt was perfect for the 9 days we were there.
