It had everything that we needed; washer/dryer, small kitchen with anything you needed, tv, computer in the apt, large outside patio (though it was too cold to use) and plenty of room. The maid comes every three days to change sheets and towels and clean the bathroom, and I believe vacuum. That was perfect for us.The apt is located right down from the hotel, plenty of restaurants in easy walking distance, Ecole Militaire metro stop around the corner, Rue Cler two streets over, and numerous markets to pick up items for quick meals. It couldn't of been in a better location, it was safe for two women to be out late at night and was a very quiet neighborhood. The staff was excellent!! They helped us with any questions we had, booked dinners for us and arranged our transfers. After this stay we will only do apts, we saved a lot by not having to eat out every meal, especially with so many food markets close by. On Rue Cler we had the butcher, fish-person (?), fresh vegetables, bakery, cheeses, pastries and even fresh flowers. This was especially helpful when we had come back from long day trips and all we wanted was a hot shower and a soft bed. I would highly recommend to anyone to consider this if staying more than a couple of days. If we had any complaints at all it would be with the dishwasher. Several of the dishes and pots and pans had to be rewashed before use, it wasn't as though there was food left on them, but they had a slight filmy feeling to them. We noticed the same problem when we had put dishes in the dishwasher. I don't know if it was the detergent or that the machine did not do a good enough job. You can't go wrong with staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Christian”
Reviews.Author: tak3
Reviews.Content: There has been many positive reviews about this hotel, so I do not have to reiterate the obvious. For those of you who haven't seen Christian, here's his picture. He was the one I had contact with the most, from confirming my reservation, his offer to book restaurants before my arrival, to checking me in. His english is very fluent, and is very professional in his mannerism. Then there's the bakery next door, Pain d'Epis, considered to be ranked #3 in Paris, by About.com:Paris Travel. There's always a lineup every time I walked past it, and almost all patrons spoke french, but the staff can speak english. This location has such a residential feel to it, no wonder Rick Steves recommended it, as Rick is well known to promote traveling as a temporary local. Yet food stores ( wine, cheese, bakery, grocery)( there's a bigger supermarket just next to the metro station at Ecole Militaire which is a 5 minute walk away) are so plentiful, as are eateries ( Rue Cler, Rue Grenelle, Rue St Dominique) it's an excellent way to live like a Parisian yet have many conveniences generally preferred by tourists. Highly recommended!.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent centrally located boutique hotel with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: evams01
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were always helpful no matter what you asked, they went out of their way to assist. They are wonderful. We have stayed at this hotel a number of times because we like it. There are different rooms. Some with views of the Eiffel Tower and others with none. Some of the rooms are larger some smaller. Naturally the smaller ones have the best views, so it is a compromise. The view or the size! The location is superb. It is on the West Bank. You can walk to the Seine, to the Eiffel Tower and Invalides. The Metro is also just around the corner. The trains are very efficient for when you travel further. What we liked best was the location, the boutique atmosphere and the service. There is really nothing that we would say we liked the least. We also believe the tariff was reasonable. You will not be disappointed. From a happy visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in a wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: garyp02
Reviews.Content: For travelers looking for a comfortable small hptel in a great neighborhood, the Relais Bosquet is a great find. The rooms are a bit on the small size but most rooms in Europe are smaller than in the U.S. The staff is warm, welcoming and extremely helpful. The location is great. A 5min. walk to the Metro 10 to the Eiffel Tower. The neighborhood has plenty of resturants in all price ranges, all with very good food. We spent 4 days here in early Sept and enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great service, very clean and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Trotamundo2010_10
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 5 night stay at this hotel. We had a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower. The room was a very good size and confortable. Very clean and service was excellent. The breakfact was also very good. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, specially Frederica. They arranged for our transportation when we arrived and departed and it was the best service that we ever had. We definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In a word, Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Like_to_travel_111
Reviews.Content: A wonderful small hotel in an excellent location. The Relais Bosquest is quiet, comfortable and charming. The location, right around the corner from rue Cler and minutes from the Eiffel Tower is ideal and the Metro is just minutes away. The staff is friendly, outgoing and efficient. Breakfast is excellent, plentiful, and free if you mention Rick Steves - a great value. I don't see how you could do much better than this. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: Hadesz
Reviews.Content: I keep saying I'll write a review of the hotel I've stayed, but I never seem to get a chance to do it. This time I just feel it's my obligation to do it. By far this hotel has the friendliest staff I've come across in any other hotel I've been. There is nothing they can't do for you, and they allways do it with a smile! The hotel is located what is for me the best and handiest place in Paris, safe, quiet and very well located, metro station right around the corner, the Eiffel tower just a 10 min walk, and around the corner a pedestrian street full of small shops and a supermarket with gorgeous food, and lots of restaurants to chose from. The breakfast is lovely and well worth the 13€, lots of different bits to choose from (the mini Pain of chocolat and mini baggettes are to die for!) if something I missed was proper coffe, not mad into that filtered americano style coffee. Will I come back... You bet!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot, perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: franceabound
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely hotel mid September with my husband. Lucky enough to be in Paris to celebrate my 50th. Had wanted to stay here on a previous visit to Paris but it was unfortuantely booked out so this time we made sure to book early. Its easy to see why its booked up pretty quickly - LOCATION for starters, its in a fantastic spot. Around the corner are wonderful cafes, irrestible shops and just a little bit further the magnificent Eiffel Tower. But to top it all off the hotel is very good, cannot fault it. The staff at the desk are so friendly and helpful. It all helped make our trip truly fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rue Cler location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: RoeTravelers
Reviews.Content: This small hotel has it all, a location half a block from rue Cler with its restaurants and shops, a very helpful english speaking staff, very quiet rooms, with excellent beds, full bathrooms, and room darkening electric shades. The breakfast is excellent, as well! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Alex99998
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Relais Bosquet. The room was perfect (with a view of the Eiffel Tower) and the staff was friendly and attentive. Easy walking distance to many sites in Paris and a very short walk to the Metro. Next time I go to Paris this would be my first choice

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel..... Excellent Location.....Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: music47
Reviews.Content: We were very, very pleased with our stay at the hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable, nicely decorated, with well-appointed bathrooms. Christian, at the front desk, was extremely helpful in suggesting wonderful restaurants, and was so patient in answering all our questions. He also gave us free passes for the Louvre Museum. An excellent breakfast, including eggs, cheeses and meats. It was the only hotel we stayed at during our 3 weeks in France that served pain au chocolat (and they don't ration the croissants and pain au chocolat). The free wireless was a plus, and they also had computers set up in the lobby. We would highly recommend this hotel. It was a wonderful experience to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel near Rue Cler”
Reviews.Author: katypaty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights and were very happy with our choice. My husband and I were traveling with another couple and loved the area. We were near the metro, bus stop and the charming Rue Cler with nice restaurants and stores. We were also close to the Eiffel Tower. We walked all over the city from our hotel. While the rooms are not luxurious, they had everything we needed including a refrigerator. Breakfast included both scrambled eggs, and hard boiled eggs. (not many hotels include eggs I heard) The staff was friendly and helpful at all times. There were computers available for no charge in the lobby as well. My only complaint or recommendation would be not to be on the first floor over the kitchen. While not horrible, I could hear the activity early in the morning when they were setting up for breakfast. It woke me up a few times and made it difficult to go back to sleep. We prefer small hotels with a cozy atmosphere and the Hotel Relais Bosquet did not disappoint us! A great value in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay while in Paris - we will return”
Reviews.Author: srf41
Reviews.Content: We are experienced travelers and have been to Paris many times. Relais Bosquet is certainly the Hotel we will return to the next time. The location is excellent, the staff friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating. The Hotel is clean and the rooms of a good size and very comfortable - Bathrooms and showers are great. The free wireless is a plus. Breakfasts were well set up - pleasant atmosphere and good selection. Can't say enough positive things about this Hotel. Certainly an outstanding value in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “J'adore Paris!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBeachbum
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with friendly, (english-speaking) service. We can't wait to go back. The neighborhood is lovely, with many eating and shopping opportunities. Great breakfast. So good, in fact, I hesitate to share! And the blackout shades were divine! Five minutes from the metro and 10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower make it a truly great location as well. Learn a little French, the locals will love you! Paris is a beautiful city. Only one warning for the "shy" Americans: pull the curtain closed in the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Parisian neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: agrofor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated in the 7eme and Rue Cler neighborhood. The front desk staff was great and very helpful. The room was very clean and well appointed. Everything is an easy walk. We preferred the buses to the metro-fun way to view all the architecture and get a flavor for the different areas. There are several restaurants close by...do not miss Le Petite Cler! It was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silicon_Valley_Guy1
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in Paris (first visit) at Hotel Relais Bosquet. Located near the Eiffel Tower, it is off the main street near the pedestrian only zone of Rue Cler. It is also quite close the Ecole Militaire Metro station. This is a terrific hotel in a terrific location. The double room was spacious by European standards as was the bathroom. The bathroom had extra amenities which I noticed and appreciated. The room faced away from the street and was quiet enough that we could leave the windows open all night for the fresh air. We did not sign up for the breakfast option preferring instead to visit the cafes located quite close by on Rue Cler - all of which offered a French or American breakfast. The front desk spoke excellent English and was quite helpful to me on numerous occasions. There were 2 terminals in the front lobby providing free internet access on a first-come basis. In addition there was a mini-library of various travel guides for Paris. We also received 2 tickets for a 1 hour boat cruise on the Seine as part of the room package. We purchased one week passes on the Metro and having the Ecole Militaire station so close was very convenient. As for value for the money - the hotel is not cheap - but seemed to me to be generally in line with the cost of 3 star hotel in Paris. Definitely recommend if you want to stay near the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: Lizzypumpkin
Reviews.Content: We were 3 couples staying at Hotel Relais Bosquet and all of us loved it. The location is just steps away from the rue Cler and just a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower. Not far is Les Invalides , as well as the metro stop Ecole Militaire (although we prefered to use the buses, whereby getting better views of the city at the same time) The rooms were all bright, large enough and had been updated with lovely modern bathrooms. Nice toiletteries, hairdryers, etc. Great electric window blinds which really help keep out the noise from outside while still being able to keep the window open. Nice comfortable beds. Breakfast was a very nice buffet with cereals, yogurt, croissants, breads, jams, cheeses,ham, fruit, juice, plus scrambled or hard cooked eggs as well as sausages. Better than most of the breakfasts offered at the hotels. You can also go down on rue Cler and get an omellette or something else for breakfast. It was nice to have a couple of computer stations in the lobby for checking emails, as well as free wifi which worked in the rooms. Staff was always ready to answer any questions or make reservations. I would have no hesitation to recommend this hotel and will certainly stay here again when in Paris next.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jads8627
Reviews.Content: Everything we wanted and more. The room was clean and comfortable. The darkening shades were great. Had free WiFi in room. Bathroom was spacious with both a shower and tub. The staff were very helpful and accommodating. The breakfast was very good too, never got to try the bakery next door. Great location to Eiffel Tower. We love to walk so seeing all of Paris on foot is possible but told the Metro is nearby. Close to great restaurants too. Fun to walk the Rue Cler at night. Would highly recommend and return to on next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating Staff in a Priceless Location with Wonderful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: WarEagleHeMan
Reviews.Content: I suddenly changed my plans as I came into Paris as I was to change trains for a southbound journey and then return to Paris the next day. When I arrived in Paris, the weather was so alluring I decided to bag the southbound trip and arrive a day early at Hotel Relais Bosquet. Not only did they store my luggage while a room was readied for me, they allowed me to check into the hotel a day earlier than my reservation. Came back to the hotel after a two hour lunch and walk, and found they had put my luggage in the room with a view of the Eiffel Tower. Great breakfast each morning, no surprises. Staff is very helpful, friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: adriana005
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Definitely smaller but cute, The hotel staff is wonderful. They were so nice and very informative. The location is excellent. Only three blocks from a starbucks. The cafe next door is to die for. They are soooo good. A couple of doors down is a little grocery store. At the end of the block is Rue Cler street which offers cheese shops and cafes. The Eiffel Tower is literally 10 mins away by walking. We loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gourdon
Reviews.Content: Well located, just moments from the Metro and lots of little cafes, shops and restaurants. Hotel staff are welcoming and speak good English, place clean and tidy, and plenty of guide books to borrow in reception. Our room had aircon, electric window blinds, windows with double glazing so very quiet and dark to sleep well, bathroom had bath as well as shower, plenty of towels, hairdryer.. Mini bar with space in the fridge for your own bottles etc, kettle, tea/coffee/milk, iron and ironing board, plenty of storage, tv ...... everything you could want really!! 205 euros per night, no breakfast. Would recommend and go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with considerate, accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: Australian_couple32
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my fiancee in September 2010, for four nights in a superior room on the first floor. We were very happy with the stay. This was the best hotel we stayed in on our trip. The room was very clean, the bed was comfortable and a good size, the bathroom and TV were both large. There were some good extras, like free wifi access in the room, shutters to block out the light of the city at night, and free guest PC access in the lobby. The hotel is well located, within easy walking distance of a metro station (Ecole Militaire), with good access to amenities and eating out options. For sightseeing, it is close to the Eiffel Tower and reasonably close to the Invalides; for other attractions (eg the Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees, Grand Palais, Concorde, Louvre, Notre Dame) it is a bit of a walk, although if that concerns you, the Metro is easily accessible. Perhaps the best part was the service. The hotel staff were very helpful and very accommodating. All spoke English very well, and did not give the impression that they resented having to do so (unlike some other people we encountered on our Paris trip). The staff answered all our queries and were proactive in offering suggestions and in following things up with us. We would strongly recommend this hotel to anybody staying in Paris, and we will stay here again when we next visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Merci Beaucoup to the Staff at Hotel Relais Bosquet”
Reviews.Author: halfapairinpo
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed 7 nights at the Hotel Relais Bosquet. We had a Superior room and found it very comfortable during our stay. Our room had all the amenaties mentioned by other posters: great a/c, wireless internet connection, darkening shades (genius!), flat panel tv, coffee/tea service, nice bathroom (two sinks!), comfortable bed & a very nice breakfast every morning. We would like to extend a special "Thank you" to the front desk staff. My husband became quite ill during our stay and the staff arranged for a doctor to see him. We ended up going to the Emergency Room at Georges Pompidou Hospital via ambulance. It is pretty scary being so ill in a foreign country, but the hotel staff was gracious and caring which helped tremendously. We would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good value near the Eiffel Tower and close to all the Paris sights on your list.

Reviews.Title: “Anytime again”
Reviews.Author: HonzaCi
Reviews.Content: Great location, only minutes from Eiffel Tower, quiet, nice, adequately roomy. Free WiFi, free tickets to Louvre, staff arranged anything we asked for. Free tea and coffee in the room. Incredible sleep quality, total shutters, woke up very late in the morning ;-) Just avoid the nearby restaurant on the main street, name Le Champs de Mars, total tourist ripoff. Found other restaurants only when leaving ...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Paris....”
Reviews.Author: JEStrach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a superior room at Hotel Relais Bosquet Paris for two nights in late August 2010. We absolutely loved the hotel! Our room was perfect- a nice size, with a comfortable bed, very nice bathroom, quiet, modern decor and nice amenities (coffee pot, high end toiletries, iron, ironing board, safe, fridge, etc.). The airconditioning was extremely efficient and the location- a block from Rue Cler with all of it's food shops was very convenient. Most importantly, the staff was friendly and helpful. We look foward to returning there on our next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hendersonz
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the hotel in Paris for 5 nights from 16th August 2010, we loved it. The room was very clean and comfortable and the staff and service were excellent. We had not been to France before therefore we needed directions and guidance from the receptionist daily and they were always very accomodating and nothing was a problem for them.We had 2 other couples with us staying in 2 seperate other rooms and they also would highly recommend this hotel. The location is perfect and easy walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and to both the bus and the metro. We had their daily breakfast which was faultless, all in all a great experience and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint”
Reviews.Author: mbgregory
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel and will highly recommend. Rooms are quality plus, not lavish, but comfortable, clean and chic - Easy to find location, blocks from the Eiffel Tower. The Rue Cler is one block away and is loaded with pastry shops, fresh food markets, etc. As you exit hotel, turn left and there is a great pastry shop right on the corner. Front desk staff is more than helpful. The toilet is located separate from the shower/bath but not really a problem-it is in the room, right beside of the bed and then you cross the room to the sink and shower. Great room for napping after an overnite flight, as its equipped with room darkening shades-easy access to Metro too-I think the Paris Metro is hard to get familiar with initially, but once you get the hang of it-its more than manageable. Highly recommend the Batobus-which is a company that offers boat trips down the Seine. It stops at 8 Paris locations and you can hop-on and hop-off as you wish and a day pass is just 17 Euro per adult per day-great way to see the city without wandering the tunnels of the Metro!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Close to the Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: TravelFun1800
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here three nights for the last leg of our honeymoon and it was a very enjoyable hotel. The location was great and exactly what I wanted. You cant really be close to everything in Paris, you have to choose, and I really wanted to be near the Eiffel Tower. This hotel was just a few blocks and we spent every night at the Tower. It was very clean and the staff was polite. The bed/pillows were by far the most comfortable we had on our trip (we spent most of our time in Italy). And I thought the automatic blinds were neat :) Our room was fairly small, which is typical in Europe and we did not partake in breakfast. They also had computers in the lobby that were free to use which was really nice. A lovely stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...exceptional staff...well located...we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TXJoeGo
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel with a very attentive helpful staff. We were traveling with our two grandchildren, ages 11 & 14, their first trip to Paris and we wanted everything to be wonderful...and thanks to Hotel Relais Bosquet it was...thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesLeah
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel. My two grown daughters and I shared a three person room which was extremely clean, well thought out (toilet room was seperate from the bath/shower/sinks) quiet and perfectly located in the 7th district, within a very short walk to the Eiffel Tower. The front desk staff were really helpful, spoke perfect English and were obviously interested that we enjoyed our stay. There was also free wi-fi which worked perfectly and a programmable safe and a small fridge in the room. That summarizes the 'pros'. The only real 'con' was the housekeeping. We were quite late leaving the room each day, but I had to chase down towel and toilet paper one night and the following day, the bare minimum was done - trash emptied and beds made but again short one towel. This may be a result of us leaving after noon each day. However on the second to last day, a housekeeping manager came by to check on the room so it appears the hotel is aware of the problem there and is working on it. As I said already, the room was clean, just not stocked. Also, buy your snacks and water etc., as there are many stores in the area to purchase snacks, including healthy ones, and water, wine, beer etc. The prices for these items through the honor bar system border on the ridiculous by North American standards. The real plus point of this hotel is the location as it is half a block from one of the most interesting streets in Paris, namely the Rue Cler. On that street there are many good restaurants, fresh fruit/veg shops, a pharmacy, clothing shops etc. The best coffee in our opinion was at the one crepe shop - we went every morning! Big cups of cafe au lait! Breakfast at the hotel was very good, not just bakery products but scrambled eggs, great coffee, perfect croissants, cereal, yoghurt etc. Best of all, the breakfast went until 11AM which was rare in our experience. We often missed breakfast in other hotels because it is finished by 9am and we aren't early risers! Can't wait to go back to this hotel - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Spike012010
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights there on the recommendation of a friend and it turned out to be an excellent choice. We were very happy with everything; close to everything, priced right, comfortable, and quiet, Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: paola2789
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just come back from a long weekend in Paris, and we stayed at the Relais Bosquet . We chose the hotel after extensively researching the areas of Paris and reading hundreds of reviews on tripadvisor. Well, the Hotel is in between the Invalides and the Eiffel Tower; we actually walked all the way to Notre Dame as well (slow pace in under one hour, with several stops for pictures). The area is really nice (I wish I could afford to live there...). Rue de Champs de Mars has a few shops, a lovely bakery just one or two doors away from the hotel, a small supermarket abot 10 meters up the road, and a fascinating cheese shop opposite it. Pass the supermarket and you cross Rue Cler: packed with little restaurants, bars, a greengrocer and whatever you could wish for. The staff at the hotel were always polite, helpful and pleasant. Our room was fine for what we needed (I don't think we managed to spend more than 6-7 hours in a row in there!), with a wardrobe, table, TV, coffee and tea, kettle. The mattress was very comfortable (better than mine at home, according to husband!), and the room also has electric blinds, so even if you are a bit light-sensitive you can get a good sleep. On our arrival we also found a very handy map of Paris on the table, with all the landmarks clarly marked: a very thoughtful touch. The bathroom was spotless and every day it was replenished of shower gel, body lotion. They also provide a sewing kit, a shoe polisher, a nail file and a little vanity kit (make-up remover pads and cotton buds). The fridge was big enough to contain the bottles of water we bought, and more food can be stored in there. There was a safe, and the bedroom was on the inside courtyard, so we had the view of a tree in front of us. Metro stations: Ecole Militaire about three minutes away, Invalides about ten minutes. We ate in three different restaurants nearby, but the one we preferred was the Italian (Di Felice in Rue Grenelle): and that's saying something, as I am Italian and I don't normally enjoy italian food abroad... The area feels very safe, we never felt we had to look over our shoulders, not even walking around late at night. It is a brilliant location also as far as getting to it from CDG. Just get the blue line RER, stopt at St. Michel-Notre Dame, change to the yellow line RER, stop at the Invalides and get the lilac metro to Ecole Militaire. One hour and you are there. I am now trying to plan my second visit to Paris, and I will certainly be staying at the Relais Bosquet again! P.S.: I nearly forgot: you have free access to internet with the two computers in the reception area. Very good for checking what weather was going to be in England on our return (quite a misery, actually).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, value & staff”
Reviews.Author: Downiefamily5
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here a week this July. The Rue Cler neighborhood is wonderful and the hotel is a no-foolin 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. The rooms were a tad small, but clean and well appointed. The automatic blinds worked extremely well and the neighborhood is quiet at night. The gems of the hotel are the staff. Frederica and Christian made an incredible set of arrangements for us and provided outstanding advice when needed. We made a foolish mistake of leaving some valuables in the safe and the staff found a way to get it back to us in the States. How often do you think that would actually happen! The Rue Cler neighborhood is wonderful with outdoor cafes open and buzzing until almost midnight. We hop to get back to Paris and if we do you can be SURE we will stay at the Hotel Relais Bosquet.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JRPLAP
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on Rick Steves Paris 2010 guidebook and was not disappointed. His review was right on several points. The staff are very friendly and helpful and we had a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in downtown Paris.”
Reviews.Author: MSNY10968
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are small, but every possible need has been thought of. Best of all, there was a mini-bar fridge with plenty of room for guests to store their own food. The rooms are air conditioned. Our room opened onto a small courtyard, so it was sheltered from potential traffic noise and fumes (although Paris is also very quiet and lovely in early August). The hotel staff is truly warm and welcoming and helpful (an amazing contrast to the hotel we had stayed at in July). We found a very nice restaurant just across the street that was also very accommodating to our needs (the Cafe Bosquet). The hotel is also fairly close to the Eiffel Tower, the Invalides (Napoleon's tomb) and the Rodin Museum. The evening desk person even helped us arrange a group limo to the airport. I would definitely give this hotel an A+! They also have two computers available for guests to use and even one with (I think) an American keyboard. As it was August, we were able to find parking in the neighborhood the night we arrived (we returned the rental car the next day).

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: Travelalot2000
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Europe and we again stayed at the Hotel Relais Bouquet in Paris. This was the third time we have stayed there and it is always a great experience. The staff are simply fantastic. They provide helpful advice and never seem to find a request too hard. The rooms are great. Air conditioned, a boon in a hot Paris summer, and the widows have real blackout blinds. This means you can sleep in comfort and wake when you want to not when the sun shines through the often flimsy curtains in many hotels. Room size is more than adequate. Rooms have irons/ironing boards, safe, nice amenities and a tea and coffee tray. The hotel is wonderful value for money and we will be back again and again (we hope). Book directly with the hotel as they have good deals especially if you stay for a few nights. Not only is the hotel a nice place to stay it is located in a fantastic part of Paris. It is in the 6th, walking distance from the Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, the Seine etc and surrounded by great little restaurants and quirky Parisian shops. It is a few metres from Rue Cler (food street!) and a short walk to the Metro which gives you access to all of Paris. Next door is a wonderful bakery. The morning queues tell you how good it is. If you want to go a little further afield there are some classy restaurants in the 8th. We ate at the Tante Marguerite, a Bernard Loiseau restaurant in Rue Bourgogne. Good food and good value for money. A tip for shoppers, and who can go to Paris and not shop? The French Post Office provides a wonderful service to send goods back home and reduce the weight of your luggage. Airlines can be very unforgiving. For around 40 Euros you can send 7 kilos by air anywhere in the world. Smaller packages are less. This includes a self sealing box which you pick up at the Post Office. There is a post office just up the road from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Teens”
Reviews.Author: CLSTustin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel's separate apartment, which is only a block from the main hotel. Location is great - just a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower. Hotel staff was very friendly and helped us book transportation from the airport. They also made great recommendations for dinner nearby. Apartment is a great option for teens. It has a one bedroom, bathroom with washer & dryer, a kitchenette, and a living room with two separate murphy beds. There was also a computer with internet so the teens could check in with friends via email every night. We also enjoyed the private patio. Great experience and highly recommended establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: joal701
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend and found the hotel to be good value for the money. The location was very good, the staff was very french... (ie not so helpful). The cleaning was unfortunately not so good - we changed room once because of this. And we recommend to do a double check in the bathroom and under the beds. To summarize we would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a decent hotel in Paris for a good price and in a good neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: merrick_cj
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Room was spacious and comfortable with air conditioning. We got free breakfast each day by mentioning that we had the Rick Steves book. Front staff was extremely helpful, all spoke English, and helped us book a car from the airport, dinner reservations, and Moulin Rouge tickets. Wonderful location close to the Eiffel tower, although the Rue Cler was swarming with Americans with Rick Steves books. Great bakery next door as well that we got baguettes from each day for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: maruth
Reviews.Content: This little hotel worked perfectly for us. We were traveling with our 11 year old grandson who needed his own bed and space but didn't want to be totally on his own. We had an arrangement where we could lock an outer door and leave the two bedroom doors unlocked and so we had in effect connecting rooms and yet we all had privacy. The air conditioning worked very well. It was hot in Paris. The breakfasts were good. Clean. We loved the location right next to the Rue Cler (wonderful local Paris street) and 5 minutes to the Eiffel Tour.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great!”
Reviews.Author: UsaMktraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in June 2010 and it was great. The rooms were very clean and for us Americans, the AC worked great as well. The breakfast was very good and filling. Not a typical US breakfast, but we weren't there to do typical US things. We booked with the Rick Steves' reference and the breakfast was included. The room darkening shades were a great plus too, as the sun doesn't set until after 10:00 and still rises before 6. The hotel staff were extremely friendly too, especially Frederica! She helped us figure out the bus and metro system and was always very kind. This hotel is literally less than 5 minutes to the Eiffel Tower, but still very much in a local neighborhood. There is a great outdoor market behind the hotel with fresh everything. We were in Paris for four days and had dinner at the Eiffel Tower 2x. We toured through the day, took a 1-2 hour nap around 6:30 and then went to the market and bought stuff (Bread, wine, cheese, figs, chocolates, dried meats, etc) and ate in front of the tower around 9:30-10:00. The great thing was that the hotel was so close. You could easlily walk there and unwind. It was a great end to the day and one of the best things we remember from the trip! Also, the dinner only cost about 15-25 Euros and the FREE view of the tower at night is truly amazing! The hotel is in a relatively quiet area, but was still very convenient (by public transportation) to the main tourist sites. Also, the free WiFi was a great plus too. I would highly recommend this hotel! When we return to Paris, we would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Gracious staff, excellent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: ddg55
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Paris in June with my teenage daughter. The staff at the Hotel Relais Bosquet were consistently helpful, gracious, and kind. I found the room to be as described; it was comfortable, clean and quiet. (I particularly appreciated the room-darkening shade and air conditioning unit.) Although Parisian hotel rooms are not large by U.S. standards, this standard room with bath was perfectly adequate for two people and their luggage. Breakfast is very good (includes eggs and sausage in addition to the usual continental fare); there are two public computers with internet access in the lobby and a shelf of travel guides that previous guests have donated. The location is very convenient: Ecole Militaire is the nearest Metro stop (two short blocks away), and several good bus lines are close by. Rue Cler, just down the block, offers many choices for eating and shopping; a post office and two ATMs are there as well.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed here twice and would return - great location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: joyfultraveler52
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located and close to Rue Cler, the Eiffel Tower and a Metro stop. I've stayed here twice now and have been very happy both times. There are wonderful restaurants all around and it takes five minutes to walk to the Eiffel Tower. Their continental breakfast is very nice. There are a number of rooms with nice views of the Eiffel Tower!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: travellingtoasters
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while in Paris and it was good. We arrived early at 6am the first day in Paris and we could store our luggage at the hotel. We were offered a nice breakfast in the morning before heading off to the streets as we couldn't check in as yet. The hotel was close to transport and good walking distance to restaurants, shops and markets. Staff was always there to recommend a good restaurant or guide you in the right direction. There was a great bakery around the corner where every morning you would be able to smell the fresh bread. I think we ate something in there every day. The rooms was smaller than we expected however i believe this was the norm in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “This location made our trip special!”
Reviews.Author: Seattlepa
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from recommendations on this site, as well as from Rick Steves' book. It was a very good choice. First, we were extremely happy with the Rue de Cler area of town! We were close to many of the sites we wanted to see, not the least of which was the Eiffel Tower, which came to represent the the entire trip in our minds. After the trip was over, as we sat in the airport waiting to leave Paris, we "compared notes" and this location and the Tower were our favorite parts! The hotel was wonderful to stay at and the staff was marvelous! I asked for a view room, which we were able to get. That was perhaps a lucky break, but very much appreciated. I can't tell you how excited we were to see the Eiffel Tower from our room, especially the first time we saw it twinkle! We about fell out of the window! The room was always clean and wasn't overly small, we didn't think. I believe it has just been renovated, which was very nice. It was quite comfortable and we especially liked the small refrigerator in our room. The staff were extremely helpful, polite and friendly. Christian was especially helpful to us many times. We enjoyed the internet access in the lobby, the fact that we were close to the metro, the nearby restaurants which were all excellent and the market area (not to mention a fine bakery on the corner!). We were also fortunate that the weather was extremely cooperative. This was one of our favorite holidays ever.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: sillypuppy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Relais Bosquet Hotel for 2 nights and enjoyed it very much. Everything about the hotel is perfect: the location (proximity of a metro and train station); the surroundings (nice & clean, close to a restaurant/shopping area with many small specialty stores as well as cafes); the interior design of the lobby & rooms. The room itself was spotlessly clean with a wonderful view of the Eiffel tower. I especially liked the small hotel library with a wide range of tourist guides & maps available. Definitely worth recommending!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, friendly, relaxed, great location”
Reviews.Author: FernwehZurich
Reviews.Content: We also agonised over the many hotels in Paris, having been burnt on previous occasions with tiny little boxes. Certainly no regrets about booking this hotel! Frederica and the other staff are so helpful and friendly; the hotel has a relaxed atmosphere and the staff obviously believe in bending over backwards for their guests - the customer is still king here. Rooms were bigger than most in Paris and bathroom larger than most, and very clean. The blackout blinds were a treat. The bakery next door (closed Saturdays) leaves one drooling, really good quiches, breads, fruit tarts, etc. The Metro stop École Militaire is 5 mins'. walk away, the Eiffel Tower 10 mins. and we had a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower from the room. We booked a private airport transfer through the hotel and we had a delayed arrival due to the strike in France, but no problem, the driver patiently waited for us. All in all a wonderful time in Paris, thanks also to the hotel. We will be back in Paris in May next year, and will definitely book this hotel again, and recommend it wherever we can!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: RR_out_and_about_
Reviews.Content: My husband and I researched Paris hotels on Trip Advisor, finally deciding on Hotel Relais Bosquet. We were not disappointed. The location was perfect for sightseeing and the local restaurants/bakeries provided wonderful food. Our room had a view of the Eiffel Tower which sparkled at night. We were pleasantly surprised at the size of the room and bathroom as we had expected much smaller. The electronic blockout blinds ensured a good nights sleep. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: wOrldTrav39
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for the first time and we could not have been happier with our choice of this hotel. It is so obvious that they are committed to providing the best service possible. Everything about the hotel including location, view, accommodations, breakfast and internet access were first class. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and responsive to our requests. We asked for and received an Eiffel Tower view and it was amazing to see it our first night from our room and another night to walk the short distance to see the light show at 11 PM. The location is perfect for seeing the city since it is close to public transportation and easy walkig distance from the river. We returned our last day from a long, hot day of touristing to pick up our bags and they offered us cold water and restroom facilities in the lobby which was just what we needed. Then they helped us get transportation to our next stop. This hotel surpassed our highest expections! We do not hesitate to recommend it. It is extremely well run.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in everyway, well priced for conveniences.”
Reviews.Author: LinW
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel and are stay was wonderful. We had a large room on the 6th floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower. Breakfast was great too and Christain and other staff were friendly and helpful. Outstanding location- close to Rue Cler but quiet. Close to tower and metro station. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “didn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Living_my_dream_now
Reviews.Content: After agonising over the multitude of hotels on offer in Paris, and reading many reviews, I decided to book 3 nights at Hotel Relais. An advanced email request for an early check-in and views of the Eiffel Tower were granted effortlessly. We had a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower, which could be viewed when lying in bed. Beautiful when illuminated at night! Free internet use in the lobby was a winner for taking care of business at home, any time of the day. Our room was lovely, clean and very quiet with free coffee/tea making facilities (we frequented the cafes). We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as there are many cafes close nearby - one block from market street with shops (fresh fruit, cheese, bakery, souvenirs, supermarket) and cafes. Bakery right next door to hotel with the yummiest baguets for your picnic at one of the many parks. If you want to be close to the Eiffel Tower and the Seine where the cruises and sight seeing buses leave from, then you will love the location of Hotel Relais as only 10 minute walk. Hotel 2 blocks from Metro station Ecole Militaire. Reception is very helpful with booking tours, etc and providing suggestions for good cafes/restaurants to visit. Overall I rate this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfort and amenities”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaBellingham
Reviews.Content: Room was spacious and very clean and comfortable: prettily decorated with fine mattress and white bedding/duvet. New large flat screen TV with some stations in English, excellent closet space. Best of all: external blackout shades that worked with the touch of a remote. Two free computers available to guests, and lovely breakfast area with extensive and tasty selection. Staff very helpful and professional. The Rue Cler area is one that I would recommend highly: good services and restaurants for tourists and locals alike, and a feeling that we visitors shared the neighborhood with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - even better customer service!”
Reviews.Author: jrsygrl444
Reviews.Content: Trusted my Rick Steve's guidebook with recommendation and was not disappointed. This boutique hotel has a great location - walking distance to many areas but even nicer was the fabulous customer service. We felt like we were "coming home" each evening - Frederica was amazingly helpful with our plans and advice on how to navigate Paris. The entire staff was friendly and would inquire about our stay and offer assistance - we really enjoyed the young lady who worked in the cafe - she greeted us every morning with a big smile and wonderful coffee! The room was comfortable and nicely appointed - we enjoyed a great view of the Eiffel Tower and would watch the light show each night. With all of its benefits- the number one thing this hotel has going for it is the wonderful staff. Would definitely stay here again when back in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The best service and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tesswhitty
Reviews.Content: Hotel Relais-Bosquet had the friendliest people and they really went out of their way to accommodate and provide service, making reservations etc. etc. Perfect location, very quite facing the back yard, the rooms had everything you could wish for when you want a romantic hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: nwspitze
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I had a great stay at the Relais Bosquet. The hotel was just around the corner from Eiffel Tower and the staff was amazing. Great breakfast and it's right around the corner from Rue Cler and the weekend market.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, right by the Eiffel Tower.”
Reviews.Author: midway42
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five days and had a great experience. My sister and I had a deluxe room with, believe it or not, a view of the Eiffel Tower if you craned your neck just the right way out of the window. The location can't be beat: you are an 8-10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, right around the corner from Rue Cler, and 5 minutes from the nearest subway (Ecole Militaire). It's a bit of a busy part of town but that's good, it's a big city and things should be busy. The nights were peaceful and the hotel itself was quiet. The staff were wonderful, very accommodating and helpful with luggage, reservations, and messages. The rooms were clean and the buffet breakfast good for the price. Overall this was a good introduction to the city; I'd definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel with a touch of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Eddy022
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a small but nice about 10 minutes walk from the Eifel Tower in an area which typifies evrything Parisienne .It has a small breakfast area which serves a basic continental breakfast but we chose to eat at other nearby cafes which provided cheaper hot meals.It is surrounded by numerous cafes , bars and excellent restaraunts all of which are very affordable.The room was bigger than expected with a French style but the bathroom was smaller than we would have preferred.We did have a problem with the room safe which wouldn't lock and the TV which wouldn't fix into any English speaking channels. As neither could be immediately fixed the offered us another room.The hotel provided 2 free internet terminals in the foyer which was a bonus as many hotels don't provide these at all let alone free. There are bike hire stations scattered around the area which is handy to be able to familiriase ones self with the area. The Transit bus service and the subway are nearby ( 200 m) and we utilised both without any difficulty .The hop on / hop off bus service was only a 10 minute walk away and a must if you want to see a lot of Paris including all the Paris icons.The Palace of Versaille is a must see and you can get there very easily by train . Allow the whole day as there is much to see . We arranged with the hotel to book dinner on the Eifel Tower as a package and then to see Moulin Rouge - a world class must see cabaret. The staff were helpful in providing information but only if you enquired specifically about it.They were not forthcoming with any suggestions probably because of their lack of confidence in communicating in English. Ther are several similar hotels in this area but we found Hotel Relais Bosquet a cut above them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tahiti77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Relais-Bosquet for one week and had a fantastic time. The staff here are so helpful and kind. The rooms are very clean and large. We got the king bed superior room The breakfast was outstanding. the hotel is in a great location. You have Bakery, ice cream, restrurants, a market place with all the shopping you need. And the metro,atm bicycles, Eiffel Tower and so many atractions in walking distance. We are going to book again here next year because we were made to feel welcome ,happy and cared for. Christian was our main contact, this person is perfection at its best. We did not want to leave. We feel like we have now true friends in France.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Snot_Finder
Reviews.Content: Immaculately clean with a fairly large room and bathroom. Room 64 has a view of the Eiffel Tower from the bed. Bed was a little firm for my taste, but with electronic blackout shades I slept great. Staff was extremely helpful, friendly and engaging. Local area is quaint, full of locals, with good shops and cafes. Walking distance to Eiffel tower and Invalides. Two blocks from a Metro station. Concierge would have been great, but for this price not expected. Good breakfast - free with Rick Steves Paris guidebook.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location and Personable staff”
Reviews.Author: xaves99
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel as its close to the Eiffel and to Rue Cler. My room had a fantastic view of the Tower, and I have Frederica at reception to thank for this. I did request this possibility but never really expected to be so lucky. It really added to the experience of staying at this hotel which has lovely rooms in any case. My room felt spacious by Paris standards with pretty but not too frilly decoration. The amenities were lovely and there were nice touches, like magazines to read. Because I had mentioned Rick Steves ?spelling guide, I enjoyed breakfast for free. It was a nice selection of the usual - fruit, yoghurt, cereal, eggs, cheese. The hotel is near Rue Cler, a pedestrian only street filled with cafes, fruit, cheese and flower shops. Its a lovely experience to sit at one of the cafes in the later afternoon (Tribeca was one I enjoyed) and watch the locals collect their children from what must be a nearby school. The shuttle to the airport was late arriving and the gentleman on reception quickly made a phone call when I mentioned to him this fact. I appreciated his quick response. This hotel is at the top range of my budget but I did enjoy my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Relais Bosquet is back!”
Reviews.Author: lhinesabc
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Relais Bosquet, and we had become concerned that the hotel needed renovation. No more! All of the superior rooms have been renovated with new carpeting, draperies, tile and bedding. The hotel itself is ideally located in the 7th arrondisement, a desirable residential area near the Eiffel Tower that is very convenient for exploring all that Paris has to offer. The metro stop (Ecole Militaire) is a block away from the hotel and the Rue Cler market street is half a block from the hotel. The hotel lobby has also been recently renovated. Two computers are available in the lobby for guest use and free WIFI is available in the rooms. The staff speaks English and is very helpful. Breakfast (13 euros per person) is served in a charming room off the main lobby and features a bountiful buffet. This is a very comfortable "home away from home" in Paris. Note: The standard rooms will be renovated next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, quiet neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: camera_gypsy
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I stayed here for two nights in early April 2010. I wanted to take him to the UK and to Paris for his sprig break. I couldn't have chosen a better location. If you are in the younger set looking for night life, this is not the location for you. It was very quiet and convenient to the Eiffel Tower, and the Metro, which we used heavily after the first day (there was a train strike the day we arrived). Charming Rue Cler is just a short walk to the west, which I recommend for some yummy French pastries. I wouldn't classify our room as too small. We were suited with two twin beds,and although they were smacked up against each other we made do. The bathroom looked like it had been recently remodeled. My son was less satisfied than I was, but what more can you expect from a 15 year-old? I highly recommend Hotel Relais Bosquet! The front desk staff was friendly. There are internet connected computers in the lobby to send an e-mail home. You can also find them on FB. I would definitely return for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful if Acts of God Interfere with your trip”
Reviews.Author: chirpy12345
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not accomodating with regards to scheduling or cancelation fees. We are impacted by the volcano in Iceland and they have been less than helpful and slow in responding.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous...look no further ...stay here..”
Reviews.Author: CathyJ1578
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location....easy access to the Metro, next to the Rue Cler, 10 minute walk through lovely neighborhoods to the Eiffel Tower. It was very easy to get to all the major attractions from here. NIce restaurants in the area. The bedroom, beds and bathroom were excellent and were roomy....and my husband is 6 foot 5 inches tall! I felt like a true Parisian in this neighborhood! But the best reason to stay there is the staff....very helpful and friendly. And totally honest. When I returned home, I realized I had left my jewelry case in the room. I was panic-stricken; we had been on a cruise so I had brought many pieces of jewelry with me. Some of the pieces are of enormous sentimental value to me. I was in tears when I sat down at my computer to send an email to see if they would look for the case. I was feeling very pessimitic that it would be returned to me. To my utter delight and relief, there was an email FROM THEM letting me know that they had found the case. They did not even wait for me to initiate a request. I will forever be in their debt!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Parisian experience”
Reviews.Author: ukulelemama
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel for my first trip to Paris. The neighborhood is exactly what I hoped for; ultra Parisian, quaint, and lovely. The room was small but ample. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sactrav8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior room on the top floor with a nice view of the Eiffel Tower off to the side of the window. The room was nice, well furnished, clean and of decent size (good for European standards, smallish by American standards). The staff were helpful whenever we had questions. The free Louvre ticket is nice because it allows a special entrance without the wait for a ticket. The Rue Cler area is very nice. We hadn't stayed here before but found it to be quite comfortable with good restaurants, food stalls, laundromat and anything else travellers might need. It's a bit quiter than St Germain, Latin Quarter, Left Bank.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY Recommended”
Reviews.Author: shamrock1978
Reviews.Content: When I was booking a hotel in Paris, everyone warned me how small the rooms in Paris hotels were. I was pleasantly surprised! Our room at Relais was perfectly sized - big bathroom, seperate toilet, and nicely sized bedroom area....all at a fantastic price! I have been living in the Netherlands without a bathtub so perhaps I am overly praising of the big deep tub with lovely shower gels!...but it was REALLY nice. The location is fantastic. We technically had a room without an Eiffel tower view, but it still had an eiffel tower view. It sparkles every hour and that was really fun to watch from our room. We loved the area. The Rue Cler down the narrow street is adorable and seemingly undiscovered by the masses. One of the small alleys down the way housed one of the best restaurants we had ever visited: auberge du champ du mars = just incredible! The combination of the lovely hotel and the salmon at auberge du champ du mars put my boyfriend in such a good mood he proposed to me at Relais Bosquet :) So it will always have a special place in my heart! My only complaint with the hotel is that the bed was really hard (for me). I know different people have different bed cushion preferences. The staff was so nice and helpful. They held our luggage the day of our checkout so we could sightsee before our departure. Breakfast tip - there are several delicious bakeries and jam shops surrounding the hotel - we skipped hotel breakfast and got local fresh bread, jam, and pain au chocolate in the morning. La Cuillere Gourmande is a WONDERFUL jam shop a few doors down - so helpful and so delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Bargain in a Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: JohnLouise
Reviews.Content: What a deal! Friendly, helpful staff; large (for Europe) bedroom and excellent bathroom; and the price was right! Close to everything--we walked to all the museums and sights every day. Numerous excellent restaurants located nearby. Perfect location for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “what a nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: lisa829
Reviews.Content: We rented an apartment in the Rue Cler neighborhood and had to move to a hotel for our last night in Paris. We found this hotel while walking around and lucky for us, they had three rooms available for us! Although it is being renovated now, it was still a lovely place to stay. One of our three rooms had been fully renovated and it was great. All three bathrooms were done. The blackout shades on the windows really work. If you are on the street side, it's a bit noisy but if you face the courtyard, it's better. The walls are pretty thin so you can hear noise from the hall but i think that is true in most small, older hotels. The breakfast was great....I think they must have walked down the street to get the fresh baked goods. Coffee was served by a waiter who was very courteous...AND they had great decaf! Most guests appeared to speak English and the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: Alex_A_RJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family for 9 nights. Small, cozy, comfortable and very well located, a true hidden gem. The staff is excellent! MMe Frederique and M Christian, with sympathy and warmth, did everything for our stay was pleasant. Like the gentleman who worked in the hotel restaurant, whose name I do not remember, but was extremely polite and friendly, trying to serve us very well. The facilities are old but well cared for, and the hotel is undergoing renovations, which will cause it to be even better. The neighborhood is wonderful. A few meters from the Eiffel Tower, Ecole Militaire Metro Station, supermarkets, restaurants, boulangeries, pharmacies and so on. If looking for a 3 star hotel with an excellent cost-benefit, look no further. The Hotel Relais Bosquet is a great choice. The buffet breakfast can be a little expensive, but it is very good. An alternative is the continental breakfast served in your room, a little cheaper, but well served and delicious. Another option is to choose between different options for delicious bakeries around the hotel. One is the Pain d'Epis, next to the hotel. Automatic curtains are excellent. Once closed, completely darken the room and provide more comfort. I found this hotel by Trip Advisor and made the reservation by e-mail. Everything went wonderfully well. Thanks to all of Relais Bosquet. See you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great service”
Reviews.Author: brayehill
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, in the middle of a 6 week Europe trip. The service was great - can't thank them enough for helping us with our guided tour. The room was good - great big fluffy towels. No problems with anything. We were in the middle of Paris, and walked to every main attration. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Relais Bosquet Apartment is a Special Find”
Reviews.Author: LegacyPlanner
Reviews.Content: My daughter, niece and I stayed at one of the Relais-Bosquet's apartments for a week over the Thanksgiving holiday. The hotel owns three separate apartments, two of which are studios. We stayed at the Studio Valadon, which is right around the corner from Rue Cler and its many amenities and a short 10 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower. A metro stop is about a block away. The apartment is on the 4th floor of a quiet apartment building built around a courtyard. There is a miniscule, one person elevator to get your luggage up the stairs (or you if you need), and the kids got a kick out of that. Although the apartment is tiny, it was wonderful to be able to have our own little kitchen, computer and to feel like we were true Parisians, buying food at the neighborhood butcher, fruit stalls and corner grocery. We didn't have the service one would have at the hotel itself, but we enjoyed being more autonomous and less touristy. The apartment itself is well-appointed, modern, and true to how it looks on the web. There is no view per se, but the many windows look out onto an inner courtyard and neighboring roofs. The kitchen could be better stocked with cooking utensils and service items, but it was adequate for what we needed. The shower and toilet are in separate rooms, which is handy if you have more than one person staying with you. Somehow they fixed the flat screen television to provide English speaking cable channels for us, and although we didn't watch much TV, it was nice to hear the news on CNN in English. The computer they provided worked so well we rarely opened our laptops. Cleaning service is every three days, but they leave plenty of towels and supplies. Frederica and her team are lovely to work with at the hotel, answered our every question and arranged for a very reasonable van service to take us to and from the airport. We plan to make the Studio Valadon our Paris home away from home. It was perfect in every way and we cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great, convienent hotel by Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: MsBlairBass
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights while on a short trip to Paris with my boyfriend. After a nightmare Eurostar trip down from London, this hotel was easy to find and really warm and friendly. We had a standard room with a queen bed, a small balcony, and a beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower! Amazing! About a 10 minute walk to the Tower in the snow. Breakfast was great and filling. Service was great as well. We got a good rate since it was winter, and compared to the prices of other hotels in Paris I know we received a good deal. The room was clean and the bathroom was large for European standards. We didn't really have a problem with anything at all. Thank you for a wonderful stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: peachpitts
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews. It was just ok. The room was a bit worn and in need of updating. Good Points: LCD TV was nice, good selection of tv channels, Heating in room was great. Buffett breakfast included with Rick Steve's book, great location, free wireless. Bad points: Old furnishing, old carpet not very clean, Old closet rickety, small safe - not large enough for small laptop/notebook, toilet separate from shower area. I would probably stay again with a discount rate as I received, but foor full price, I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but wasn't as good as I thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: vee_travels
Reviews.Content: The staff was very accommodating which we appreciated. Superior rooms vary so if you aren't thrilled with the one you are in ask to see another. Rooms were decent but I was surprised that while my towels were changed every day (despite hanging them up) my floors were not cleaned regularly. We loved being close to Rue Cler - the food options are great. And if you aren't into paying the hotel prices for doing your laundry and don't want to spend a morning at the laundry mat, the 5 a sec on Rue Cler has full-service laundry. Friends were at other hotels in the area (the 6th and 7th) all about the same price per night but the spaces drastically different. This is on the low-end of the 3 star rating when compared to other 3 star hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Hotel”
Reviews.Author: biglaughingboy
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, it's quite clean, the bed sheets were clean and smells clean! We asked for extra pillows when we made the reservation online and the hotel receptionist confirmed by email that we will have extra pillows, The hotel even asked us prior to our arrival if we want to make any restaurant reservations or tours. That was really nice! Very friendly staff. The hotel location is great, very close to the metro and the Eiffel tower, the Rue Cler market and restaurants. There's a great bakery and pastry shop at the corner, right next to the hotel. French pastries and breads are so delicious! The only drawback about the superior room we were in was the toilet room is separate from the bathroom and there is no sink in the toilet room, you have to go to the bathroom to wash up. This is really a minor issue compared to the good things about this hotel. Breakfast is always good, but a little monotonous, if you stay there for 7 days...they serve the same thing everyday. A little suggestion would be to have some variations on the meats (maybe bacon sometimes instead of sausages), although the croissants are delicious and flaky and always a good thing to eat every morning. We loved our stay and someday go back there again. This was our 2nd trip to Paris-we just celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Relais Bosquet”
Reviews.Author: BigTA
Reviews.Content: Due to the glowing praise on TripAdvisor and by Rick Steves, we had pretty high expectations, which were met. Glad I sprung for the superior room. Great neighborhood, very nice, smaller property. Clean, quiet, well maintained. Very helpful staff. The free Wi-Fi worked very well. An excellent base for exploring Paris. We didn't get the breakfast at the hotel, which was the right move for us. Several cafes and markets on Rue Cler allow for sit-down and takeout options for breakfast. The only disconcerting experience was being told on arrival that they didn't have the reservation. It wasn't a problem since they had rooms, and they gave me the Internet rate. I had made the reservation directly on their site and gotten an email confirmation, but I hadn't had a chance to confirm the deposit charge on my credit card before leaving. So I recommend confirming the charge before you leave.

Reviews.Title: “What a find, we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: annandalewanderers
Reviews.Content: We like many others chose the Hotel Relais Bosquet because of the great reviews on Trip Advisor and having never been to Paris AND on a second leg of a 4 week honeymoon I wanted to make sure it was spot on. And we weren’t disappointed. We arrived very early in the morning and were able to check in straight away, freshen up and hit the streets before 9:30am. The staff were always polite and patient with my French (and if you don’t at least try you should have a good hard look at yourself!) and the room spotless. The room by French standards was huge, with plenty of room to spread out, a view out our window to the oh so close Eiffel Tower made it even better. A nearby market street became the location for great breakfast supplies, and watching the real Paris flow by (steer away from the breakfast at the hotel – while very well provided for it is excessively expensive considering what is all of 30m away). Throw in the free Lourve tickets, just ask at reception, and the free internet 24 hours in the lobby you are on winner. Definitely be looking to come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jack7783
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Relais Bosquet was Fantastic. Loved the hotel. The rooms were nice, clean, and quiet. The staff was friendly, helpful and efficient. Their breakfast was excellent and the neighborhood was wonderful. We found this hotel through a combination of Rick Steves' Book and TripAdvisor and we feel very fortunate to have picked this place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The apartment was great!”
Reviews.Author: WOXOF1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed six nights at the two room apartment offered by this hotel. The ground floor apartment had everything including washer/dryer, diswasher, microwave, wide-screen TV, kitchen with appliances, a computer with Internet access and electric black-out shutters. It also has a patio with table and chairs. It was very comfortable and we didn't feel claustrophobic like some hotel rooms. The apartment is located one short block from the hotel and is very near to Rue Cler. There were many restaurants, shops, bakeries and food markets nearby. The hotel staff all spoke very good english and were very courteous and helpful. The rates were very reasonable. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for low-budget eating”
Reviews.Author: Arknsstrvller
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay here. I don't have a lot to add that hasn't been said already. We got a standard room, which was barely big enough for the two of us and our three suitcases, but fine for our 4 night stay. The free computers in the lobby were a plus, and the staff gave us a pot of good strong coffee every morning (free gratis, on request) to take up to the room, which is a great thing to have if you're a coffee addict. The best thing about this hotel though was the location less than a block from Rue Cler, which is a market street. The food available at the fish market, vegetable market, meat market, bakery, cheese shop, etc. was incredible. A taxi driver mentioned that one of the cheese shops is the best in Paris. Every shop features gourmet prepared foods in addition to the basic grocery fare, which you can take with you for travelling lunches and save the cost of a restaurant. We went to the Louvre, and ate at the food court at the mall underneath. But instead of buying the typical fast food, we pulled out our stash from Rue Cler, bought a half bottle of wine to go with it, and everyone that walked by was jealous. The things available to eat at Rue Cler are truly fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Small and personal, nice rooms and service, good location.”
Reviews.Author: OzSooty
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris and booked this hotel from other reviews. The staff were friendly and responsive when we were booking and this was also reflected during the stay. We stayed in the superior room, and this provided plenty of space. The bed was very comfortable and shutters on the windows ensured sound and light didn't wake us too early. The Rue Cler is very close for cafes and restaurants and the hotel is also near a Metro station. It is only a short walk to the Eiffel tower where you can catch a red tourist bus and also a "hop on hop off" ferry up the Seine. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Uncommonly friendly service in a well-located, simple hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjp3003
Reviews.Content: Had it not been for the friendly service and location, this hotel would have received a lower rating. Every front desk attendee was cordial and helpfull. As other reviewers have stated, the location is good in terms of access to many restaurant, the Tour Eiffel and the metro. Not the swankiest location in Paris, but a pleasant one. The rooms and the hotel in general are not spotless, but but they are well kept. Rooms are modestly sized by US standards, moderately sized by Parisian standards. My room had stains in th carpet, the chair upholstery and minor wall scuffs. Decorations are homely and inviting. The bathroom is complete and functional, but dated. Rooms have flat screen TV's (with limited channels), small fridges and a tiny lockbox. Kudos for providing free Wireless Internet and a wide array of magazines in the room. In relative terms in Paris, this hotel is honestly priced. This is my third trip to Paris in the last 11 months. Depending on your preferences, if your are considering this hotel you may also want to consider the Best Western Premier Trocadero La Tour. It is similarly priced, rated 4 stars (versus 3) and offers nicer rooms and bathrooms in Passy. Passy is a quieter neighborhood that is more residential and less touristy yet offers several restaurants for dining, Metro access (one or two stops from the Eiffel Tower) and shopping. The service is not as friendly as Le Bosquet but was agreeable. Both offer nice breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty little hotel with at-home feel, doting staff and quiet location near Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: lechatcelli
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was accomodating throughout our stay. Although our rooms were not ready on arrival, the staff stored our bags, kept us posted, permitted us to use the free internet as long as we wished, and got us checked-in by mid-afternoon, as is their stated policy. The immaculate rooms are charming, though quite small, and are decorated in fresh, calming colors just as their official web site shows. We found the bathroom to be a decent size compared to the rest of the room - it has a sizeable tub/shower enclosure with attractive glass door, all chrome fittings throughout the room, is well-lit and even features a separate room for the commode with a door for total privacy. There is an abundance of lovely toiletries for guests and a handy, efficient hairdryer by the bathroom mirror. The room-darkening electric blinds are so efficient at shutting out light (and sounds) that you had better set your alarm! We didn't the first night and slept so soundly that we missed the wonderful breakfast they offer - luckily, charming Frederique ran to the boulangerie next door and secured amazing bread, and along with other items she uncovered for us, it provided almost everything we missed. Another thoughtful employee was our breakfast room server who actually found my vitamins and stored them in a cup for me! The staff was also very indulgent in helping me with my French, patiently answering my numerous questions when I approached with pen in hand. This goes well beyond the call of duty. The only feature of the hotel that was not desirable was their lighting system - it's necessary to insert your room key card into a slot really quickly, otherwise you are left in darkness. Finally, we felt so comfortable in this hotel that we stayed an extra night! Although rather pricey, this is reminiscent of a boutique hotel at less than boutique prices.

Reviews.Title: “A superb experience over and over agqin...”
Reviews.Author: Northshoreman
Reviews.Content: Over the last 2 years we have stayed in the hotel and most recently in one of their apartments. We lived like the French...shopping in the Rue Cler marketplace and eating in restaurants and our own apartment...just a block away from the hotel. It's the best of both worlds with the front desk there if you need anything...maid service every other day, and your own apartment in the charming Rue Cler area. We've stayed in Paris on 12 occasions and this is consistently our best experience whether in the hotel or the apartments. We will return many times I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - Great location for Paris, Great service”
Reviews.Author: DesignerSong
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Relais Bosquet over 9th October 2009 with my wife for her 30th Birthday, and had an absolutely amazing time.
