As others state, we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast by mentioning Rick Steves' Paris book (which is a brilliant book, by the way, we used it all around Paris - his guides for all the top places were see were fantastic, and the info really added to each sight). By the way, we got to the Hotel really easily from Charlle De Gaulle Airport - just got the RER train to St Michel Notre Dame, and then connected to another RER train to Pont D'Alma. Only cost 8.50 Euros each (just got ticket from machines at airport). Really easy - only took about 45 mins in total. From Pont D'Alma it was a ten minute easy walk to the hotel, basically just down one main road. Hotel staff were all very friendly and spoke great English. Christian helped me with booking a Dinner Cruise and Moulin Rouge show. All top notch service! We stayed in a superior room, and it was massive. Could see the top of the Eiffel Tower from our room too. As others have said, Rue Cler is just a 2 mind walk from the hotel, with lots of cafes/shops/restaurants. The Metro is a 5 min walk, base of Eiffel Tower around 10 min walk. Seine/Dinner cruises 10 min walk. How great a location is that? Will definitely stay here again, and can't wait to come back to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to Rue Cler area and Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Admiral_Zheng_He
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights at this hotel as recommended by a Rick Steves travel guidebook. This hotel is popular with American tourist travelers, and may have gotten pricier as its popularity has grown due to Rick Steves' positive review of it. Good ample breakfast buffet, and we (unfortunately) found out after-the-fact that, apparently, if you bring a Rick Steves guidebook with you and mention the "Rick Steves breakfast deal" when you check in, then the daily breakfast is on-the-house. Rooms are small but cozy, with an average bathroom and a pretty comfortable bed (showerhead water pressure could have been better, and toilet is in a separate enclosed space adjacent to the bathtub/sink space of the bathroom). Space could have been cleaner, there was dust and floor stains evident. You can occasionally hear voices/noise outside the room. But overall this is a good deal provided that you can get the breakfast-included deal, because this hotel is well-located to enjoy Rue Cler, a Parisian-style pedestrian street lined with quaint shops (boulangeries, flower shops, little boutique shops, etc.) and nice cafes, and is relatively convenient to the Metro subway to be able to explore the rest of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly friendly”
Reviews.Author: mcintosh25
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully located in Paris near the Eiffel Tower, it is a sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of this capital city. Discovered it through researching the web only to find that after we booked it is recommended in Rick Steeves France. Excellent value spacious and brightly decorated rooms. Our room had a view of the tower and the hotel is only one block from Rue Cler, a wonderful street of cafes, produce stands and various bakeries, and shops Groceterias. Very handy to the metro as well. Most importantly, wonderful staff to assist you. We were there for two weeks and while we spoke basic French it was nice always nice to come home to Relais Bosquet for a breath of fresh air!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, so comfortable, convenient, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Cookie_C
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and comfortable with a view of the Eiffel Tower, loved the bathroom with tub and the free breakfast (thanks to Rick Steves) was awesome! The coffee was so good, I'm still talking about it. Relais Bosquet is close to Rue Cler, a wonderful walk street with outdoor seating cafes and great little shops. Best part of our trip was hanging out on the Rue Cler people watching. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. So relaxing and the staff is friendly and helpful. We are retired and speak no French yet had a wonderful time. Walking distance to metro and Eiffel Tower. Great location, friendly staff, wonderful breakfast, comfortable beds, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quite... Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: BAL90
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. On a quite, one way street that dead ends into an almost pedestrian only shopping area with restaurants. There is a bakery next door and a small grocery store a few doors down. Less then a block away is a laundry facility and an ATM. We easily walked to the Eiffel Tower area from here. The staff was more than helpful. They immediately responded to my online order with a personalized email, and scheduled a car service from/to the airport. Breakfast was great with many options, including breads, yogurt, hard-cooked eggs, etc. Breakfast is free for Rick Steve's readers. The bed could have been better, but all in all this was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: eavnapa
Reviews.Content: Fredrica was very helpful in making reservations and suggesting places to eat. We especially like Le Bosqet for lunch and La Fontaine du Mars for dinner. The location was exceptional, all you need right there. Boulangeries, fromageries, butcher shops, restaurants, metro, the Eiffel Tower.... The room was spacious and comfortable. We will definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “This place is the perfect choice for Paris”
Reviews.Author: bobcatks
Reviews.Content: There were 3 of us gals off on a girl's trip without husbands or kids. We loved this hotel. The location was perfect. The front desk desk staff was so helpful. There is a laudromat just around the corner, which came in very handy once we figured out how it worked. We were able to get City passes to skip the lines to the museums and book boat tours right at the desk. We got the contintental breakfast for free since we were able to tell them we heard about the hotel from the Rick Steve's book. Our bathroom was huge compared to other hotels. There are amazing black out drapes that come down at the press of a button. If you are looking for great location (walking distance to Eiffel tower and Metro) and fits within a budget, this is the hotel for you

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed Expectations”
Reviews.Author: mmp1021
Reviews.Content: I have only positive things to say about this small hotel in the 7th arrondissment. Our room was more than adequate. The large bath, plasma TV and mini fridge were unexpected bonuses. Use of computers was free and the breakfast was great. the hotel is 2 blocks from the metro and walking distance to many great places to eat. The hotel staff was always gracious and very helpful with dining suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Great, quiet hotel with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Illinitraveler21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our second stay in two years at the Relais Bosquet. As before the hotel was clean, comfortable and quite. The staff was very friendly and attentive when needed. The breakfast buffet was a great addition to hotel services. We will stay here again next time we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful base for a Paris Vacation”
Reviews.Author: CTTraveler42
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful 6-night stayed at Hotel Relais Bosquet in September 2009. The location was ideal, a relatively quiet residential neighborhood with many cafes, outdoor markets, and the Eiffel Tower and Seine within walking distance. The short walk to the Metro stop and and the pleasant 10-minute walk down Avenue Bosquet to the RER station at Pont D'Alma made it very easy to get to any point in the city, or train connections to Versailles, to Chartres, and even to CDG airport by public transit. We "splurged" for a "Superior" room and found it spacious and comfortable, with a lovely modern bathroom. The breakfast buffets were ample, at 13.6 Euros per person, but included in the room when we mentioned booking through Rick Steves. The computers in the lobby with free Internet made it easy to check on the weather, train schedules, and news from home. The staff at the desk was very helpful, even after we had returned home, when Frederica kept calling Paris Lost and Found for us, in an attempt to find the camera that we managed to lose on our train ride to Chartres.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: AllenTravelers
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris. The greatest asset of the hotel was "location, location, location". We were able to go numerous places either walking or taking a bus or boat. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and bathrooms were very nice and a good size. There were many wonderful cafes within walking distance which we visited frequently. We will stay here again when we return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “NiCE”
Reviews.Author: angelofmercy
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay. Christian, at the front desk was very helpful and nice, which is needed in this city if you don't speak french and you are lost. Our room had a view of the eiffel tower and it was quiet, which is the most important thing to me. The man at breakfast was nice, too, sorry I can't remember his name. He had a kind way about him, especially when your in a city that pretends to not understand english. The street was great, I am really missing those bakeries and the fabulous food in Paris. You will be happy with the location. There are so many things to see you need at least a week in Paris. We tried to see everything in 3 days and we were so tired from walking. I would definitely take a few more taxis, next time. Its hard to say much more than the other reviews. It was really all good. Thanks to the people who work there.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ozroiz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Relais Bosquet four days in August. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great and I enjoyed using the two complementary computers in the lobby. Our room was very clean and quiet. The hotel is located one block from Rue Cler which had several good places to eat. It was also a short walk to the Eiffel Tower where we enjoyed watching the light show at 10 P.M each evening. We definitely will stay here the next time we are in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: californiatravelor09
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights at the end of May 2009. From the helpfulness of Abdinor when we booked our reservation to the friendly service after we arrived, we were completely pleased with our stay. The hotel assisted in arranging our transportation from the airport. Christian at the front desk even helped me with my limited French skills along with great restaurant recommendations and transportation tricks. Our room was comfortable with a partial view of the Eiffel Tower. The breakfast was one of the best we had during our entire trip. We hope to return and would definitely stay at the Hotel Relais-Bosquet again. There are two computers in the lobby for guest use (we did not use them) because we had our own laptop. Free wireless internet in rooms was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: hey_kim20
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, the staff are helpful and caring. I would definitely recommend this place to others. The room we were in was bigger than we expected for a room in Paris, and we could see the Eiffel Tower from our window.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable over Christmas”
Reviews.Author: mcnamn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Christmas 2007 and really enjoyed our stay. Great location for sightseeing and a very clean room. Was maybe a bit more money than we usually spend but well worth it for a Christmas break.

Reviews.Title: “My Wife Gave Me Big Points for This Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: XYZZY
Reviews.Content: I looked long and hard to find this gem. The price was right. The location, excellent. The staff great. It was a half block to Rue Cler - an iconic Paris neighborhood street with shops, restaurants, fruit stands, a flower vendor, a bakery, a small grocery store and a post office with an international ATM outside. A neat, clean neighborhood laundromat was a short block away. Our room actually looked like the pictures on the hotel's web site. The Ecole-Militaire Metro stop was less than a 5 minute walk; It was a 15 minute walk either by tree-lined streets or through the Champ du Mars park to the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Demgee
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day stay at the Relais Bosquet and i could not be more pleased, It totaly lives up to the reviews on this site. Great loacation, spotlessly clean, fantastic facilities and very friendly and helpfull staff. Without doubt the best value hotel i have ever stayed in especialy considering we recieved free tickets to the Louvre when we booked. Checked in at 12pm no problem at all ( unlike the London hotel we stayed at the night before where we were charged £10 extra to check in before 3.30pm). Room was just as the hotel's own website shows and was very pleased when i opened the window to see we had a view of the tower ( room 24). I was going to update our room to superior on arrival but, after seeing our standard room i could see no point in the upgrade even though it is a relatively small charge. Great bathroom with bath and shower, lost of little extras like tissues, flannels,shoe shining kit, sowing kit, shower caps, body lotion and shower gell. Breakfast served in the room was a great idea 10 Euros for the continental delivered to your room at a time of your choosing has to be a bargain. The street is pretty quiet ( as is the whole area ) but with the electric blackout blind down its both silent and dark until you chose to open up in the morning. Hotel is within an easy walk of the Eiffel and the river ( i highly recommend using the Batobus Hop on Hop off service (just down the steps to the river at the back of the tower, bought a 2 day pass for 16 Euros ( 5 day for 19Euros) and used it all day every day) great views so relaxing and saved a fortune in taxis. Bars cafe shops and restaurants all around the hotel and streets nearby so you cant be stuck for somewhere to eat or drink but i would recommend, on a warm evening, pack a picnic with bottle of wine and get off the Batobus at the Jardin des Plantes to enjoy the locals in free music and dancing ( or maybe just watch the dancing like me) its a beautiful way to spend an evening and it will only cost you a few Euros if you shop at one of the supermarkets near the Hotel Relais Bosquet . This was our first visit to Paris and i have to say it was fantastic and cant wait to visit again. The Relais Bosquet will be on my booking list for sure as i cant see how this hotel can be beaten for value.So i would say if you are thinking of booking stop thinking and just DO IT you wont regret this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: llgg23
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Great neighborhood. Skip breakfast and get a cappucino on Rue de Cler. Two computers with free internet in lobby! The Eiffel Tower has a light show around 10 pm, walk there in about 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ramsden
Reviews.Content: I'd wanted to stay in this hotel for ages and finally got round to it last weekend on a trip with my aunt and mother. We shared a triple room which was excellent value. The room itself was perfect for three of us...the third bed was a camp bed style which worried me a little but allegedly was perfectly comfortable! The room and bathroom were lovely, great views of the Eiffel Tower. We really appreciated the fridge on a hot weekend. We didn't have the breakfast - at 15 euros we thought it was pretty ridiculous and filled the fridge with our own breakfast supplies. The tea/coffee facilities were much appreciated. The staff were lovely throughout our stay. It was a pleasure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Our ninth anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Psycher
Reviews.Content: Did a whirlwind Paris tour; even though we stayed two nights, we had one day to see as much of Paris as our legs could take. Finding Relais Bosquet was a bit of a challenge, even with the GPS. And you'll need luck getting parking anywhere near the hotel; you have to pay to park on the Champ de Mars. However, there are a couple of parking areas nearby (€25/day), or you cold get lucky and find free parking on a nearby street. Christian greeted us once inside, but after check-in there were no offers to help with the bags. Gotta love the French. Anyway, we got a deluxe single. The hotel is only two blocks from the Parc du Champs de Mars, and I'm told you can see the top of the Tour Eiffel from the right rooms, but not ours (room 42). The room was spacious, clean, with antique-ish furnishings, a FIRM queen size bed, plenty of pillows and blankets, and a mini minibar. The bathroom was on one side of the room, the shower on another; a bit weird but at least you have facilities en suite. Warning, the doors are no barrier to sound! Everything was clean and inviting. The hotel offers breakfast at €15 per person, but there are plenty of bistro's and a bakery just down the street. Overall we really liked our stay. It was quiet, friendly, and very pleasant. Christian was more than helpful with reservations, free tickets to the Louvre, and useful advise. While this may be the last time we ever get to Paris, if a miracle should happen and we need to come again, I can see staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel with great service, friendly staff and in a great location. Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Canada2062
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It is located on a quiet street, close to Rue Cler (pedestrian market street). Lots of good restaurants close by, supermarket, bakeries, metro all very close by. It is less than a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. I am a light sleeper and I could not believe how quiet it was at night. The sleeping part of our room was down a hallway from the door and so I heard no hallway noise. In addition, the hotel is located on a quiet street, so no traffic noise to keep you up at night or wake you early in the morning. Wonderful Italian restaurant close by on Rue Cler. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and spoke perfect English. My teens loved the computers available to check in with their friends on facebook. The hotel arranged a shuttle from the airport for us which worked out quite well. The beds were quite comfortable and the rooms are very clean. The blinds on the windows completely black out all light for sleeping. Breakfast is great - lots of choice and very filling. I just can't say enough good things about this hotel. I will recommend it to everyone I know and it will be the only hotel I use if I return to Paris. I have no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Huge room!”
Reviews.Author: eozoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Hotel Relais and had a wonderful stay! The room was huge, which seems to be uncommon in Paris. Our room looked out on a small courtyard and the only real down side was that you could see into the rooms across the way, but we just kept our blinds closed. They had automatic metal shades on the windows, which made the room nice and dark at night and gave us alot of privacy. The location was awesome! There is a market right beside the hotel, very nice to pick up some wine and cheese. There are numerous bakeries and cafes on the same street. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, just went to one cafe down the street, much cheaper! They have free internet in the lobby, which is rare on its own! The metro is one block away! The Effiel tower is within about 4 blocks, the Las Invalides is only a couple blocks away, as well as many other attractions, we walked almost everywhere! The front desk staff was hit and miss in their helpfulness, but always pleasant. We would definitely stay here again, no question!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in an ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: LAworld
Reviews.Content: Our room was large by Paris standards with a a dresser, desk, walk in closet, and plenty of room to walk around. We loved the electric shades, free computer access in the lobby, the room safe, and the wonderful rue Cler neighborhood. The front desk staff were friendly and very helpful, assisting us with dinner reservations. Great meals can be had within biocks. We would recommend Cafe Constant , L' Ami Jean, Le P'tit Troquet, and Le Florimond. The location is ideal with the Eiffel Tower and Invalides with in a few blocks, as well as easy access to the metro and the RER to Versaille. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast (a nice plus for Rick Steves guide users) in the newly remodeled lobby. The toiletries and towelst were very nice and the beds were comfortable. The room was spotless, but could use some updating. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: juliancarax55
Reviews.Content: Simply fantastic!!! It's a very expencive place, but me and my wife stlept there thanks an our friend's present. Very good service, very nice room, central location, very confortable.

Reviews.Title: “Location, then Staff Make All the Difference”
Reviews.Author: MtnWest09
Reviews.Content: At the end of a 2 week trip we stayed 3 days in Paris. This was a lovely location with friendly helpful English speaking staff. Location was wonderful in the 7th, near Rue Cler and Metro as well as walks at night in Champs du Mars. We hope to return, soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaggieTucson_AZ
Reviews.Content: We loved this quaint hotel. You feel like you are truly experiencing Paris. You are among the locals here. Wonderful restaurants, markets just outside your doorstep. We enjoyed eating ham and cheese omelets, apple pastry, fresh squeezed orange juice and coffee at an outdoor cafe each morning, watching the locals begin their day. Our room had a wonderful view of the Eiffel tower. The staff spoke English and were very helpful. The day we were checking out, we had a train departure to Rome at 7PM. The staff allowed us to store our luggage there until we left. I also felt ill that morning and they extended our check out time until 2PM. I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: freodoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in early July . Chose the Relais Bosquet after reading the good TA reviews. Everything you read is true... it's a great little hotel in another of those cities it's really hard to get good quality accommodation without breaking the bank. The location is good, close to Eiffel Tower, and there is a Metro Station 2 mins away. There are plenty of excellent restaurants and shops nearby.. for eating try L'Ami Jean for a real French experience ( found Le Florimond a bit too touristy ! ). The nearby Leo le Lion is good too. The rooms are a good size and clean with electric shutters, some with view of the Tower. The staff at reception can't do enough to help and will arrange anything for you from transport to airports, restaurant bookings etc. And they speak perfect English. There is free WiFi internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location- You need not look more!”
Reviews.Author: travelmutter
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Relais Bosquet. You could not find a better location. Five minute walk to the Eiffel tower frounds and right around the corner from Ecole Militaire Subway stop and down the street from the RER station. The pedestrian area (Rue Cler) is 1 minute away and full of great restaurants. Self-service laundry is a block away (opepn 7 a.m. to 10 p.m.). Paris' Velib (public bike rental) has "stations" all around the hotel. Free breakfast when you let them know you found them through Rick Steve's Guide Book. Highly recommend Fat Tire Segway Tours (75 euros/person) but book in advance. (they have a website). Travelled with two teenage boys and had a large triple room (155 euros) with separate bathroom, separate toilet room, separate large closet with safe and the room itself was air-conditioned. Two free computers in lobby for guests to use. Great staff. Hotel arranged for shuttle from airport (51 euros for 3 people with suitcases). Terrific location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Paco_Mxl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 days in Paris from July 21 to July 24. We booked a room after reading a review in a travel guide. At the time of reservation we mentioned the book review and they gave us complimentary breakfast for the duration of our stay (the chocolate croissants are specially good). The hotel is small but nice, the rooms are surprisingly spacious, nicely decorated and impecably clean. They have free Wireless Internet and a couple of computers downstairs for general use. The location is just a 10 minute walk away from the Eiffel Tower and the Seine river. One block away from the lobby is the Rue Cler street with beautiful bakeries, a couple of nice cheese shops, grocery stores, fruit vendors and several cafes with a typical Parisian atmosphere. The location allows easy transportation options including the Metro (1 block away) and the bus (just a few steps away). This is not a luxury hotel and it doesn't pretend to be one, but, for the money, location and for what it offers it is, in my opinion, an excellent deal.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Rick Steves for recommending this place”
Reviews.Author: cat4554
Reviews.Content: If it wasn't for reading Rick Steves book on Paris I wouldn't have known about this place. I went to a trusted travel agent and she never heard of it so I went with my gut and booked it on my own based of what Rick Steves said. I wasn't disappointed and neither was my spouse or friend. Right from the beginning Christian was the most helpful. He is on the staff at the hotel and answered all my questions before the trip started. He arranged for my friend, who was arriving in Paris by plane, how to call for a taxi. She was very anxious being she doesn’t speak French but it all worked out. Thank you Christian. All the staff at Hotel Relais Bosquet was friendly, courteous and very accommodating. The place in general was decorated beautifully and was very clean. Our breakfasts were tasty and free if you mention Rick Steves book. The location – OMG!!!! Convenient to the Eiffel Tower and all the different shops – cheese, wine, flowers, produce, chocolates, cafes, what more could a person want. Perfection. Don’t listen to all those stupid Americans who say the French are rude. Sorry, I am a Jersey Girl and I find many Americans to be rude, loud, arrogant and ignorant. Every time I walked into a store / bakery, etc. people said, “ bonjour”. Not once in all my life have sales people in any of the stores in the tri-state area said “good day”. I am lucky if I can get sales help. What I experienced in Paris was so different from NJ / NYC. The streets are so clean. Everyday you see them sweeping / hosing down the sidewalks. We have a lot to learn. Don’t believe all the propaganda that the French are rude. If you smile, be friendly and say “ bonjour”, you will have the best time, trust me. For the longest time my spouse wouldn’t step foot in Europe, now he can’t wait to visit other countries and this was all due to the fact of the positive experience we had. Au revoir & Merci.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: dragonfly37
Reviews.Content: From the moment I found this hotel in Rick Steves book I knew it would be fantastic. I checked reviews on Tripadvisor and then emailed the hotel to arrange for 3 rooms for 6 people. Christian emailed me back almost immediately with a special rate that included breakfast and tickets to the Louvre. I sent him several emails with questions and he answered them all patiently and when I got confused he even took the time to call and explain the details to me. (not something you would expect from a hotel in Paris when you are coming from Canada). He also arranged for a shuttle to and from the airport for us. The hotel and rooms were just as the website showed it, clean, bright, large and new. The breakfast was one of the best Europe has to offer and the service was incredible. Frederica at the front desk was just wonderful and unfortunately I can't remember the names of all the other people at the front desk but they were all so great at finding our destinations and tranportation as well as recommending places to see or dine at. We found the Hotel to be a great home base as the Eiffel Tower was only a very short walk away and the subway was only a couple of minute walk as well. Just outside your doorstep the Rue Cler area is full of great restaurants, cafe's, pastry shops, grocery stores and so much more. After a full day of site seeing you can come back and always find a great place to either relax, eat dinner or just enjoy the atmosphere in one of the many outdoor restaurant/cafe's.. We all would come back again and would recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to visit Paris. As a last note, everyone spoke perfect English if that is a problem for anyone. We can't thank everyone at the hotel enough for making our stay so wonderful and filled with great memories!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great first-time to Paris - Good location”
Reviews.Author: DMO_child
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Relais Bosquet back in May '08 (I'm a little late with this review). This was our first time to Paris. I definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone. I went through countless reviews of many hotels before finally deciding to stay here. The main reason for choosing this hotel was the price and the location. You are very close to the Eiffel Tower at this hotel, and our room actually had a view of the Tower out the window! We loved watching at night when the lights were flashing. So amazing! We did not try the breakfast they offer, as we wanted to get out into the city and experience the different cafes and restaurants. In hindsight, the breakfast seems a little overpriced compared to what we could get elsewhere. There are several cafes just a block from the hotel. Another thing we loved was Rue Cler. Several nights after a long day seeing the city, we would stop on Rue Cler before heading back to our room to get food, like an early light dinner snack. Just right down the street. I could go on and on about our experience, but I definitely recommend staying here. The Relais Bosquet is great if you want to be close to the Eiffel Tower; if you want the option to have a view of the Eiffel Tower from your room; if you want a nice cozy clean room; and you want to be close to a Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: flynn78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Relais Bosquet for 5 nights in June after getting a very good price on the Internet. The superior room was large, comfortable, clean and very quiet. The hotel is located in the Rue Cler area and is a short walk away from the Eiffel tower, a Metro line and many fine restaurants. The convenience of its location really can't be overstated. Paris is for walking and you can get around very well with the Relais Bosquet as your starting point. The front desk staff were very helpful throughout our stay, including booking the extremely enjoyable Paris Illumination tour for us. Although we took advantage of the breakfast buffet a couple of times for convenience sake, we found it a bit overpriced. Other than that, we have nothing but good things to say. There was free internet in the lobby which was much appreciated. This was a good choice for us and we recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel & staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Flymesoon
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in this hotel just before Christmas in 2008. Our first room was very nice, but tiny--for 2 people and luggage. The second night we were able to upgrade easily (for a slight increase in room rate) into a large, airy comfortable room. The beds in both rooms were quiet and comfortable and the rooms are attractive. And I loved the electric kettle so much I bought one for my office. I was delighted to see that the lobby has 2 computers for guests to check email and browse the internet--although Americans should be aware that there are some differences in the French keyboards (Where is the @?). The people who worked at the hotel were all really helpful--and tolerant of my long-ago studied French--from the managers to the housekeepers. Christian, the manager, was just charming. We also loved the neighborhood, which was not far from l'Ecole Militare and the Eiffel Tower. The hotel was about 3 blocks from a Metro station. There were lots of choices of nearby restaurants, and the hotel staff gave good recommendations. This was a great little hotel. I'd happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with terrific hospitality and location”
Reviews.Author: dbreid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Relais-Bosquet Paris and by far this is the best hotel we have ever stayed at for our price range. The hotel staff was so courteous and accomodating. The breakfast was delicious and lasted until 11:00. We stayed in Paris during the current heat wave that hit England and France and the air-conditioning was superb! Not used to being at such high latitudes, we were not prepared for it to still be light out at 11:00 at night, but the hotel was. Their light blocking shades were a delight and thoroughly effective. The neighborhood had cute affordable cafe's where the wait staff were familiar with English and happy to speak it. The hotel is located in a safe area and we would definitely recommend it to anyone. There was free internet in the lobby and a wonderful bakery one door down.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal service... Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Lagrandequeso
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were at the hotel between Jun 28 to Jul 4, 2009. We had a terrific stay and I would recommend this Hotel to any traveller looking for phenomenal value at this price range. It was a hotel oriented to folks who needed to be in town for business reasons (I was in for a conference), yet wanted to be in an excellent neighborhood where leisure and recreational activities were within reach. The one thing that really stood out in my mind was the exceptional service, and the super friendly atmosphere. Being quite busy, I was hard pressed to come up with an itinerary for things to do at night. Lucky for me, my email to the Hotel was received by Mr. Christian, at the concierge desk. He stayed in touch with me online, and made 4 reservations for dinner (at the OK L'affriole, sumptuous Le Florimond, exciting L'Ami Jean, and for the coup de grace: a marvelous dinner cruise on Bateaux Parisiens for our final night). I do not think one will get service like this anywhere else at a hotel at this price point (if you find another place, let me know). Mind you, it wasn't just Mr. Christian -- the other concierge staff were real nice too, and ready to help out (Ms. Frederica comes to mind). I plan to make return visits to Paris in the future, and I do look forward to coming back to Hotel Relais Bosquet!

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further”
Reviews.Author: MaryLouPhelps
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific choice for a conveniently located, friendly, and very clean hotel. I have stayed at many hotels in around 25 countries, and I cannot remember being so pleased with choosing a hotel as I was with Relais Bosquet. Save yourself lots of time trying to figure out where to stay in Paris, and trust the many, many people who have recommended this property. I am glad I did.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted with our choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: mgaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Relais Bosquet Tour Eiffel for four nights with friends. We had chosen to stay in Superior rooms and we were delighted with them. The rooms were extremely spacious (for Paris), clean and comfortable and the airconditioning worked well. The bed was very comfortable and we slept well, due also to the electronic window shutters. The staff were very helpful. The location was just perfect. Walking distance to lots of attractions and the Metro. The Rue Cler was just around the corner and provided an oasis for us in this busy city. A pedestrian street with cafes and food shops and a great atmosphere. We ate at the restaurants there every evening and enjoyed it! We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel as we felt it was a good choice and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravelerWDC
Reviews.Content: We have just concluded our sixth stay at the Relais Bosquet, this time with our 13 year old grandson. As with our past visits the staff was exceptionally helpful and exceedingly pleasant. When we were about to depart for dinner on our first night, a thunder storm occurred and within seconds the staff provided unbrellas and recommended a shortcut to our restaurant. Our room was a perfect accommodation for three and the service staff maintained the room in perfect order. The lobby and breakfast room have been redecorated to a very high standard and the two lobby computers have also been upgraded. This hotel is truly a Paris gem. We look forward to many more visits both as a couple and with family.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, exemplary customer service, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: LAtravelerKenner
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Relais Bosquet provided my wife and I exactly what we wanted: a small, local hotel in Paris that would let us immerse ourselves in a Parisian neighborhood and the Parisian lifestyle. The staff was incredibly helpful, friendly and welcoming. They went out of their way to make our stay a memorable part of our trip of a lifetime. We loved the intimacy of the dining room that actually encouraged conversation with other guests. We absolutely loved the Rue Cler neighborhood and the ambiance. We felt like we were residents there, never visitors or tourists. Our room was the right size; we had no complaints about the bathroom. Our view of the Eifel Tower was just perfect. We recommend the Hotel Relais Bosquet to anyone who is comtemplating a trip to Paris and wants to have more than a routine tourist visit. The Hotel and the neighborhood introduced us to the charm and warmth of the French people. We loved the Hotel Relais Bosquet.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Beat”
Reviews.Author: bobburgess
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and that usually says it all. The people could not be nicer the rooms are large for Paris The bathrooms are also large and the whole place is spotless. They have roll down blinds and double windows so it is very, very quiet. It is a block away from rue Cler and a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “A Room With A View”
Reviews.Author: Parisgirl69
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel because of the location and the good reviews we read on this website. We were very pleased. Our adventure began the minute we looked out our hotel window and saw the Eiffel Tower (Tour Eiffel, en francais). I knew how Dorothy felt when she said, "We're not in Kansas anymore, Toto." We booked our 7-night stay using the hotel's website and received a prompt response confirming our reservation. I emailed the hotel a week before we arrived to get info on day trips, etc, and received prompt responses and assistance setting up all the outings we requested, as well as a transfer from the airport. Our room was just like the pictures on the webite. By US standards the room was small, but we had plenty of room. There was a small dresser and armoire to hang clothing in plus a bench to store our suitcases; one on, one under. The bed was very comfortable and I miss the feather pillows. If you're tall, the bed may be short, but we had no complaints. The room staff kept everything neat and clean, with fresh towels and bathroom accessories daily. Our room, #54, was in the main building right on the street. There is a lot of traffic noise and nightlife, but with the window closed we couldn't hear a thing. We usually left the window open and didn't mind the noise - it was all part of the Paris experience. The few times we had the window closed, we used the a/c which worked wonderfully. There is a breakfast buffet available with a wonderful selection of breads, eggs, cold and warm meats, cheeses, fruit, cereal, yogurt, coffee, juices and the best butter we'd ever tasted. If you have the Rick Steves Paris 2009 book, as we did, breakfast is free (usually 15E per person). The front desk staff were friendly and helpful and very quick to speak English when our French left something to be desired. I do miss the friendly "bon jour" and "bon soir" we heard from them every day. I still have the urge to say it to strangers, just for the fun of it. The hotel location is wonderful and very safe. We were less than a minute away from two major bus stops and 5 minutes tops to the L'Ecole Militaire metro station. We found ourselves out walking late at night with no concerns for safety. The Rue Cler is about 1 block from the hotel with a wonderful bakery and several great restaurant options and is busy with locals and tourists alike. There is also a bakery next door with delicious baguettes, but I preferred Changement de Direction on the Rue Cler; their pastries were to die for and they gladly boxed several up for us to bring home on the plane. It made leaving Paris slightly less painful. By the time we left, we felt like we were leaving our favorite neighborhood. This was our first trip to Paris, to anywhere in Europe, and we hope to return and stay in this wonderful hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: thenutkin
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably priced small hotel in the "swanky seventh" arrondisement. Our room, a "superior", had a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower. The Tower is a short walk from the front door of the hotel and along the way you will pass interesting shops and restaurants. The Ecole Militaire metro is a couple of blocks away. The room was decently sized with cheerful colors. It had a flat-screen tv and a fridge. I was very adamant about having a room with air conditioning but the Parisian weather during our stay made the heater in the room a more useful feature. The small lobby features two computers for your use. Your touch-type speed will be slowed considerably unless you are accustomed to using a French keyboard. We had a few minor issues. The beds were very hard but given all the walking we did in Paris, we had no trouble sleeping. Also, the showerhead was a bit clogged so that the spray was erratic. Rather than have a full-width shower curtain, there was a partial glass door so that unless you were very careful, some shower water ended up on the floor. The breakfast is a little pricey at 15 euros but it is a nicely presented and high quality selection. The unintrusive desk staff was polite and helpful. There is a wonderful bakery on the corner and many shops and restaurants on nearby streets. For this expensive city, this is a good place to stay in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, small beds”
Reviews.Author: Kimkam26
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Paris with my 18 year old son to see the French Open. We wanted to spend a few days in Paris so I booked 4 days here using Travelocity. Part of the reason I picked this hotel was the recommendation of the Hotel Valadon front desk (# 12 on Trip Advisor) because it was full. Also the price seemed reasonable, $130 Euros for 2 twin beds. The location was great, we walked to the Eiffel Tower, to Musee D'orsay, to the Louvre, Hotel Invalides and really just all over. There are great restaurants everywhere, we walked to Rue St. Dominique for dinner twice. Rue Cler market street is just around the corner and it was awesome. Exactly what you envision Paris will be like. The staff was cordial but not friendly, and not overly helpful. I needed batteries and asked if the store across the street would have any and they told me no. What they didn't tell me was 5 addresses down was a Fran Prix market that had batteries and everything else you might need. When we needed to get to Roland Garros I asked the best method - taxi or metro. They recommended a taxi and called one for us. It cost 15 euros to get there and we could not find one to bring us home. We had to walk to a hotel a mile from Roland Garros and have them call us a taxi. Two days later when we had more tickets we decided to try the metro. The station was close to our hotel and took us straight to the stadium and cost us 1.60 euros each, quite a savings. Again, maybe they thought we were too dumb to figure it out on our own, but I was unhappy with their lack of guidance. Breakfast was adequate but expensive, 15 euros each for croissants, eggs, coffee and a fruit cup. It was advertised as 15 euros per room, but they insisited on charging us 15 each. We took advantage of the boulangerie on the corner and the Fran Prix to get our own breakfast after the first morning. Our view was a narrow courtyard and everyone else's window. That didn't really bother us. The beds however where too small for my 6 foot son and his feet hung over the end. He didn't sleep well while we were there. I guess upgrading to double beds may have been necessary for someone his size. The bathroom was very nice with nice toiletries, the towels were very large, but somewhat rough. They had free wi-fi which was very nice, our previous hotel charged for wi-fi. Bottom line, great location, clean rooms, nice bathroom, pleasant lobby, buy your breakfast elsewhere, don't get the twin beds if you're tall, and don't expect the staff to be overly helpful. We still enjoyed ourselves immensely and didn't let any of that bother us.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: jdydau
Reviews.Content: This was a great ,boutique hotel in the center of the rue cler neighborhood.We loved all the cafes ,shops and easy walk to the Eiffel Tower and Seine. The metro was just around the block,next to a wonderful restaurant for breakfast,le terrace. They even offer carafes of water,not just the bottled. The bus service is great from this hotel as well.We will be back for our 4th trip to paris,hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, Clean, Great Breakfast, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: maggiesmail
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect.. near the Rue Cler - a charming street....near the Eiffel Tower.- in fact, we had a view of the tower from our room (#55) It was clean, roomy, and had all the amenities...They had a 4-night package special so it was quite reasonable. We used the Rick Steve's book so our breakfast was free and it was so fresh and tasty...croissants, meats, cereal, eggs, orange juice...and the best cup of coffee.....the server was wonderful - he prepared a tray for my daughter one morning and brought it upstairs..I would recommend this hotel to anyone....

Reviews.Title: “Room With a View? A Warning”
Reviews.Author: Much2Learn
Reviews.Content: We booked after reading great reviews here. Unlike the reviewer whose room looked out over the Eiffel Tower, however, our room looked directly out over a small courtyard and directly into the windows of other guests. We were embarrassed to open our window one morning only to get a very clear view of a woman showering. The windows in the showers appear to have opaque glass, but if you expect to have privacy, please remember to close the fabric sheers. We did like the location and the room was clean and generous in size. Service was fine. The lobby is being remodeled now; the rooms could use some fresh carpet and paint soon, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Xeena
Reviews.Content: Superior Room - 130 €, free breakfast due to lobby painting going on during our stay, Wonderful Fluffy towels, good size room, good size bathroom, view of top of Eiffel tower from room, metal blackout shades on windows switch located right at head board, wifi included in room price, there are also two computers for free use in the lobby but they have French keyboard layout so not east to type off a quick e-mail Excellent breakfast with eggs, sausage, ham, jellies, toast, yogurt, fruit, pain du chocolate......... Staff friendly and helpful, room was ready when we arrived around 10:30 am, nice to be able to freshen up after 10 hour overnight flight. Liked the neighborhood, pleanty of places to eat, shop, do laundry, post office,

Reviews.Title: “Quite pleased”
Reviews.Author: Zurika
Reviews.Content: We were quite pleased with all aspects of this little hotel. The neighborhood is lively and interesting. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and had a bit of charm. The breakfast was somewhat limited in its offerings, but everything there was high quality and yummy. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place”
Reviews.Author: sccpm
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to France and spent 5 wonderful days at this hotel. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The room was great and the electric room-darkening shades came in very handy while we adjusted to the time change. I heard absolutely no noise from anywhere else in the hotel. Even though they were undergoing painting and renovations, it in no way interferred with our stay. I loved having access to the computers in the lobby and the breakfast each day was a real plus. The location was perfect for us as we both have minor disabilities and walking is difficult. We were able to walk to all the food markets in Rue Cler and the bakery next day was so convenient. There are several bus stops right around the corner which we used every day to navigate the city by bus. Never stepped foot in the Metro, we preffered riding above ground so we could see all the sights. I would rate this hotel as excellent in every way! I plan to visit my travel agent today to tell her about this wonderful hotel. She was not familiar with it and now she can add it to her list of great places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: SSRT
Reviews.Content: We stayed last year at this nice place, but somehow I could not get around to writing about it, until now! It was our first trip to Paris and yet we could easily manage at the hotel with the language handicap, as the area seemed frequented with American tourists. The hotel staff was discreet yet courteous and very helpful. It was a quiet residential neighbourhood, had nice cafes (albeit a little expensive), a supermarket, boulangerie, cheese boutique, post office etc. The subway was walking distance too. It is close to the Eiffel Tower, and you can see it from the front rooms in the the evening. The beds were clean and the AC worked nicely in the humid summer. The walls seemed thin enough to allow sounds to come in, but I hear that it is mostly like this for most Paris hotels. We couldnt breakfast in the hotel, but the spread seemed decent enough. All in all, we felt comfortable and welcome at the hotel and I would certainly not mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place!”
Reviews.Author: Birdie07
Reviews.Content: What a gem! A beautiful little hotel with a lot of Parisian character! Our room was comfortable, clean and quite large by Parisian standards. The location was fantastic, we could see the top of the Eiffel Tower from our room, which was only about a four minute walk away. There is a very nice patisserie next door which was handy for breakfast and snacks, and a great restaurant right across the road. All in all, great value for a lovely and convenient Paris stay!

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to "my home" in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Imelda L
Reviews.Content: Will be staying here once again in May for my 10th trip to Paris. Have stayed at various hotels and I finally found a place I can consider my home in Paris. Warm and welcoming staff especially Frederique truly contributes to the wonderful experience. As have been mentioned, lovely and comfortable rooms, great location and outstanding service all define this exceptional hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Bernie028
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in June 2008 and as described by others the hotel is wonderful. On the day I departed there was a strike and taxis were not available. The owner personally drove me to the station so I could catch the Eurostar on time. I did not realize who he was until I attempted to tip him and he refused. Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Lovely”
Reviews.Author: KDayOrlando_FL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem! Our room was spacious and very pretty, on the 6th floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower. The hotel staff, especially Christian at the Reception desk, was always happy to answer questions, give directions, or offer restaurant and sightseeing suggestions. The neighborhood is charming; cafes, restaurants, shops, and a daily street market. There are lovely churches and an abundance of boutiques one block away on Rue St. Dominique. Would we return--oh my, yes; if only for the beautiful tray of coffee and pastries delivered to our room each morning!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant experience.”
Reviews.Author: Kisha1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Relais Bosquet for 8 nights last May with my 21 year old daughter. Everything about it was great. The rooms were a good size for Paris, quiet, with electric blinds - we had a superior room. The breakfast was very good and served with attention. We overslept one morning and did not wake up until 11 at which point we ran downstairs and while all the breakfast dishes were being put away, it was with pleasure - or we felt it was- that the breakfast attendant made us coffee and breakfast. The location was just perfect for us. We walked everywhere and if we were tired and did not want to go too far for dinner, there are plenty of restaurants nearby. We are going to be in Paris again in August, and I booked the Relais Bosquet again.

Reviews.Title: “A LOVELY hotel! I can't wait to visit again soon!!!”
Reviews.Author: jodes42
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend a stay at the Hotel Relais Bosquet in Paris. My husband and I had a lovely time there. This was our first time visiting Paris and we felt welcome at once. The staff was very helpful with recommendations, reservations, and travel advice. The location is fantastic! Some rooms have gorgeous views of the Eifel Tower (just a few blocks away) and there is a charming outdoor market with plenty of wonderful cafes located just around the corner. The metro is also just a short walk away, making travel easy. I am in love with Paris and the Hotel Relais Bosquet!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with Great location at a Great price!!!!”
Reviews.Author: moonman111
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March and loved the hotel. First of all its in a great location (10-15min walk from most of the touristy stuff). Rue Cler is 30seconds away and so is the metro stop. The rooms were a good size (Europe standards) and the bathroom and water pressure in the shower were also great. The housekeeper always cleaned our room and bathroom and it was spotless everytime we came back from a long day out on the town. We could also see the top half of Eiffel tower from our hotel window. All that for 105 Euros a night is a great bargain. i will def be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location for first time visitors to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Thumper74
Reviews.Content: Celebrating 35 years of marriage, we crossed our fingers and reserved a superior room with the Hotel Relais Bosquet through their on-line website. Polite, professional and courteous, the English-speaking staff anticipated and met our every need. They arranged a Yellow Van to meet us at the CDG airport (36E for two) and then reserved a return trip shuttle for our departure as well. They gave easy-to-follow directions for taking buses and metro and literally saved us hundreds of euros for our day trip to Versailles with directions on how to take the right train. The room was very clean with fresh linens and towels every day; the electric room darkening shades were a plus for late afternoon power naps. It was also lovely to have an electric "hot pot" for having tea or coffee in the room. Although some travellers may have been put off or inconvenienced by the on-going renovation to the lobby, we left early each day and returned early each evening so experienced very little inconvenience to mention. Nonetheless, the staff offered us an additional discount on our room and the one day we could not use the elevator, provided us with a complimentary bottle of champagne! We were about a 15-minute walk from the Eiffel Tower (which we could partially see from our room #33!) and an equal distance to Des Invalides in the opposite direction. The markets and cafes of Rue Cler were less than a block from our door. Served from 7-11am, the breakfast is quite adequate with eggs, sausage, ham, fruit, juice, coffee/tea, yogurt, breads and cereals. (Ask for the "Rick Steves discount" to have this included as a complimentary breakfast ). Go early for a clean tablecloth! For ordering on-line, we also had our choice of a free pair of tickets: the Louvre or Andy Warhol exhibit. We strongly recommend purchasing the Museum Pass...we stayed a week and purchased the 4-day pass which included Versailles and most major sites. (Using the free hotel tickets to the Louvre bought us an extra day on the museum pass for other venues since some museums are closed Mondays and others on Tuesdays). This was a great 2nd honeymoon and as first time visitors to Paris, we recommend the Relais Bosquet to all!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: mskittyPortland
Reviews.Content: I booked the Relais Bosquet based on its terrific reviews on Trip Advisor and Rick Steves. The property lived up to its expectations except for one small issue... it was undergoing a major remodel to the entire lobby and main level. In my more than dozen email communications regarding my seven (7) day stay, nobody once bothered to mention the construction. There was lots of noise; and the usual camaraderie I've come to experience in breakfast rooms of European hotels didn't take place as I chose to eat in my room. They did upgrade my room as compensation, and I really did appreciate it. Try to avoid rooms next to the elevator. That said, everything else was terrific. Breakfast was awesome, but the highlight was the STAFF Leo, Frederica, and Christian. All were superb and very helpful. I miss them already! I cant wait to see the Relais Bosquet remodel on my next visit, I couldn't possibly stay anywhere else. Great location too!

Reviews.Title: “Website looks better than it really is...”
Reviews.Author: ozmadmax
Reviews.Content: ...now that isn't a first but it has to be said that the website doesn't show the public areas and reception, elevators and some of the more pokey areas of the hotel. Ok, so I've started off a bit harsh. Check in was robotic, not a word spoken (late evening) but service was a bit more friendly the following day. Breakfast was typically small in choice and volume as per most hotels in Paris. Rooms were ok, although could do with a bit of a refresh here and there. Location is good for sightseeing and is close to some cool restaurtants and bars (turn right when you exit the hotel), post office and late night food shopping. Free internet access in reception was useful. Whilst not "Very good" - better than average for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SomersetReporter
Reviews.Content: We have found it difficult to find a good value hotel in Paris and previous trips have always left us a little disappointed by some aspect of the stay. But now at last we have. Great location, lovely rooms, great service. Stayed in this hotel for Valentine's Day and help received from Christian at the hotel before and during the stay was fantastic, they really went that extra mile to help us out in arrangements at the last minute and make it a great weekend. Unhesitatingly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: viajeelmundo
Reviews.Content: HRB is a small, clean hotel that I would recommend as a basecamp for your trip. We were constantly sightseeing and only used the hotel to shower and sleep. The hotel was perfect for us if that is the kind of trip you are expecting. We had room #13 which was considered a superior room which for Americans is equivalant to a standard room. I can't imagine how small the standard rooms are. Positives: The room was very clean - the carpets and sheets especially. The bathroom looked updated and everyday it was cleaned very well by housekeeping. This room faced the street and the window had electronic shutters that you could close at night to keep the noise and light out (which were not at all an issue). The hotel is in the Rue Cler district where you can experience true Parisian life - no tourist shops here. This is the best part of the hotel. You can walk around the area and enjoy all the small shops and cafes. You can walk to the Eiffel Tour. Free internet in the lobby. Good value! Staff was very friendly and most spoke English. Negatives: In this room the toilet was in a seperate area than the shower and sink and that small room had no fan or window. There was a constant moldy smell there. There is a metro but it is 2.5 blocks away and you do have to switch trains to go to the tourist attractions which is a hassle. There is a taxi stand 1.5 blocks away but of course that is more money. Very hard beds and very soft pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: ILuvLexie
Reviews.Content: My Paris trip was last August so I am a bit tardy in writing this review but I just wanted to say a few things about this charming hotel. We were a large family with children ages 6 to 14, a 76 year old grandmother and several adults traveling for eight days. We stayed at the hotel for five nights and had three rooms. The location is wonderful. Just off the Rue Cler... every morning my sisters and I walked to the market for coffee and croissants. The rooms have all the modern amenities and were very comfortable. We even had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our small balcony. The staff was polite and helpful but unobtrusive. The metro is a short walk around the corner. We are traveling to a different European city this summer and I find myself looking for a similar accommodation. A great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: aspine67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - 10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower, 1 minute from restaurants, bakeries and supermarkets in the Rue Cler area, and about 3 minutes from the Ecole Militaire metro station. There's even a direct bus to the Champs Elysees outside the hotel, although we never used it (took the metro). It's a very safe area and we didn't have any problems walking back from the Eiffel Tower at 10pm at night. The free Internet access in the lobby is brilliant. Must do: You must go up the Eiffel Tower at night - 9pm is a good time as the queues are shorter. The lights on the Eiffel Tower flash for 10 minutes on the hour at nights and it's the most beautiful sight. Must try: crepes at Cafe Ulysse en Gaul, breakfast at Cafe du Marche (both at Rue Cler), across from the hotel - Fontaine de Jade for good Chinese food and Le Bosquet for excellent French onion soup, and Punjab restaurant (1 minute past the Ecole Militaire station) for great Indian food and some of the best restaurant service in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Paris at Hotel Relais-Bosquet”
Reviews.Author: jpi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 3 star Hotel Relais-Bosquet in the RueCler district and it was 2 blocks from Eiffel Tower park. Everything was right outside our hotel and the metro 1 block away. This is the second time we have stayed in this district but this location and hotel was very good. Recommended by Rick Steves, we got free breakfast which was good. Also, booked an online special so it was only 130 euros/night with free breakfast and 2 tickets to the Louve. The desk personel were very helpful with all our needs. Extras:Two free computers available in the lobby; clean and neat even tho the building was on the older side; updated room with big bed and wonderful fresh feeling sheets; flat screen TV (in case you need CNN); two wastebaskets in room; refrigerator in room with coffee/tea making service; updated bathroom with separate room for toilet; big, fluffy towels. Restaurants in the area are abundant from small cafes to full scale. The bakeri around the corner is wonderful and a grocery store that sells good inexpensive wine just by the metro. I would stay at the HOtel Relias-Bosquet again and recommend it for a true Parisian experience in a wonderful neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: ColWarne
Reviews.Content: I've used quite a few Paris hotels and this was certainly an excellent choice. A very comfortable hotel in a very nice district of Paris, with easy travel to all the attractions. Staff extremely helpful - for example, when we were wrongly told that breakfast was served until 12 on the Sunday and we appeared at 11.15 to find the room being vacuumed, we were immediately offered what turned out to be an excellent (and cheaper!) breakfast in the room. The costs of the room compared well with Paris hotels generally, especially the reduced rate for 3 days. Tea and coffee facilities are provided, which is often not the case in Paris. Decent size bath towels too! Minor quibbles were the fact that free internet was provided, but that the signal was very weak in the room we had. However, there are two free computers to use in the very comfortable reception area. And there was some minor sound disturbance from water draining from another room and people using the stairs, but we were so tired it didn't matter. I’ve already booked to stay there again, on business, so that's got to be the best recommendation. PS: The restaurant recommended by reception - Le Bosquet, over the road - was excellent and very reasonably priced. It’s also worth travelling into the Marais to eat at L'Epouvanteil (6 rue de Jarente). Lovely food from a three course menu @ 28€ and a brilliant host, who really wanted a group of 10 of us to enjoy our time there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelllorNy
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel.. ideal location with great places to eat 1 block away.. main bus to the city-champ de elyses, louvre 2 blocks away and metro ideally located 3 blocks away.. free internet, free tray for cofee....The staff is really phenomenal who are ready to help for anything you need.... further many city tours will pick up at the hotel including the airport taxi... Overall excellent.. definitely a great hotel to stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice & convienant hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovesToTravelAround
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. There are good restaurants near by and you can get cheese and bread from the market stand to take back to your room. I only stayed 1 night at this hotel (quick stop on my way to Italy) but it was a great night. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The black-out blinds help ensure you get a good nights sleep. I had a view of the Eiffel Tower from my room - it was spectacular to look out and see it lit up at night. The metro is just a few minutes walk from the hotel and the Eiffel Tower is in walking distance as well as many other sites. On this trip to Paris I went to the Musee D'Orsay - if you can try to get there - you will not be disappointed. Since this hotel is so close to the Sienne, if you are able to do so, I suggest walking along the river to see the artists work on your way to Notre Dame - then, if you can, stop to have a bite to eat in one of the outdoor cafes in the Latin Quarter. The view from the top of Notre Dame is quite amazing and it was great seeing the Gargoyles up close. Remember to bring your umbrella with you at all times because what might start out as a beautiful sunny day can end up as a rainy day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ralais Bosquet Paris- 'Fabulous'”
Reviews.Author: c1119
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from a trip to Paris and we couldn't have picked a more perfect hotel. Hotel Relais Bosquet is in an adorable neighborhood. We were a few blocks from a metro station and one block from a picturesque walking street where we could shop at boutiques or purchase fresh fruit, flowers, meats and cheeses. Or sit at one of the many cafes and people watch. Two doors down from the hotel is a wonderful corner bakery where we purchased sandwiches and then walked two blocks and ate in the park with a breathtaking view of the Eiffel Tower. The first impression from the staff was very telling. I e-mailed the hotel while in the states to get information and received an immediate response from one of the employees, Christian, our new french friend. Their personal touch sets them far above other hotels that I have stayed with on previous travels. I hope to return to Paris soon and I will definitely be staying at Hotel Relais Bosquet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Experience”
Reviews.Author: RBL52
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Hotel Relais Bosquet for a week ending on November 20, 2008. We had done extensive research about the hotel and were thrilled to find the positive comments we had read were justified. The staff at Relais Bosquet could not have been more accommodating and helpful with information, especially bus and metro directions and restaurant recommendations and reservations. Their genuineness and willingness to help made our stay so comfortable. Our room was on the top floor (#64) and the view out the window at night of the twinkling Eiffel Tower was magnificent. The electric blinds and quiet neighborhood made sleeping very conducive, which was quite helpful. We felt it was a bargain, especially for the size of the room and bathroom facilities, at 205E a night. The Rue Cler neighborhood in which Relais Bosquet is located was perfect. It is walkable to many places (stores, outdoor markets, bistros, boulangeries, patisseries) and also situated near 3 metro stops and 2 bus lines, all which helped us to see as much of Paris as we could in the most efficient manner. It is a perfect location to see the traditional tourist sights of Paris, while providing a quiet nieghborhood at the end of the day to return to and have a glass of wine while watching Parisians on their way home from work stopping at Rue Cler's many outdoor markets. The best part of the hotel's neighborhood is the abundance of truly excellent well-priced restaurants offering various styles of cuisine, from modern trendy French, Basque, traditional French, bistro food - all priced very competitively. It is our pleasure to highly recommend Hotel Relais Bosquet, its personnel (Christian, in particular), its location and its ambience to all age groups. (Even though there were no children at the hotel when we were there, it would be a perfect location to stay with children, as the surrounding Rue Cler market area and park near the Eiffel Tower would provide great areas for children to run and play.)

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: funtimes7
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel in terrific location so that you can walk to Lots of landmarks! Christian was the most welcoming, helpful hotelier we encountered on our vacation! He send tons of information prior to our trip and was so warm upon our arrival. The room is small (typical European) but clean and had terrific blackout shades! highly recommend this hotel and will stay here if we are in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Location makes this hotel a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: davidleeds
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of what has been said about the hotel. I'm a Rick Steves fan and his tips make all the difference in our trips. The location is perfect for walking or buses or the metro. The restaurants in the area make a stay in Paris affordable as did the food shops. We liked Tribeca the best and it is really great value with a main course including tip and tax from 9 - 11 euros . It is a pity that all the outdoor eating is really off limits if you aren't a smoker. The hotel itself is somewhat tired in the public areas and there are plans to redo it sometime in the future. I was initially put off by the amount of dust on the carpet in the halls and am surprised it hasn't been noted in any review. We had a superior room in the courtyard which we requested.and it was very clean. It was a good size with lots of storage, two large windows in the bedroom and one in the bathroom and very quiet in terms of noise from the outside. While smoking is permitted there was no hint of smoke.The windows were always left open by the cleaning staff and the room felt fresh and airy. The bathroom had a big tub and shower which was great and double sinks with lots of counter space and there was always hot water. It is also great if you have to rinse out clothes and hang them up since there are racks that work really well. The one drawback was the toilet which was in a separate room but it was across the room from the bathroom and felt very closed in. It was beside the bed and the sound of flushing from other rooms could be heard. The breakfast was ample and the staff serving it excellent. Christian and the other men at the front desk were all pleasant and very helpful. While I have noted some issues with the hotel I would still recommend it highly. The tea/coffee bar in the room was a plus and having real china and cutlery a nice touch. We felt comfortable, safe and happy with our choice of hotel and neighbourhood

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Europe_rules
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful location, right off of the pedestrian street Rue Cler. The staff in the hotel are super friendly, speak perfect English and are very helpful. Seems like most people staying there have a Rick Steves book in their possession. Most of the guests were Americans when we were there in September. The breakfast is very nice, it is free if you mention that you have a Rick Steve's book. Try the restaurant, Leo the Lion, located 2 blocks away for a wonderful meal. There is a Metro stop within a 2 minute walk. This hotel will certainly have us as repeat customers.

Reviews.Title: “Ooh la la!”
Reviews.Author: pomodoroCt
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel in the perfect neighborhood, Rue Cler. Fantastic staff, delightful petit dejeuner, lovely room and spacious bath, immaculate. A place you wish never to leave and are eager to return. Whatever you need, it's there, in this sweet small property that lets you feel like a Parisian. I still swoon over our time there and have pictures on my nightstand....do stay there, you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!”
Reviews.Author: OhioDiane
Reviews.Content: We really loved everything about Hotel Relais Bosquet. The front desk staff spoke perfect English and were so helpful. They gave us restaurant recommendations, maps, tips for the metro, and really went out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable. A special thank you to Frederica & Christian!! We stayed in room #55 which had a nice view of the Eiffel Tower. We especially liked having coffee and tea fixings in the room along with a nice fridge to store water etc. The room was spotless and well appointed. We highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Relais Bosquet”
Reviews.Author: Mazowin
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Hotel Relais Bosquet in early October. The hotel is extremely comfortable and cheerful, rooms are ample in size for two people, and the closet space is exceptional. I loved the bathroom with an actual shower door (important for Americans who are used to shower curtains/doors). One morning the light in the toilet room was burned out---we meant to tell the front desk but forgot. Nevertheless, the light was replaced by the time we returned to our room in the afternoon. Good attention to details here. We faced the street with two large windows, but we never heard any street noise unless we wanted to. Location cannot be beat---access to the Metro, Rue Cler, and city buses is very easy. The hotel is within walking distance of major sights, and there are many restaurants and cafes nearby. Frederique at the front desk was extremely helpful with making dinner reservations and calling cabs, and she did it all with a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: baillie9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on our friend's recommendation and we were really impressed with the friendly service and convenient location. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. The reception staff helped with our restaurant bookings and gave some useful recommendations for local shopping. There are so many wonderful cafes, bakeries, chocolate shops to die for - so closeby. It is only 5 minutes walk to the nearest Metro station.We would highly recommend the hotel as good value for families like us from Australia

Reviews.Title: “Very happy!”
Reviews.Author: RogueFour
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Relais Bosquet for three nights in early September. We were very pleased. First, the location was terrific ... close to the Eiffel Tower, restaurants and the metro. There was also a great little bistro across the street that we visited often. We arrived early, and even though breakfast was technically over, they allowed us to eat and served us coffee as we waited for our room to be readied. They let us store our luggage as well. We stayed the first two nights in a standard room. Wow, a view of the Eiffel Tower! Sure, it was a small room, but I have stayed in smaller in Europe, so it wasn't a problem. We knew in advance we would have to switch rooms to a superior for the third night (we booked late and that was the only way they could accommodate). We packed our stuff, but just had to leave it in the room and the attendants moved it for us! The superior room, well, what can I say? Wish we would have booked it for all three nights if we could have. Very roomy for Europe, and of course, we also once again got the Eiffel view! Great base for Paris, clean, with free wireless in the room. You should feel very comfortable reserving this boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice for Paris”
Reviews.Author: lmg11
Reviews.Content: We were really happy with this hotel. We booked two rooms online, and the management immediately sent an email notifying us that our request for rooms together would be accommodated. The rooms were clean and comfortable, with good air conditioning. The hotel provide free wireless internet with 2 stations in the lobby for guests. The location is very good, you can walk to the Eiffel Tower, there are great restaurants and bakeries on Rue Cler on the next block, and the Metro stop is close by. We would definitely stay here again (and I hope we get the chance!)

Reviews.Title: “Our little secret in Paris. Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: traveller30
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last February for our trip in September. We were a group of 6 and took two superior rooms and two standard rooms.
