Christian is valuable asset to this hotel as the service I received from the time of booking to our departure was notting short of excellant. Nothing was a problem and every email was answered in the most professional manner. The hotel is small and holds a cosy character in a beautiful area of Paris. Our room was on the 5th Floor and was a very good size. The beds are very comfortable and the decor was gorgeous. We had a great view of the Eiffel Tower from the second floor up and what a sight it is to see it sparkling a night. The bathroom was very nice and absolutely spotless clean. Our room was cleaned every day with fresh towels replaced. Tea and coffee facilites and the flat screen tv has Sky News, Cnn and BBC. Air conditioning is available and they have fantastic free internet facilities in the lobby. The staff make this hotel, they are extremely friendly, helpfull and welcoming. Christian organised our shuttle transfer to and from the airport which was so handy, and spot on time. It is a mere 20 minute walk from Le Tour Eiffel and the Seine. The area is quaint, stylish and typical French and has a very relaxing atmosphere. There are some gorgeous restaurants and cafe's in the immediate area. It was wonderful to sit outside with a beer or glass of wine and watch the world go by. We will definately be returning to the Relais Bosquet for many years to come and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel whether you are with friends or taking a romantic break, you will not be disappointed. I nearly don't want to tell anyone about this hotel, because I want to keep it our little secret. We just loved it and send a special thank you to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidayloverFalkirk
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in really nice area with good access to métro and nearby monuments such as Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides. Very clean and comfortable with great continental breakfast as well as polite serivice. Stayed in Room 33 (superior) which is one of largest rooms we've stayed in in Paris with great view of top of Eiffel Tower. Would not hesitate to recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Book. This. Hotel. Now!”
Reviews.Author: travel_bug_europe
Reviews.Content: The Relais Boquet is by far the best Parisian hotel I've ever stayed in. It's a small home away from home. We had a standard and a superior room, and the small touches in the superior make it worth the few extra dollars a night. Double sinks, larger bathroom, larger LCD TV and slightly larger room with the most comfortable bed! A/C, plates, wine glasses, and coffee service in all rooms. Great for having wine and cheese in the room. I can't say enough about the location (two blocks from Ecole Militare metro stop and in the middle of the 7th Arr. near the Eiffel Tower), the shops in the area, the staff (most pleasant I've encountered on my many trips to Paris) and the room itself. The restaurant across the street (Le Bosquet) is great food and well priced, also friendly staff there! Book it now, availability goes fast as people are discovering this place at a rapid rate. This is my new home in Paris for years to come. You won't find a better price/quality ratio in Paris! A BIG recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful "home-away-from-home"”
Reviews.Author: donsue1986
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Relais Bousquet was simply charming. Cozy and extremely clean. Nice reception area. Elevator available to upper floors (although it is extemely small). Room was nice. Had light blocking shades (nice for an afternoon nap!). Had A/C (a real find in Paris!!). If you use the Rick Steve site, you get free breakfast! We didn't know that until the day we checked out. Great area. Lots of wonderful cafes and groceries. Walking distance to Eiffel Tower (great night light show). Convenient to Metro (L'ecole militaire). A wonderful hotel. We'd go back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: bnparks
Reviews.Content: A wonderful Hotel located centrally in Paris. Great charm within, quite neighbourhood, and good restaurants nearby as well as other amenities such a laundry. Compliments to Christian as he is a great help both during all our booking questions and during our stay. Highly recommend a stay at the Hotel Relais Bosquet!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in quiet part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: enjoytravel_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Relais Bosquet during September 2005. It was our first trip to Paris and we thoroughly enjoyed staying at this charming hotel. The size of the room was adequate. The hotel staff was very friendly and informative. I especially liked the location of this hotel. It was in Rue Cler area and we enjoyed the short walking distance away from the Eiffel Tower. We walked to the Eiffel Tower in the evening couple times to enjoy the beautiful lights! There is a great cute bistro down the street called Cafe du Marche as well as assortment of bakeries, chocolatier, and other great eateries down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little hotel”
Reviews.Author: brianc_li
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based on the positive TA reviews and was not dissapointed. The hotel is in, what to me is the nicest part of Paris, the 7th Arrondissment. The area, whilst close to many of the towns main tourist sites, retains a charm an a "residential feel" to it which is missing in many other parts of the city. It is an upper end, three star, property. We were in a standard room, no. 34. It was spotlessly clean and very well equipped with, amongst other things, air conditioning, a mini bar, flat screen TV and safe. It wasn´t particularly large but perfectly adequate for the two of us. The bathroom was a decent size with a good powerful shower in the smallish bath tub, adequate toiletries and big, fluffy towels. Free internet access in the lobby was a nice added touch. This is not ,by any means, a super deluxe hotel. Don´t expect a doorman, 24 hour room service, etc. That said, it is clean, friendly and very comfortable. It fully deserves is high rating in the TA reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for our family”
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day European vacation with four nights at this hotel. It was our first when we arrived in Paris. I can not say enough good things about this hotel. They were very very accomodating to our family of six. We have four children so finding an adequate place to stay for 4 nights in a good location is not easy without spending a fortune. We stayed in two superior rooms with an extra bed in each one. The rooms were a nice size with a hallway and a closet to store things such as suitcases out of the way. The rooms had a mini bar which could also fit in a few things that you had purchased at the grocery. They also had free wi fi in the rooms which was so easy to use. Even the Hilton is paris charges over $30 for wi fi for one night. This came in very handy as my wallet was pickpocketed from my zipped purse when we arrived on our first metro ride. My advice for ladies is not to be dumb like me and leave that purse it home. We are Rick STeve's readers so we requested the free breakfast. Rick Steves has advice for paris that more than pays for his book. This hotel was part of that. Free breakfast for a family of 6 is worth about $75 US a day. The location was excellent. There was a grocery called Franix (I believe) within steps of the hotel so we could stock up on food for our back pack to eat while we were out. Eating at sit down anything is hard for a family so this was great for us. The wine selection there was great and very inexpensive. The personnel at the hotel especially Christian was wonderful. They helped in any way that they possibly good to offer advice, and point you to the right metro. Another wonderful addition to this hotel was that they had a great ice machine in the lobby. We did not find this any where else on our trip. I am sure it was added esp for all of the ice hungry americans that come to this hotel. The neighborhood around this area was very safe and quiet. The Rue Cler with it's markets is so close. Don't miss this wonderful hotel. You will not be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hotel in Rue Cler area”
Reviews.Author: BeHappyM8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because from our Trip Advisor Research it appeared to be the nicest of the Hotels in the Rue Cler area. And it was! From the moment Frederica welcomed us by name to the time our pick up van took us to the airport, Frederica was a welcome font of knowledge and information and maps and suggestions. And what she couldn’t help us with, the two free internet computers in the hotel’s pretty lobby solved for us. Our room a double superior room, was exactly what we were hoping for in Paris, elegantly furnished with a view of the Eiffel Tower that we marvelled at day and night. The room was ample with a big, comfortable bed, two large windows for light, a big TV, desk and room safe. The windows had electric shutters to block out the light and the noise so we slept soundly after our days of wandering the beautiful streets of Paris. The bathroom was a good size with a strong hot shower and a separate toilet in another room, almost unheard of in Europe. There was also a walk in wardrobe with an automatic light that activated as you walked past it which was particularly useful for those that need to visit the toilet in the middle of the night. Breakfast was not included but there was a bakery on the corner to the left and Rue Cler with multiple cafes and another bakery to the right. Rue Cler is just the most beautiful market street, especially on a Sunday, and definitely worth a visit. The close proximity of Relais Bosquet to the Eiffel Tower, a really good landmark to get you back home, The Ecole Militaire, the Invalides, the hop on – hop off bus, the Metro and heaps of cafes and brasseries make this an excellent yet not too touristy location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great location for seeing Paris”
Reviews.Author: TravelingWill
Reviews.Content: The two of us stayed for a week in May 2008. The hotel is a ten-minute walk from the Eiffel Tower and the Seine. The rooms were very clean, and the staff was helpful when giving advice or making a special dinner reservation. The rooms are air conditioned, and after spending a day around the city, the cool room at night was truly welcomed. Our room's window overlooked the street, but there was little street noise. There are room-darkening shades so you can sleep in if you want. Our room was a standard room with a double bed. We didn't spend much time in the room--gone all day and in the room only for unwinding after dinner and for sleeping. With its great location and friendly staff, the hotel served its role superbly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Paris Neighbourhood Experience”
Reviews.Author: Elsbeth&Damian
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the Rick Steves travel guide, and were completely satisfied with the rooms, the breakfast, the service and the helpful staff. The location alone will have us stay there again-- the Rue Cler neighbourhood isn't a touristy area, despite its proximity to major attractions. The market street is lovely to stroll, and there are great restaurants nearby. We are middle aged travelling without children, and this hotel met all of our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daisybelle65
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on Rick Steves Paris Tour Book. Very well located in the Rue Cler area. Very quiet location. We had a superior room on the 3rd floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower - lovely. When we checked in we mentioned Rick Steves Book and were given complimentary breakfast - saved money and was delicious. Room service of the complimentary breakfast was also included. The room and bathroom were a nice size for Europe and clean with very adequate air conditioning. It is not terribly hot in Paris but can be very muggy and humid so the air conditioning is welcome. Plus you can keep the window closed avoiding listening to the street noise. We spent 8 days there and were very comfortable. The rooms have an electric room darkening shade that is great. The only problem was that sometimes with jet lag we woke late because of the darkness. The staff was always helpful and internet access was free and very accessible in the lobby. The area has many restaurants to choose from and is within easy walking of the metro. It was also conveniently located to the #69 bus which traverses the city and all the major historical sites. We knew of this bus from reading Rick Steves book. The Eiffel Tower was about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel and since it stays light out until 10:30 PM a late picnic at the tower was very nice after a long day sightseeing. Would definitely stay at this hotel again and thank Rick Steves for the recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: Raddie28
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this hotel in Paris we weren't disappointed. This hotel has a great location. We had a view from our window of the Eiffel Tower - fabulous! Just around the corner were many quaint little eateries. It was within walking distance to a few of the attractions in Paris. We stayed in a deluxe room which we found comfortable. You don't really spend alot of your time in Paris in the room anyway - if you do you may need to figure out why. I wouldn't hestitate in recommending this hotel to anyone. I will certainly be looking it up again when I revisit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShellOb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Relais Bosquet with my partner early in June. The hotel is situated around the corner from one of Paris' most renowned streets, Rue Cler. Rue Cler is a cobble stoned street lined with fabulous produce stores. It really comes alive on Tuesday-Saturday where you can find great fruit/veges, deli, cheese shops, bakeries etc, as well as a few decent restaurants (Tribeca is good), and around the other corner, Bosquet is also great. I would definitely not consider eating breakfast at the hotel as it costs 15 euro per person. The room itself was small but liveable, and the bathroom was fine. The metro is about a 5 min walk from the hotel. Eiffel Tower is 10 mins walk from the hotel. The metro is a breeze, and is a great & efficient way to get around the city. I would definitely stay at Relais Bosquet again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusanLLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Hotel Relais Bosquet in one of their superior rooms. The room was a very nice size with a dresser and wardrobe for our clothes. Our room and bathroom were both very clean. The hotel provided nice bathroom amenities and there was a regular hair dryer which was great. My only very small criticism is that the housekeeping staff was not very good about replacing things, but as soon as we told the front desk it was taken care of. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and included in the special rate we got. If it had not been included it would have been 15 euros per person, pretty expensive. The buffet had juice, cereal, fresh fruit, ham and cheese, wonderful rolls, croissants and pastries and a couple of hot items. The coffee each morning was excellent . The fellow who ran the breakfast room was terrific. There is free internet access which was very nice. Everyone at the front desk was very friendly, helpful and accommodating. In particular, Frederique and Christian were outstanding. They always went the extra mile for us. For example, when Frederique checked a website for us she wasn't sure if the information was up to date so she called them and got the correct (and completely different) information. The Relais Bosquet is located right near Rue Cler which is a real neighborhood street, with lots of places to eat, and every kind of store (fruit, cheese, bakery, etc.). It's a great location, convenient to the Metro and within easy walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides and other sites. I would love to stay there again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: barley5
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Relais Bosquet our last night in France, and by the time we got there, we were very tired. Fortunately, the bed was plenty big enough for us (two fairly large people) and the hotel room was large and pleasantly decorated. We could see the top of the Eiffel tower from our room, and it was a short walk to see it. Breakfast was a bit expensive, but it was very good. There was a problem with our reservation, they had us down for the wrong day, but it was corrected and we were given our room in a reasonable amount of time. On the day we were checking out, we weren't leaving until later in the day, the hotel nicely allowed us to store our luggage until we were ready to go, about 3 in the afternoon. After we returned home, I was charged a fee for not showing up on the day they thought we had made our reservation for...one phone call cleared the situation up with their apologies. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “My Paris Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lmllvm
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! Whenever I go to Paris, I will stay there. It is not very big nor is it very fancy but it is in a perfect location. It is close to all forms of transportation and within walking distance of quite a few popular sites. The rooms are small but very neat and clean. The beds are WONDERFUL! I had never slept on a springless mattress and I want one! The staff was excellent! I love them! They were so helpful and fun. We laughed with them all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful in every respect. Loved the Relais Bosquet.”
Reviews.Author: JeffreyN
Reviews.Content: This clean, charming, small hotel is located right in the heart of the 7th arrondisemont and adjacent to the Rue Cler market. The hotel is upscale and professional in every respect. It actually exceeded our expectations, and this was our 4th visit to beautiful Paris. The staff of Girard, Christian and Frederica are very professional and helpful. The superior room was spacious by European standards and the bed was firmer and newer than our bed at home. The room was cleaned and kept immaculate every day. We stayed 7 days. Each day we enjoyed the excellent breakfast and coffee, which other reviewers under-rate. Of course we received the breakfast for free, because we found the hotel through Rick Steves recommendation. We had a nice view of the Eiffel Tower, convenient internet access for our email, and wide screen TV. The bathroom was also very good with everything you need. See if you can request room 64, it is perfect. In summary, this hotel deserves all the high praise it receives. We intend to return to the Relais Bosquet on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rji1962
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights last week. This is the perfect little hotel to stay in central Paris. It belies its rating as a 3 star. Free internet, flat screen tv with english news channels and Villeroy and Boch crockery in the rooms are not to be found in comparable hotels elsewhere. The rooms, whilst small, are impecably clean (more so than many 5 star hotels we have been to in other parts of the world). Its location next to the Rue Cler, metro and walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, Invalides and Rodin Musuem make it very well placed. The italian restaurant along the Rue do Champ d De Mer is very good, esp if you are a veggie. The most important thing however, is the front desk team's care. Unfortunately another guest somehow checked out with one of our bags but the front desk team were hugely embarrased. Accordingly, not only did they compensate us for this (without us asking or expecting) but they traced the bag and send it on to us in the UK, no doubt at quite a cost to them. Personally, I think that is exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Live like a Parisian!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra909
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days in May 2008 for our first trip to Paris. At first glance the hotel felt small and maybe a tad worn around the edges, but within a few days the nice location and great staff had won me over completely and I would gladly stay here again. The hotel was quiet, comfortable, and clean. Our room looked over the small courtyard and we never heard any traffic or noise. The small frig in the room was great for storing our purchases from the Rue Cler market street (that is just as cute as the pictures show) and from the fresh bread bakery next door. It was nice to stay in a small hotel with local flavor that didn't feel like a chain hotel. The neighborhood is safe and clean. Metro is located 1 block away and Rue Cler is on the corner. The Eiffel tower is also a short walk away. Free internet terminals in the lobby. The staff was also very helpful. They helped us locate a lost piece of luggage, gave us maps and directions, recommended restaurants, and were able to book a last minute shuttle to the airport. The hotel was great to come home to after a long day of sightseeing. In fact, we spent one rainy day just hanging out in the neighborhood because it was too perfect to leave. You will quickly get into the habit of going to the bakery for bread in the morning, buying fresh fruit on Rue Cler, and greeting the locals as you head back to your hotel or sit at one of the many cafe's in the neighborhood. Some people may find the neighborhood too quiet, or may expect more amenities from a hotel, but for us it turned out to be just right and far away from the tourist crowds, which is just what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Just delightful!”
Reviews.Author: mssavion
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the Relais Bosquet lobby, we knew that we were going to have a great time. Christian was there to greet us, and he even remembered me from our emails when booking the room. He gave us a good map, showed us the two computers for our use, explained where the bus and subways were, and all in all, made us feel quite welcome. The room was just fine, we faced the street, and could see the Eiffel tower, it was so lovely all lit up at night! The beds were comfortable and we liked all the shelf space in the bathroom....the most space we had during our 16 day trip through Italy and Paris. The shower was a bit tight, and I am a small woman, so a larger person might find it a bit difficult to shower without banging into the glass doors, which by the way, only covered half of the tub. Did not bother us, as the nice-sized bathroom made up for it. The breakfast was terrific, eggs, meats, cheeses, and wonderful pastry. Leo made me delicious hot chocolate every morning, and he was oh so French!!! You will not be sorry staying at this hotel, clean, well located, and a great staff...enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaMartini
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on the great Trip Advisor reviews. We were very happy with our rooms. It was our first trip to France (mom and her 3 daughters). Were excited to look out the window and see our first glimpse of Eiffel Tower. Read about Rue Cler on internet and found it a great place to stock up on our first evening feast of cheese, bread and vin. Was wonderful. Wine glasses and corkscrew were supplied in room. Also coffee and tea for morning (and candy dish). Room was spotless and staff were excellent. Great location for Eiffel Tower and lots of restaurants in neighbourhood. Didn't have breakfast at hotel, instead went to cafe on corner. Used shuttle Francesca from the hotel arranged for us to get from airport. That worked great. Loved how the rooms were decorated. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: lizzy309
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a great experience with Paris.. We tried our very best to speak French, but nothing was good enough... Now that has nothing to do with the hotel, but I thought I would throw it in.. The hotel staff were great! They gave us plenty of information on how to get there by public transport, where to eat etc. There is a fantastic bakery on the corner of the street the hotel is on. The smell was too hard to resist! Make sure you get some fresh bread there! It is in a really good location with regards to the fact that you can walk to many of the tourist attractions. The Eiffel Tower is about a 15 minute walk... We got lost somehow.. Well, we got sidetracked with all the buildings & everything else there is to see! The Champs Elysees is maybe about 20-30 mins, depending on how fast you walk! I would suggest taking a tour bus (8 seater) around Paris, you get to see everything! The drivers speak English and often many other languages so you can understand what's going on! Front desk can help you with that! Also, if you don't feel comfortable catching public transport from the airport or train station, I would suggest trying to organise a shuttle as it's much cheaper! The bed is quite comfy, and the shutters are great for blocking out the light from the street. We really didn't spend too much time in the room as we were doing plenty of sightseeing while we were there, but it was a great room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: MATOA
Reviews.Content: We found out about the hotel on trip advisor. We decided to go there based on the favourable reviews. We were not disapponted. Rooms were very clean and tidy, the windows and the rolling shutters kept out noise and light during the night. The staff was very friendly and willing to help. I would definetely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmjlhs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during an anniversary trip to France. The hotel is located in the Rue Cler neighborhood, near the Eiffel Tower. It is in an area where locals shop for produce, meats and bread. If you want to be away from the tourists, this is the place to stay. It is also one of Rick Steves' recommended hotels. The Ecole Militaire Metro stop is nearby which makes travel to all the sights in Paris a breeze. You are also near an RER suburban train station for a trip into Versailles. We recommend buying a "carnet" or book of 10 tickets good for Metro or RER. The hotel itself had internet access in the lobby and a cordial front desk staff. We opted to decline the 13E "petit dejuener" and stopped next door at the boulangerie for fresh bread, croissants and other bakery goodies for a fraction of the cost. They also had coffee to go which is unusual in Paris. The room itself is small, but had a decent bathroom, a safe and a complementary tray for coffee or tea. We also liked the metal shades on the windows that block out both light and sound. Our room faced the courtyard vs. the street, so it was already very quiet. All in all, we recommend the Hotel Relais Bosquet.

Reviews.Title: “It's not in the top ten for nothing!”
Reviews.Author: Busmantoo
Reviews.Content: Maybe there's no such thing as the perfect hotel in Paris, due to price, demand and so on - but this little gem gets pretty close. If you're wanting value for money then this is the one for you. It doesn't have all the amenities of the big boys but it doesn't charge "top dollar" either. Go on their website and book at special rates 72 hours before your stay. The breakfast is acceptable, the rooms VERY clean and comfortable but not large. Located 10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower (we found it sparkling at us through the window when we arrived late at night!) there are several good restaurants nearby and it's close to one of the city tour bus routes. If we went back to Paris we'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lots good, nothing to complain about, but lacked French ambience”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireUKtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in April, booked over the web. Everything very efficient. Staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English, which is a shame if you are trying to improve your less than perfect French, but useful! We stayed in a standard room on the ground floor. It was spotlessly clean, well equipped and reasonably sized, despite a pillar in the middle of the room. The shutters were excellent at blocking out light and noise, although we found it very quiet anyway. The bed was quite hard for our taste though and not particularly comfortable. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as at 15 Euros it was expensive and there are several much cheaper options nearby on Rue Cler. Hotel is convenient for places to eat and access to Metro at Ecole Militaire. However, not sure I would choose to stay here again. It was on the highish side pricewise for what is a 3 star hotel, and although there was nothing to complain about, it seemed to me to lack a French ambience. Inside the hotel it could have been anywhere really.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay... wish it was longer!”
Reviews.Author: khuuger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our first year anniversary in Paris, and we stayed at the Hotel Relais Bosquet (mainly because of the excellent review ratings). The hotel didn't disappoint-- it was the best hotel we stayed at during our European vacation. The hotel is very reasonably priced for European standards. The good: Location, location, location! It's within a 10-15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, less than 5 minute walk to the Metro, and a block away from a street that features a permanent farmer's market. Since I love food, it was perfect for me (I still dream about the warm buttery chocolate croissants from the corner cafe... *drools). The staff are friendly and extremely knowledgeable. Right after I booked the hotel online, I received a confirmation email from the hotel staff asking me if I needed them to help with any ground transportation. Also, when we checked in, they remembered that it was an anniversary trip and wished us a happy anniversary! Rooms are bright, cozy, and clean. Unlike soom other hotels we stayed at during our trip, it always looked forward to coming back to our hotel room, and we were sad to leave. The electronic shutters were good at keeping out the light. Free wireless internet. We are from Silicon Valley and love our technology. Free internet is always good. The bad: Beds are hard. Then again, none of the beds in any of the hotels we stayed at in Europe were soft. Breakfast is not included (and it's pricey). Skip breakfast at the hotel and go to the corner cafe to get a chocolate croissant (see above... yum). Our room had no view at all. It's ok though, since they gave us a bigger room to make up for the lack of a view. Walls are thin-- we were next to an elevator and could hear everytime people were using it. It didn't bother my husband, but I could've done without it. Overall, we loved our stay here and wish we were able to stay longer. We will definitely come back to this hotel the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Relais Bosquet”
Reviews.Author: Tomtravel23
Reviews.Content: We booked the Relais Bosquet based on the tripadvisor recommendations and it met our expectations. The hotel is very low key. The staff was professional, could converse in English, and was pleased to help. Having two computers in the lobby for checking email was a real plus (but getting comfortable with the French keyboard took some time). The electric shutters on the windows were very effective in shutting out the light and outside noise. While our bed was comfortable and the bathroom large by European standards, the room itself was nothing to write home about. The neighborhood is very nice, but predominately residential, so don't expect a nightlife hotbed. You are two minutes away from a Metro stop (with a classy Lenotre shop close by) and only ten minutes from the Eiffel Tower. Strolling the nearby Rue Cler was a nice plus for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Delghtful and Perfect”
Reviews.Author: shirley24
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic little boutique hotel in Paris. The neighborhood is very safe and convenient to everything. The Rue Cler market is fantastic and all the coffee shops were great for people watching as well as eating or drinking. Most of the staff was very helpful with the exception of the night clerk. This place was very clean. I would stay here in a heartbeat again close to Eiffel Tower, Metro, etc. Do be sure to go see the Louve Museum and the River Seine tour boat is great and very reasonable. We went at about 5:00pm not dark yet and could take good pictures and the lights are fantastic at night. Dress warm as if you sit outside you can see more.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in fab location”
Reviews.Author: kelloggy
Reviews.Content: I tok my 10 year old daughter to Paris this Easter weekend. Read the Trip Advisor reviews of this hotel and decided to book. Really glad I did. Hotel was in a perfect location - 2 mins from Metro, 10 min walk to Eiffel Tower and Invalides. Round the corner from Rue Cler. We took a leisurely 30 min walk to the Musee D'Orsay and Louvre. Hotel itself was small, unpretentious and very friendly. Our room had a view of the Tower, which my daughter just loved. Would not hesitate to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Sancerre_Lee
Reviews.Content: We like to stay in the 7th when we're in Paris and have stayed in a number of different hotels there. After our recent visit, Hotel Relais Bosquet is our new favorite. The location is perfect for us: near the Ecole Militaire metro station, rue Cler, many wonderful restaurants, the Eiffel Tower and all the other sights. Our room (superior) was large, freshly decorated and very clean. If your French is less than parfait, the staff speaks English and, when we were there, most of the guests were American.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Chaasema
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend in Paris with a few friends and stayed at this hotel. It was everything you could ask for -- very clean, central with good metro access, great neighborhood, etc. The little markets and restaurants nearby were fantastic. All in all, a great stay for great value. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up To Reviews”
Reviews.Author: canoe23
Reviews.Content: I travel often to Paris on business, and like to try different hotels. Normally I stay in either the L'Opera area (our company headquarters in located in the 9th), or the Left Bank, and take the metro. I read all of the favorable comments on the Hotel Relais Bosquet, and decided to give it a try. I stayed for 4 nights and couldn't be more pleased. The room was larger than most other "boutique" hotels, with a large plasma screen tv and a much larger bathroom than I was accustomed to. The staff was friendly, the breakfast was much better than most (included scrambled eggs as well as the normal "French" breakfast), and the location near rue Cler and the Eiffel Tower was great. Also, the Ecole Militaire metro (#8 line) is just 2 blocks away, and a 10-minute ride to L'Opera, or a 2-minute ride to the connection to the Latin Quarter on the 10 line - very convenient. If there's any downside, it is that the hotel is not in the middle of all the activity and restaurants of the Latin Quarter/St. Germaine area, where I also stay. However, for many this would be an advantage. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful place”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Having been fooled into booking a hotel on Rue Valadon we were obliged to look elsewhere after one night and my wife found this fantastic place around the corner. We paid a little extra for a superior room and it was worth the money. The room was a decent size and very clean with a proper bath in the bathroom. 15 euro for breakfast was steep so we went round the corner to a cafe and paid 6. It's ideal for a metro station (2 minutes) and the Eiffel Tower (10 mins). Helpful friendly staff and free wi-fi made it a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a Great location”
Reviews.Author: IpswichBlonde1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel having seen the positive reviews on this website and we were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location easily accessible by the metro or on foot. Our room was large , clean and comfortable. The staff in the hotel were very helpful and although relatively expensive breakfast in the hotel offered a good variety of food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandBuckeye
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at Hotel Relais Bosquet. Like most reviewers said this hotel has a unique location, walking distance to Eiffel Tower (5-7 minutes), Metro or bus ride to almost all other main attractions( 20 Minutes), and located in Rue Cler neighborhood. The Hotel is clean, staff is helpful, and the rooms were a decent size for European hotel (room 23). People in other reviews complained about the hard bed but to be honest although it was hard we had no issues with the bed. The view from our room of effiel tower minimal but if we stuck our head out the window we could see the top sticking out. Rue Cler has plenty of bakeries and cafes for cappacino we did not do the breakfast at hotel. The hotel staff recommended some excellent neighborhood restaurants with traditinal French food. The Metro is awesome way to get around city if you need help go to subwaynavigator.com hotel stop is Ecole Militaire. This was my wife and mine first visit to Paris. Paris is by far my favorite city have fun and enjoy you can't go wrong with Hotel Relais Bosquet.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: RKPT
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and in a lovely area. Loved the hotel and had a room which had everything we required. Very helpful staff and we could not fault our stay. Great shops and market very close by. Will hopefully be returning next year and will make a point of staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, superb location”
Reviews.Author: Gasheads
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a 3 night stay after reading the great reviews on Trip Advisor and we certainly were not disappointed with our first visit to Paris. We travelled by Metro to and from CDG Airport which is relatively straightforward and much cheaper than by taxi or shuttle. If your thinking of using the Metro then take RER B to Saint-Michel Notre Dame, switching to RER C. Take RER C to Invalides where you can then hop onto the Metro line 8 to Ecole Militaire. However the metro only runs from 5.45 so no good for early flights. The location is just perfect and the main attractions are easily accessable, and if you don't fancy long, brisk walks then Metro is just yards away. We paid an extra €10 for a supreme room and it was spacious, well equipped, warm and very clean. Contrary to some opinion we also thought the bed was comfortable. The staff are very friendly, speak good English and are always on hand if needed. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel due to the massively inflated price and there are plenty of cheaper places to eat if you look. We just loved the little patisserie a few doors down. The local restraunts didn't blow us away with their quality but were reasonably good value and staff were polite, however vegetarians be aware as you may be restricted to salad. Overall, I can't recommend this hotel enough especially if it's your first visit to Paris. It's in a lovely part of Paris and we always felt safe and welcome. We would definately consider it in future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NST45
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for myself and 3 friends after discovering (through TripAdvisor) horrendous reviews on the other place we'd booked (Hotel Merryl). A work colleague of my husband recommended it having stayed there for a while before moving to Paris. What a great little place - the room was spacious, well decorated and very clean. Comfy bed too. The bathroom was sparkling clean, had crisp white towels & a basket of shower gel, shoe shine, etc. There was a kettle & tea/coffee etc on a tray, which was welcome in the morning! The staff were friendly and helpful. And free wi-fi too! We didn't eat breakfast there, as on the corner next to the hotel was a great little patisserie. Definitely would recommend this place to anyone wanting a weekend (or longer) in Paris! The hotel is tucked down a quiet street, about a 5 minute (or less) stroll to the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geobyr27
Reviews.Content: We have 3 wonderful days at this hotel in a quick visit to very romantic Paris. It is in a very good area although a little expensive is worth extra money. We enjoy very much French food and excellent wines. Paris is a beautiful city and the hotel will give you good information on how to travel around without car. We highly say you must stay here if you go to Paris. My English born wife is very happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: OspreyFL
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Relais Bosquet's apartment a block from the actual hotel for three nights. It was very comfortable for two adults and two teens. The hotel staff was very efficient and helpful with questions about their neighborhood and how various things worked in Paris. The location is beyond compare. The Rue Claire neighborhood has a wide variety of cafes, restaurants and shps (including pizza and wine for a picnic on the Parc du Champ de Mars for shell-shocked, first-time overseas travellers) and is close enough to the Eiffel Tower so that you can start and finish every day of your visit in Paris there. Which is exactly what we did!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: tm68
Reviews.Content: I would like to start by stating that I have been to Paris many times, and found this little treasure of a hotel through America's favorite travel guide, Rick Steve's in his Paris 2007 guidebook. I called to make reservations, and the person on the other end was very fluent in English and very happy to take our reservation. It was the next day that we received an email from Relais-Bosquet thanking us for considering them, and to please let them know if we needed any help with dinner or tours. We accepted their help for dinner, and we were never disappointed. On the contrary, we were blown away. I have to say that as an American, name dropping goes a long way. When we showed up for dinner, and dropped Frederiques name from the hotel, they rolled out the carpet for us. I have to say that has never happened to me ever in Paris. The rooms are bright, spacious and have wonderful windows that open out. We had a beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower. There were two PC's in the lobby that had free high speed internet access. We were close to the metro and centrally located. There hotel is located in the quaint Rue Cler district. Just around the corner you are surrounded by bakeries, a fromagerie, a wine store, a market, a fruit market, and a chocolate shop. What more can you ask for? This hotel added to the whole Paris experience, because you could come home at night and ask all of the embarrassing questions without fear. We bought a phone card that had instructions only in French. The wonderful front desk person was so kind as to go through the whole auto-prompting and walked me through it. We will definitely go back to Paris, and the Relais-Bosquet will definitely be a part of our experience. Make sure you ask for Frederique...!!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: maddyHampshire
Reviews.Content: hotel relais bosquet is lovely. we spent last weekend in paris and we were not disappointed with this hotel. we booked an executive room, which seemed to be little different from the standard rooms except it was bigger, so if you're not bothered about size of the room, go for standard. the hotel is quiet, spotlessly clean, and well located, near the eiffel tower, and close to many brasseries and places to eat. we didn't bother with breakfast as it was not included in the room rate, there were plenty of places close by to get breakfast. we chose a lovely little brasserie about five minutes walk away. our experience at this hotel was very positive and i would recommend it as a an ideal base for visiting the sights of paris.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: AUSSIETRAVELLER23_8
Reviews.Content: Having arrived on a rainy day from London this hotel was a welcome relief after the shoebox i stayed in in London. Could not have been happier with location,service and room was excellent, i have to add the external shutters are a godsend for weary travellers who may want a sleep in as they cut out all noise and light making life very comfortable. Free access to internet and within walking distance of some fabulous food outlets Hotel Bosquet will fill my head with pleasant experiences everytime i think of my time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJJones
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Relais Bosquet is just a stones throw from the Eiffel Tower. It is conveniently located for the Metro station at Les Invalides and you can be at any of the central Paris landmarks within 2 or 3 stops on the Metro or within 20 minutes if walking. The Hotel itself is clean, pleasant and represents good value for money. The rooms are not huge, but then this is Paris! The bathroom was functional and clean with a good range of complimentary toiletries and a hairdryer. The rooms also had irons and ironing boards as well as coffee making facilities and a mini-bar. The reception area downstairs was well appointed with complimentary newspapers (English and American) and free Internet access. The reception staff were helpful and knowledgeable. If you want a good standard hotel which is ideally placed then this is the Hotel for you. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: vivelaweekend!
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a rainy friday early afternoon for a long weekend break and were delighted that the positive reviews for this hotel were very accurate. I have stayed in a few hotels in Paris before for both business and leisure and have found this one to be excellent value for money and based in a great neighbourhood. The hotel is based in 2 buildings (one behind the other, linked by a small corridor). The hotel is based on a quiet road, just 1 minute from Rue de Cler, a wonderful, bustling, pedestrianised street, full of fromageries, fine foods, fruit and veg shops, and cafes and restaurants (excellent choices for morning croissants and coffee). The hotel is 5 minutes walk from Ecole Militaire metro, which means there is only 1 change (at Srasbourg St Denis) if you are travelling on the Eurostar from Gare du Nord. Furthermore the hotel is only 10-15 minutes walk to the Seine and 2 minutes from Rue St.Dominique, with its good restaurants, boulangeries and shoe shops, that leads you down to the Boulevard St Germain with its upscale swanky shopping options. The hotel rooms are nicely decorated, clean and spacious, and ours, though it was on the top floor in the attic, didnt have a restrictive ceiling height. Our room had a plasma screen with satellite channels and a partial view of the Eiffel Tower (the tower's lights flash for 10 minutes on each hour during the night!) and a well stocked mini bar and tea/coffee facilities. The bathroom was clean and bright, with lush white fluffy towels provided, with the only mini-gripe being that the water pressure in the shower was rather low. The staff on the desk were very helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations, and very accommodating (they kindly stored our fromage in their fridge on our last day, until we were ready to leave). I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for good value for money and a quiet, central location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ilmanrd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Relais Bosquet in May of 2006, based upon recommendations from our Rick Steves tour book. The hotel is clean, spacious and the electric darkening blinds are great. The hotel is located in the Rue Cler neighborhood which is walking distance to Eiffel Tower, Napoleon’s tomb, the Seine and the Orsay and Rodin museums. The metro station is around the corner and the street outside the front door is lined with café’s, restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: snafu
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Relais Bosquet in December, just prior to Christmas, for 4 nights. We booked the hotel based on reviews posted here, & were very satisfied. We arrived at 11:30, & reception prioritised the cleaning of our room without asking. Within an hour we had unpacked, washed & hit the museum trail. The room & bathroom were very clean. The bed was hard (as mentioned by others), but that suited us. The only negative was the thin wall between our toilet & the one next door. It wasn't a major problem for us, but I can see that some people might find it offputting. As have many others, we skipped the expensive breakfast, & ate from the boulangerie on Rue Cler (better than the one next door). We ate around the hotel most nights, & had a wonderful Moroccan tagine @ 7eme Sud on Rue De Grenelle (about a five min.walk from the Hotel). When leaving the Hotel on Christmas Eve storing our bags for a few hours while we did last minute shopping & sightseeing was no problem with Reception. We paid €140 per night for a standard room, looking onto the inner courtyard (booked directly on the Hotel website) & considered the Relais Bosquet good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: DonegalDoll
Reviews.Content: Picked the relais bosquet based on the tripadvisor rating (14/1735 hotels). Had to make changes to the booking twice and Christian at reception could not have been more helpful. He was also great for restaurant recommendations, the restaurants got better every night. All the other staff were just as pleasant & helpful, I just don't know their names. Very close to the eiffel tower. Metro strike on that w-end but well able to sightsee by walking from the hotel. Good sized rooms, big bathroom, v quiet electric shutters for light control, comfortable bed with cable tv (2 english channels). Didn't bother with breakfast as there is the most beautiful little pedestrian street full of eating established the end of the Rue du Champs de Mars. 3 nights for €180 pps was really great value and I would recommend it for anyone

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: PeteG13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Relais Bosquet for Christmas and we were not disappointed. Based on the reviews from this site and the price of the rooms we chose this hotel. Extremely convenient and they provide many services. Rooms are very clean and an excellent size for european standards. Bathtub was a huge plus as we travelled with a 18 month old baby and she loved her nightly baths. Free wireless internet in the rooms plus internet downstairs if you didn't bring your laptop. I did all my research for our next excersion in the rooms and then we would set out. The metro is around the corner. If you exit the hotel and turn right you'll find a grocery store and then a walking street that has excellent selections for food....ie. chinese takeout, italian delivery, Cafe Du Marche, pastries. If I do return to Paris I will again book this hotel if its available.

Reviews.Title: “My 2 cents”
Reviews.Author: NateK
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with all of the reviews. This is the perfect hotel for a short stay in Paris. The rooms are clean and nice, but the real draw is its location. Perfectly situated and within walking distance of all major attractions. It's also was block away from the Rue Clar, which is a foot traffic only street. The street is lined with cafe's, restaurants, and cheese/wine shops. My wife and I are taking a 4 month round-the-world trip starting January and changed our itinerary in order to make a 3 day stop in Paris. This hotel is one reason it's easy to justify going back.

Reviews.Title: “Many good things... and one bad.”
Reviews.Author: edinburghedge
Reviews.Content: We booked our three night stay, Novermber 28-30, at the Relais Bosquet on Expedia.co.uk and got a terrific deal of £90 per night. I arrived at the hotel, (ahead of my other half travelling from Edinburgh), at approximately 8:00am after a flight from the United States. I was grateful for the effort made by the staff to get me into our room very early. Cab fare from Charles De Gaulle during morning rush hour was approximately £35. Room #45 is a standard room and for the most part it resembled the photo on the hotel's website. It was snug but not as small as some of the European rooms I've stayed in; we had no problem stashing our luggage out of the way. The view of the Eiffel Tower and the Rue du Champs de Mars, decorated for Christmas, was picture postcard pretty. The window was outfitted with an electric shutter which came in handy when we wanted to block out the noise from the street below. The room contained two small twin beds pushed together, a wooden wardrobe which stored an iron and ironing board and extra blankets, a small desk and chair, a mini bar with plenty of space to store our own water and snacks, and a working safe. Everything was clean and well presented. The bathroom was small but equipped with a full bath/shower and the standard ameneties. The towels were large and decent quality and there was plenty of hot water and good water pressure at all times. One of the nicer things on offer is the use of the free internet access in the lobby. If you've never pecked out an e-mail on a French keyboard, (I hadn't), prepare to be amused. The hotel sits in a charming neighborhood with a range of good cafes, bars and restaurants nearby. The Cafe Champs de Mars, just doors down from the hotel, was the perfect spot for a late meal after a night of pub crawling in Le Marais. The metro station and post office are within easy walking distance. The hotel staff both at reception and housekeeping are accomodating, friendly and professional. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel so I can't comment on the food service. We enjoyed so many things about this wonderful little hotel but we did have one rather significant problem...we found the beds to be extremely uncomfortable. We loved the location, the price, the staff, the view, so many things...but we didn't sleep well. At the end of the day a good night's rest is the most important aspect of any hotel. We may choose this hotel again but we would certainly want to avoid the beds in room #45.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Relais Bosquet”
Reviews.Author: TishIreland
Reviews.Content: Georgeous gem of a hotel. Clean, cozy room with view of the Eiffel Tower. Reasonable rates; Very central to main sights; 8 minutes to Tower, 15 to Champs Elysses/Palace. Very quaint location with lots of nice small boutiques. Ate in the Bosquet accross the street; georgeous! Staff at hotel very nice and friendly and great for tips etc. Loved it; definetly going back!

Reviews.Title: “It's all TRUE”
Reviews.Author: tripdenver
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 8 day stay at Relais Bosquet. IT WAS WONDERFUL. Room great, Eiffel Tower view great, people (esp. Christian) great. Boulangerie next door is excellent for pain aux raisins and pain au lait. Location cannot be beat. STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “We felt like Parisians!”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very charming, with the location being the greatest asset! We loved feeling like we were in a local area, with the street market and wonderful cafes around. Also, the metro stop is just around the corner so it is convenient to get other places as well. It is clean, with wonderful staff who were very helpful . The only problem we had was leaving at 4 a.m to catch a flight and trying to communicate with the night front desk clerk (his english was a lot more limited than other workers) as to why our taxi we had asked him to reserve was not there. We were getting frustrated, and unable to hail one that early in the morning, when he finally communicated to us that he had spoken with the company and one was on the way (although 45 min late). He zoomed us to the airport so it all worked out fine! The rooms are clean and sort of bed-and-breakfastish...not near as modern as all the other hotels we stayed at in Europe that had flat screens and modern furnishings but very clean and well taken care of. There was a strong smoke smell one night so we feared the place was on fire, but that same hotel clerk told us it was from another apartment next door or something.... The highlight of our room was the view! We requested an Eiffel Tower view so we could lay in bed and watch the Tower twinkle on the hour! This was one of the highlights of all of Europe for me! Overall, great experience, great location, great staff, great view... definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellently located”
Reviews.Author: mikepickard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in November 2007. The staff at reception were incredibly polite and showed us to our room with a minimum of fuss and virtually immediately on arrival - happy to speak english in response to our broken French. Likewise, on our departure date - they were more than happy to watch over our bags for eight hours while we wandered the streets of Paris. Always a smile on entry or departure from the building. One evening, the key toour room broke, leaving us locked out of our room. it was fixed immediately. Room was clean and warm (radiators) The location of the hotel itself is perfect. Five minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower along quiet streets, a great boulangerie practically next door, the Metro (Ecole Militaire) just around the corner and some great chocolaterias and restaurants all on the same street. When I return to Paris, I will be happy to stay here again, and recommend it readily.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: Agile_Lapin
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris during the train strike. The staff could not have been more helpful in assisting us in working around the train strike and the metro delays. Rooms are nice and roomy for the price. Area is great. We'll come back.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimpleTraveller_7
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. Rooms are quiet, comfortable and medium-sized and the service is very good . Quite close the Eiffel Tower and not expensive if compared with the average fare of Paris hotels. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spddmn31
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Hotel Relais Bosquet was excellent. The hotel staff was very friendly. The breakfast was good, its worthwhile if you have a Rick Steves Tourbook (tell the hotel, breakfast is free). I don't think it is worth the 15 Euro they charge. The room size was good considering its a European hotel. The rooms were very clean. The hotel is very close to the Rue Cler markets, and an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower (10 min walk) and the metro (5 min). We would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel;great location”
Reviews.Author: rebb6076
Reviews.Content: Our original plan was to stay at the Hotel Leveque on Rue Cler but I failed to properly confirm the reservation. We then selected the Relais Bosquet, and I am glad that we did. It is rather plain on the exterior but once inside, our room was very clean and well maintained. The room has a safe, small refrigerator and electronic window blinds that provided full room darkening. Best of all, we had a direct view of the Eiffel Tower from our room. It was great laying in bed and watching the twinkling light show. The hotel is a 15 minute walk to the Tower and the Seine. It is a half block from Rue Cler and the restaurants and shops (the bakery on the Corner of Rue Cler and Champ du Mars is better than the one adjacent to the hotel, in our opinion). The front staff spoke excellent English and were very helpful. In addition, there are two computers in the lobby with free access to the internet. This is a very useful tool to confirm or make reservations. The price per room was 160 euros. Well worth it in our opinion. We give this hotel as solid 5 for overall value and location. Highly recommended to others.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: TP_Travel_Chronicles
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel and we loved the location. We stayed here for 3 nights in the month of October. We had communicated with Abdennour who helped us out in booking a nice room, and with directions as well as other information about Paris. Frederica and other staff was very helpful too. Advantages: - Location: Very close to RER station (Pont de Alma) as well as the Ecole Militaire station which can get you to any of the big attractions even though it has just a single metro line running through it. Rue Cler is right behind the hotel which has wonderful fruit shops and a very nice cheese store. It also has a couple of restaurants which are above average. Rue Cler also has general grocery stores which makes it easy for you to pick up water, snacks etc. Eiffel tower is a 10 minute walk.. - Staff: Helpful, not overly-friendly, but professional. - Rooms: We had heard about small rooms in Paris, but found the room to be quite well sized. Not gargantuan, but adequate. The bathroom was nice, clean. - Free internet in the front lobby and across the hotel (wi-fi) which was helpful. The only disadvantage we found was the slightly expensive breakfast which we did not end up taking. Pain d Epis, a bakery, on Avenue Bosquet is just wonderful and is right outside the hotel when you walk towards the Ecole Militaire station. Their baked goods were really delicious. As a previous guest has mentioned, do your research for restaurants. They do make good recommendations, but nothing that would wow you away. We really liked our stay here and would love to return back. Thanks for making our stay in Paris wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dreamtrip07
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great little find thanks to tripadvisor. We stayed for 4 nights, and enjoyed the location and view of the tower. The room was a good size for a European hotel and had a full bath(bath/shower combo). The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the tower and pretty convienent to the rest of Paris. It is a 10 or so minute walk to the RER station near the pont de l'alma and a 5 minute walk (past the bakery on the corner..mmmm) to the ecole militaire metro stop. In addition to all the other wonderful things about this hotel, there is free internet access in the lobby! I felt it was a great value for the money. I would stay here again and recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: quercus_magnus
Reviews.Content: Selected the Relais Bosquet first on area (Rue Cler so convenient for sightseeing) and Tripadvisor reviews. What a great find! Room, on top floor, was great and included a view of the Eiffel Tower when you leaned out. Comfortable, clean. Superb staff helped with directions, restaurant reservations, transportation. Location to sights, transportation, markets, and more, is just fantastic. When we return to Paris, this is where we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: MerryTravels
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for us. We had a superior room on the top floor, which was quite big and had a big bathroom. Housekeeping did an excellent job. The front desk staff were always friendly and helpful. The location really is ideal. Lots of options for food and drinks around, the Champ du Mars is a few blocks away for a picnic, and the Metro stop is very close. You really can't ask for a better hotel in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Relais Bosquet”
Reviews.Author: mdarch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for part of our honeymoon in early September. The concierge was polite and helpful, the room was bright and cheerful with a lovely view out the window of the street below and the neighborhood was full of charming boutiques, restaurants, etc. There is an excellent bakery on the corner with wonderful quiche and pastries for breakfast (a better value than the hotel breakfast). Also, there is a grocery a couple of doors down where we stocked up on water to place in our fridge. The bed was two twins pushed together, which worked fine. The A/C worked well and the room darkening blinds were very cool. The hotel is located very close to the Ecole Militaire Metro stop, which was quite convenient, and we found a few really terrific restaurants in the area as well that we really enjoyed. The only downside at all might be the bathroom, which is showing it's age with tile needing some repair, but it was kept relatively clean and served its purpose. I would certainly not hesitate to return to the neighborhood and would gladly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel close to the Tower”
Reviews.Author: Tired_travelling_dad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over UK bank holiday weekend at the end of August. Paris full of tourists but this part of town only minutes away from the Eiffel Tower felt relatively peaceful and quiet. Booked special package which included two tickets for boat trip on River, well worth the trip. I would probably not have done it otherwise. The hotel itself is well appointed and the rooms are actually quite a good size for Paris. The bathroom is well equipped and the shower / bath was another welcome feature compared to other hotels of this price range. Reception staff were helpful. Only minor complaint was cleaning staff who left our room unlocked, a cleaning rag on our suitcase and our complimentary tea / coffee set half cleaned, as if they had intended to return to finish cleaning but had forgotten to do so. There are a number of brasseries near by for a late snack, so food is not a problem even at 2 am!

Reviews.Title: “our best paris room yet!”
Reviews.Author: edwis
Reviews.Content: How is it that each visit to Paris can be better than the previous ones? We took a one and one-half hour flight from Dublin to CDG, arriving in Paris in the late morning. By the time we got to the baggage claim area, our bags were waiting. We walked directly to the Air France Coach shuttle going to the city center and were at our hotel in record time for Paris. Never smoother. We stayed at Hotel Relais Bosquet, a three-star hotel in the 7th district. You can really see the difference a few dollars makes when upgrading to a three-star from our usual two-star hotel. Our room was a record setting size, complete with electric shutters to block out the street noise and lights. Wow! We had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our room. Three blocks left from the hotel is the Champ de Mars Parc, with the Ecole Militaire complex on one end and Le Tour Eiffel at the other. One block right of the hotel is the Rue Cler, once a bustling street market and now just as full of trendy cafes. Breakfast was 13 Euros extra, so we went down two doors to the Boulangerie Artisanale, where we were well satisfied with quiches, chocolate croissants and baguettes. We toured the Le Orangerie museum, which has recently reopened with an entire floor of Monet’s water lilies painted on circular walls. While we were in Paris, the city had fans from all over the world for World Cup Rugby (Coupe du Monde 2007). The best group was the Scotsman, who all wore their kilts to show their national pride. Friday after dinner we walked through the Champ de Mars Parc under the colorful lights of the Eiffel tower, where dozens of folks were having picnics with lots of wine bottles on the grass. Very nice scene we will do next time.

Reviews.Title: “What A Gem!”
Reviews.Author: henryv731_123
Reviews.Content: As most of the other reviews indicate, this hotel is simply a gem!!! I recommend it very, very highly. Tremendous location: 10 minutes from Eiffel Tower and Seine River cruises, 15 minutes from Orsay museum, 25 minutes from Louvre, and 35 minutes from Notre Dame. There are so many sites that are well within walming distance of the Relais Bosquet that its location is superb. If you get a chance, ask for a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower. It's trivial, but looking at your window to see the top of the tower leaves you with a memory yo won't soon forget. If you are a Rick Steves customer, tell the hotel. I mentioned that I discovered the hotel through Steves and they indicated that the continental breakfast was free for Steves' readers. Frederique, one of the clerks at the front desk, is incredibly friendly and helpful. Don't hesitate to ask her for help with getting a taxi, etc... A tip: if you are planning to visit museums in Paris, consider getting a museum pass. The hotel can arrange for this pass to be delivered to the hotel and waiting for you when you arrive, and it will allow you to by-pass lines that can sometimes be fairly lengthy. If you are staying at the Relais Bosquet, you are in for a treat. A great value and a great Parisian Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, quiet location, nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler78
Reviews.Content: Pros: Short walk to metro, Tour Eiffel, Hotel des Invalides, quiet location, computer with internet access in lobby, tourist services (airport shuttle, excursions, tickets, etc) Cons: Breakfast too pricey for what you get, does not reply quickly to email Hotel Relais Bosquet was a great little hotel not far from the Tour Eiffel. The rooms have a full bathroom which is quite a nice size with full tub and shower with handheld shower head. The rooms are a nice size as well. They supply some bath/shower gel, cotton swabs, sewing kit, lotion, hairdryer, iron. There is plenty of sink space, a shelf above the sink right below the mirror, and a wheeled shelf unit, so plenty of room to put your own bathroom necessities. Rooms have air conditioning, dresser, and wardrobe to hang clothes. Several TV channels, mostly French of course. There is also an elevator (pretty small, only two with a suitcase could fit at once) There is a computer for internet access in the lobby for guests to use, which is great for communicating with people back home. The housekeeping was great at cleaning even though when we ran out of toilet paper they forgot to restock. Also on checkout they tried to charge for 3 mini bar items, which we did not eat/drink. They took it off the bill. Breakfast is not worth the 13 euros they charge. You get free coffee, tea in your room already. For 13 euros they pretty much give you coffee, tea, juice, and a basket of breads. The fruit was just a few small pieces of cantaloupe, nothing special. This is not worth the cost. at all. Their site mentions this breakfast as an option: "Drink only: freshly-squeezed orange juice, a hot drink, a madeleine and a croissant." but that was never mentioned to us or offered. We never got any croissants from the hotel even with the 13 euros breakfast. Save your money and run down the street and buy croissants yourself or go out to a little cafe and get crepes! The hotel is slow at responding to emails. They eventually respond, but maybe a week or two later. If you have something urgent it may be best to call them. They did arrange a shuttle from the airport to our hotel for us.

Reviews.Title: “Believe every word!”
Reviews.Author: MissBonie
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this charming, boutique hotel. I'll spare repeating what others have said. I will confirm, though, as in another previous review, I'll only stay at the Relais Bosquet upon my return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A paris gem”
Reviews.Author: JodyZ
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here in two rooms for four nights in August. Both rooms (6th floor front) were clean, spacious by Paris standards with a fantastic view of the Eiffel Tower. Electric shutters and good A-C made it a great place to sleep, and proximity to numerous attractions, bakeries, restaurants, metro, taxi stand and even laundry made it a great spot for the middle of our fifteen day three country trip. Staff is friendly and helpful. This is the only place I will ever stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: katlvr1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we were hoping for during our stay in Paris. This is our second visit to Paris, and we based our choice of lodging on tripadvisor reader's recommendations. We were not disappointed. The location in the Rue Cler market area was superb...we visited the bakery next door to the hotel which was fabulous, and ate crepes from Ulysses restaurant on Rue Cler...try the trois fromage! The Relais Bosquet is a great little boutique hotel...quite modest, but very charming. It is clean, and offers several amenities you would expect in a larger operation. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful (even in translating a french website on the lobby computer). The reservation was very easy and everything was just as presented on their website. We did not eat at the hotel so I can not comment on this. I wholly recommend a stay at the Relais Bosquet if you are visiting Paris...you won't be disappointed. We will definitely consider this hotel our own little home when returning!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: rubeus
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartment for 3 nights. It was just wonderful. Excellent location for exploring Paris. a great spacious place to come back to relax. The patio was wonderful to eat, sit and enjoy. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, courteous staff, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Mexifried
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 9 day stay at the Hotel Relais Bosquet and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. We got to the hotel by Yellow Van which was arranged for us through the Hotel. This worked very well and made the transfer easy. You could have got here by a combination of the Roissy bus and Metro 8 but it would have involved hauling bags up and down quite a number of stairs. All in all, the van worked well and was not expensive. The front desk staff were extraordinarily helpful and pleasant. They speak excellent English and are happy to help you with suggestions, reservations and advice on request. Check in and out was efficient with no surprises. The front lobby has a computer to access the internet. It has a different keyboard than the one that we use in Canada but, with some considerable patience, you can get used to it. It is often used by guests but is generally available with a short wait. The hotel has wireless internet and so bringing a lap top would be a good idea. Ice is obtained through the front desk and isn't available on each floor which was fine as far as we were concerned. We had a superior room which was very nice. Had to insert the room "key" into a slot by the door to make the lights work, which was a new one for us and not something that came to us immediately. It had a large bathroom with two sinks and a large and effective shower. A separate WC was within the room. The air conditioning worked well, thank goodness! The safe was inside the small fridge (which wasn't the first place that we looked for it). The fridge has enough room to store soda, cheese, meat, and other stuff if you wish. They do stock it with the usual which we didn't use. They have a coffee maker in the room that we didn't use. There was a small TV which had 3 English channels plus a number of other channels. There was a large cabinet and a chest of drawers for clothes which was adequate. Electronically closing blinds completely darken the room and completely keep out outside noise. One could hear the doors open and close in adjacent hotel rooms. Breakfast was included in our package and was very good. It consisted of orange juice and "cake" to start, followed by coffee and heated milk, chocoate bread (addictive), croissants (very good) and additional bread with an assortment of jams and butter. Cheese came with it as did some cut up melon. This was one filling breakfast that was very good. We never were able to eat all of it and it pretty much filled you up until supper time cutting the costs of lunch (generally you might just need a drink and could share a salad and that would do you the rest of the day). I am sure that you could go out to a local bakery etc and it would be fine, but this was so convenient and so good! The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel tower and two blocks from the Metro. It is one block from Rue Cler. There are two bakeries nearby and two grocery stores as well. Banking was within two blocks. I highly suggest the Le Bosquet restaurant nearby as it has great service and food. Cafe du March is also close and is a little cheaper with reasonable food and a fun atmosphere. You can get a crepe on Rue Cler that is the equivalent of a full meal. Wine shops abound nearby. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: olygirl21
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Hotel Relais Bosquet in Paris for 3 nights on our recent trip to Europe. This was our first time in Paris, but we will definitely come back and stay here again! All of the staff were very nice and accomodating. Our room, a standard double on the 5th floor, was the largest hotel room we stayed in on our trip. It was very clean, had a comfortable bed, and the best towels on our trip. And the very best part was looking out our window, we saw the top half of the Eiffel Tour. It was especially romantic at night, when it sparkled for 10 minutes on the top of the hour. We paid a very reasonable price for such a nice hotel with such a great view. The breakfast in the morning was good with juice, coffee, bakery basket, fruit, and cheese. It costs extra so may not be worth it unless it is included with the package as ours was. This hotel was close to many sights, which was nice for returning to the hotel midday for a rest. It was right around the corner from a Metro stop, which took us to most everywhere in the city very easily. We ate at 3 different restaurants nearby the hotel. We had delicious and reasonably priced salads at the Cafe du Marche, good crepes at the Ulysee en Gaulle, yummy french onion soup and salade au chevre chaud at Le Bosquet and a good steak and chicken meal with awesome dessert at Cafe le Bosquet. If you are planning on seeing at least 2-3 of the main sights in Paris, look into the Paris Museum pass. We saved a lot of money as well as time waiting in lines by buying this pass. If you're going to Paris, definitely look into this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Totally Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bunnytraveler
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Europe to celebrate our 40th anniversary and chose the Hotel Relais Bosquet for the Paris part of our trip. What a great choice! This hotel is situated in a lovely part of Paris close to so many things and just a few blocks from The Metro station so getting around the city was easy and convenient. I particularly loved seeing Parisians during their normal daily activities while sitting at a cafe or bistro on the Rue du Cler. I couldn't have asked for a better location or a more friendly and helpful staff.
