There is a computer in the lobby that you can use without charge (not a common occurrence in our experience overseas), a post office and laundromat just a few blocks away and you're blocks from the Eiffel Tower and the Seine. . .who could want anything more? I can't wait to get back for another visit fo Paris and will definitely stay at this hotel again anytime I'm in the city. I had high hopes when I left home and I was not disappointed! What a wonderful experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: misstraveler2007
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for 8 nights at the beginning of June and enjoyed every bit of it! The hotel is charming and the staff is incredibly helpful. I would stay there again in a heartbeat and would recommend the hotel to anyone going to Paris. It is conveniently located just off a lovely market street (Rue Cler) and is just a short walk from the Eiffel Tower and Ecole Militaire metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: valleycitylyn
Reviews.Content: My family of two senior citizens and three 50ish "kids" stayed here and found the hotel to be lovely. My husband was pick pocketed in the metro on our second day. The staff was very helpful including taking us to the local police station and staying with us to help fill out the paperwork involved. We didn't let this setback dimish our enjoyment of this beautiful city. The energy saving measures used at the hotel were impressive. Location was perfect for us. It was an all around great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Young707
Reviews.Content: May, 2007. Room #36 & #38. 160 euro per day. Breakfast extra additional charge. Walking distance to nearby Eiffel Tower. Ask for 2 twin beds in each room, but got one queen bed in each room. Bed Mattress is soft for typical older American tourists. Excellent & quiet air conditioner. Good electric window screen. Ask for and got inside building 2, top floor facing inside courtyard. Very nice bathroom. Excellent receptionists, Christian, knowledgeable and very helpful. One computer in lobby, keyboard and commands, are in French. Nice neighborhood, quiet, very near metro station, lots of nearby restaurants and grocery and shops and laundry. Absolutely do not carry luggage on metro. Ask for shared shuttle. Or take the Air France Bus to downtown, then, get a Taxi.

Reviews.Title: “What at great location.”
Reviews.Author: PharmDoc
Reviews.Content: This is our second time back to the Hotel Relais Bosquet thanks to Rick Steves. It is a little scarey to walk around the area and see Rick Steves' Paris travel guide in most everyone's hand. However, he is right; the location is great. You can walk to either corner to get great pastry to eat in your room with the coffee provided or just walk to the Rue Cler and eat breakfast while the market is set up. You have an ATM across the street and a small grocery a few doors down. If you stay long enough to need clean clothes, you don't have far to walk to a clean laundromat. No one can complain about the size of the bathrooms which are larger than most we have encountered in Europe. We had a smaller room this time, but still facing the courtyard which keeps the street noise to a minimum. Fredricka scheduled a shuttle for the two of us from CDG to the hotel for 36E which isn't as cheap as the metro, but with luggage, it is considerably easier. Oh, you internet geeks, like my husband, they now have WiFi in the rooms. They also have a computer in the lobby for free use if you need to check your e-mail. This place has the basics and is close to everything. No doubt we would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: plmguy61
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip and a wonderful stay at Relais Bosquet. It's as charming and friendly a place as you could ask fort, and in a great location. Our room was spotless and spacious, with all the amenities we could want, including a safe and a mini-bar. It also had very handy electric blinds that could be lowered, which was a big help, since it stayed light surprisingly late there. There was also an internet terminal in the lobby for checking e-mail , and free newspapers in French and English. Frederica and Christian were incredibly helpful with everything, including dinner reservations, taxis, and anything else we needed. The Rue Cler neighborhood where the hotel is located is a nice quiet spot, but very well situated. You can walk to quite a bit (You're especially close to the Eiffel Tower and the Invalides) and there is a Metro station (Ecole Militaire) only about a 5 minute walk away. There are two wonderful bakeries within a block of the hotel (one practically downstairs), and we got pastries for our breakfast most days. There is also a small grocery store just a few steps away, and many other food shops and produce stands very close. The hotel serves a continental breakfast, but it was not included with our room and was a little pricey (15 euros a person), so we did not eat there. There are also several cafes very close at hand where you can sit down for a breakfast and watch the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “My new Paris home!”
Reviews.Author: CAOItalia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent find! I've stayed in the Rue Cler area the last three times I"ve been to Paris, and the Relais Bosquet tops the other two places that I've stayed. I love this little neighborhood and it feels like I'm living in Paris when I stayed here. This was our 1st anniversary trip and my wife's first time in Paris, and she felt the same way. Rooms are nicely sized, the air-conditioning is good, and the hotel staff is so accomodating. Special kudos to Christian for his assistance on this trip. The hotel is just off of Avenue Bosquet, and the location is great for walking to numerous sights and some excellent restaurants; Les Clos du Gourmets, La Cuisine, and Venezia Italia. We had an inside room that overlooked a courtyard and it was very quiet. I highly recommend this hotel and this neighborhood in general. If you're a foodie, it may take you a couple of days to get past all the great shops. (You're right across the street from Marie-Anne Cantin--one of Paris' best cheese shops.) You're just a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower. We got there at 9:15 on Sunday morning with practically no one in the "individuals" line, and we were in the first car up. No downside to this hotel or location at all. But skip the 13 Euro breakfast, and hit the boulangerie down the corner to the right as you leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to experience Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bella22
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Relais Bosquet in the Rue Cler area for a week and highly recommend it. The location is perfect - easy access to the Metro, short walk to the Eiffeil Tower area, Invalides, American Church and Rue Cler is a mere 1 short block away. We booked the superior room which is large by European standards. The furnishings are basic but very adequate. Linens and amenities were really nice - large towels which is something we did not find on the rest of our travels in France. There are electric blinds on the windows which is beyond a doubt the best thing going. Our room was on the street side and with the blinds and the air conditioning, never heard a sound. Incredible. Slept like babies which is not easy to do when traveling. Service was very good. Frederica is just wonderful. We did eat breakfast at the hotel every morning. You can go elsewhere, but why. When in France, eat as the French do and enjoy the croissants, bread, etc. Please do try the hot chocolate - it's to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Still fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerPVB
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the charming Hotel Relais Bosquet many times and this trip confirms this charming hotel is still fantastic! The friendly staff couldn't be more helpful and I wouldn't stay in any other neighborhood in Paris. My mom's luggage was missing from Air France the whole visit and they kindly continued to call and check on the bag for us. Great location and good value. Large bathrooms, great towels, clean and in walking distance to the Tour Eiffel. I recommend visiting the local bakery and cheese and wine shops and plan a carpet picnic at the Tour Eiffel in the afternoon. Wish I could go back now!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Relais Bosquet, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nanasnest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Relais Bosquet for a week this month. We found the recommendation for the hotel in Rick Steve's guidebook. We were not disappointed. We had a nice size room for Paris and an unusually large bathroom for Europe with 2 sinks. Everything was spotless. The hotel has air conditioning which was great as it was really hot for April. Our room had a small refrigerator which was useful for storing water, wine and cheese. We loved the location. About a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower and round the corner from Rue Cler with its open markets and cafes and restaurants. The hotel is a few minutes walk from the Ecole Militaire metro (line 8) and bus #69 stops nearby (great route - Invalides, Musee D'Orsay, Louvre, near Notre Dame and Marais) and a few mintues from bus stop #92 (Arch de Triomphe and Gare Montparnasse (we went to the latter to catch a train for Chartres). We used the buses a lot as the routes were so direct and it gave us a chance to see more of Paris but they can be hot in warm weather - no air conditioning! The staff at the hotel were efficient and friendly - both the front desk staff and Barbara who serves a nicely presented continental breakfast with yummy fresh strawberries. The hotel also has free internet in the lobby. The room has an iron, hair dryer, wine glasses and wine opener and coffe/tea maker. One thing to watch for - if the hotel calls a taxi for you, the charge will start from the time the cab leaves the taxi stand. We got a taxi to the airport and when it arrived there was already about 9.70 euros on the meter. This is not the case if you flag down a cab on the street. We were glad we choose this area of Paris as other areas like the Marais seemed so crowded and it was nice to come back to the green boulevards and see the Eiffel Tower, especially lit up at night. We had a wonderful time in Paris and would definetely come back to the Relais Bosquet and not hestiate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great district!”
Reviews.Author: AllAboutParis
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel from Rick Steve's Paris guide 2007. We booked it with no problems, but you are always hesitant about staying somewhere new. The Hotel was GREAT and met all and more than I could ever expected. I speak fluent French, but my boyfriend did not and the staff was very polite, knowledgeable, helpful and was willing to deal with him in English. The room was perfect, not too big and not too small and with a great view of the Eiffel Tower. I am planning to go back to Paris next year and will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: PMwhf
Reviews.Content: All the positive reviews are spot on - this is a great find! We got a superior double room for approx 130 euro per night. The location is v quiet, but its only 10metres from the local market street on Rue Cler. We asked for a room with a view and we got it!! ......going to sleep with the Eiffel Tour framed in the window was amazing . Ask for room 64!! The room was large enough, spotlessly clean and equiped with tea/coffee making facilities. Superb shower and lots of bath gels/foam etc. Very good bed also. The TV comes with sky news, CNN and BBC World. Staff were v friendly and helpful. They were happy to speak french if you were happy to do so, otherwise they all spoke english very well Breakfast costs 13euro - excellent bread basket with breads, croissant and pain au chocolat. Fruit juice, coffee/tea and fruit. Staff keen to fill up drinks when needed Also has WI Fi, internet pc in reception and UK/USA newspapers. Taxi from CDG takes 30/45 mins and cost us 45euro. Location is well suited for the metro or walking towards the sights around the Seine

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but praise!”
Reviews.Author: jardinm
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a number of hotels I can only say how much we enjoyed our stay at this hotel. We had a lovely room and the beds are v. comfortable - a decent size too! Bathroom was v. clean and at least the bath towels were a good size unlike some other places! For the price you pay here I certainly didn't expect to get nice touches like a tray of bath/shower gel and body lotion etc. We ordered breakfast in our room which was there on time - a great selection of bread and pastries as well as fresh fruit, freshly squeezed orange juice and I could go on. The other thing was that it was beautifully quiet - we booked a superior room at the back of the hotel which had a view of the dome - all lit up at night. There was free internet access also v. useful and a great location for getting around - a 25 minute walk to the Orsay and Orangerie and a good selection of restaurants - we found a great little Vietnamese restaurant one street away and then a north African bistro a 5 minute walk the otherside of the Rue Cler. We will definately be back! - Miranda & Graeme - Brittany

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: bondrey
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Trip Advisor, seeking best value or best hotel I could get while staying in the lower price range. Had a couple others higher on my list but were booked out....in hindsight I'm very glad for that! The last hotel I stayed at in Paris was much more expensive and not nearly as nice or accommodating. I explained to the staff that it was my first anniversary and wanted a view of the Eiffel Tower and they obliged; it was very nice of them and my wife loved it. The Good: >Very hospitable staff!!!! They helped us in every way possible. >Clean. Maid staff works hard. >Found for $132 Euro/night on a European travel website. Reletive bargain to what else is out there. >Free wireless highspeed internet access. >Great location. Food and stores are right there; close enough to most attractions to walk; 2 short blocks from metro which is also very cheap & convenient. >Superior room was very spacious for Paris hotel. >Hotel staff gave suggestions of things to do and made reservations in advance for us at Florimond & Moulin Rouge. The Florimond is ~5 minute walk from hotel and very good food at reasonable price. The Bad: >Not much really, but if I were to nitpick... >I read reviews of large bathrooms with 2 sinks but ours was smaller and only had one sink. That said, it was still larger than others I've seen in Paris hotels. >There are no no-smoking rooms, which is normal for there. They did clean the room and air it out well as I couldn't tell and I'm very sensitive to that sort of thing. However, on our last night people were smoking in the next room and it was wafting through the door. >Breakfast is 13 Euro for basically bread/coffee, eggs/cheese/ham are sold individually on top of that price. The quiches, pastries, etc. at the bakery adjacent to the hotel are much better option; much less money and very fresh.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: Noakesi
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews following a Paris ratings search within our specified budget; I'd say we came up trumps with the Hotel Relais Bosquet. I booked the hotel for a short inexpensive break to Paris to celebrate our first anniversary; and found the hotel to be relaxed, very friendly and helpful. We only stayed the one night, and given our limited time chose to be out and about more than in; for which the hotel via the efficient metro system is in easy reach of anything you need to see and do (the Eiffel tower is in walking distance and we easily got to principle sites within aprx 25 minutes tops - all times of day/night). The room was spacious, clean and airy. We chose not to have breakfast in the hotel, rathermore chose to turn right out of the hotel and onto Rue Cler for on a Sunday a thriving local scene full of cafes and small shops selling a wonderful array of cheeses, fish, meat, vegetables & fruit and of course bread and pastries. Wonderful. We would visit again without hesitation and would glady recommend it to friends and family. Getting to the hotel is very straightforward from Roissy Charles de Gaulle. RER 'B' to Chatelet les Halles. Change to Metro line 1 (Yellow) heading west to La Defense; changing at Concorde to Metro line 8 heading south to Balard - alighting three stops down at Ecole Militaire. Easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: holtr727
Reviews.Content: Been a while since our trip, but finally remembered to write a review. The hotel was great! About as big as I expected, big enough to sleep in for the night. We skipped the breakfast, there are plenty of cafes around to eat at anyway. The location couldn't be better, a quiet part of the city, 5 min walk from the Eiffel Tower or a metro station. Lots of nice, but fairly expensive, shops around (Rue Cler). Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A fine boutique hotel in lovely neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ashia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel, taking advantage of the discounted rate of booking 2-days prior to arrival. It was a "superior"-class room and very, very spacious with TV, tea/coffee, hairdryer as well as electronic blinds. It was very clean, the queen-size bed was comfortable and it was always quiet. The hotel offers continental breakfast until Noon, with various breads, cheese and fruit. It is situated in the heart of the Rue Cler neighborhood with easy access to the Ecole Militaire Metro station. There is a food market down the street and many restaurants near by. It is a residential neighborhood so definitely not a place to stay if you are seeking a lively nightlife. Wonderful staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment, professional staff”
Reviews.Author: QP
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the one-bedroom apt managed by the hotel. The apt's half a block from the hotel on a very quiet street on the ground level. It's lovely decorated with a outdoor patio. Unfortunately, we didn't get much use of the patio due to the weather condition in November. The size was more than adequate and amenities were better than expected with the DVD and CD players. We didn't stay in one of the hotel rooms and therefore unable to comment on the quality of the room. My impression from the lobby was that the décor was a little outdated and didn't look well maintained. I did like the fact that there's a PC/internet available for guest use. The location of the apt/hotel was excellent; just one block away from the Tour Eiffel. The neighborhood is mainly residential, quiet and upscale. I wouldn't recommend it if you're looking to stay at a place that's busy and happening. Most of the shops close early in this area. The front desk staff offered adequate service for a 3-star hotel. With that said, I’d like to command the hotel staff on their professional and courteous way of handling problems. We encountered a problem with the apt lock upon check-out. One of the keys was stuck in the lock and we were unable to open the door. The hotel manager and staff calmly helped us check out and allowed us to leave for airport. We were told that the deposit would probably have to be forfeited if the hotel incurred costs in fixing the situation. I was not optimistic that I would be able to get much of the deposit back. However, the hotel emailed me after a couple days and let me know the cost was 30 euros. I was relieved to learn that it wasn’t a costly problem and the hotel staff handled it promptly and kept us informed. I’d go for a hotel if it’s your first time in Paris and prefer to join tours and visit the city in a well-planned out way. I’d recommend the apartment to experienced travelers who are adventurous and willing to find their ways around Paris. Staying at the apt is a bit more costly than staying at a hotel but it’s all worth it. It was very nice to be able to come back to a “home-like” environment after being out and about for a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Parisian Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteBuckeye
Reviews.Content: We truely enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The hotel is conveniently situated in the Rue Cler. Quiet side street area. Very nice, clean rooms. Extremely helpful and friendly front desk staff. Liked the free internet/computer access. Was pleasantly surprised that we had a view of the Eiffel Tower -- at no extra charge (see photo)! Metro stops and many wonderful restaurants are near by. Don't miss the delicious creme brule croissant at the bakery next door! (We skipped the free hotel breakfast for the 1E pasteries next door!)

Reviews.Title: “A Paris Gem”
Reviews.Author: BabsM
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a fabulous area of Paris, Rue Cler. The staff is very helpful and friendly. We had a nice room on the top floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower. The linens are pretty, and the bathroom was very nice - new and clean. This is a great location within walking distance to several favorite "must see" attractions - Eiffel Tower, Louvre, D'Orsay, etc., plus the market on Rue Cler is so enjoyable and only a half block away. We liked this hotel so much that we are going to stay here again in Jan. 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: wdcraven
Reviews.Content: Minutes from the Eiffel Tower (many rooms have a view) and close to the metro and the charming Rue Cler, this is our favourite hotel in Paris. Clean and modern with a helpful staff and very reasonable rates. 4 stars in my book.

Reviews.Title: “nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: girardot
Reviews.Content: Left bank near Invalides and Tour Eiffel. Quiet. Affable staff, helpful, and the room was much better than expected, large and clean ( 4th floor ). Free internet access off the lobby with use of printer. A block from the Metro ( with direct line to Place Madeleine and Opera ) but a fairly long walk to those locations, taking about 35 minutes. Reasonable rates for the room size and appointments. Difficult parking so we dropped the car off at Avis ( just a few blocks away ) and walked or used Metro and taxis. Numerous restaurants around and a great pedestrian market street 1/2 block away ( Rue Cler ) with plenty of breakfast places (we don't usually take it in the hotel) and restaurants. The street markets are open daily.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quiet honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon in France this week. Our stay at Relais Bousquet was, for the price, the most comfortable, clean, and well-located accommodation of the trip. The room was tastefully decorated with important amenities: mini bar, tv, water heater for tea, a bathroom with 2 sinks and a nice enough shower/tub combo so that I could enjoy evening baths. After leaving the Relais Bousquet, we hit the road for Normandy and it was not until then that we realized how nice our Paris accommodations had been for the money. We stayed at a number of hotels that were a bit less expensive or quite a bit more expensive, and none of them to me were as comfortable as the room we had at the Relais Bousquet. The location was excellent: within walking distance to the Eiffel tower or across the bridge to the Right Bank, Trocadero; superb neighborhood restaurants on Rue le Dominique; and great transportation with the Metro & convenient 69 bus. Breakfast was adequate at the hotel, but just as easy to walk 2 minutes to Rue Cler and pick up something a little tastier. Also, the Super Marche is right next door to the Relais Bousquet which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great staff and a good location”
Reviews.Author: LonelyAvenue
Reviews.Content: My wfe, mysefl and daughter stayed at Hotel Relais Bosquest twice during the quiet Paris month of August 2006. The hotel staff, Gerard & Abel, was exceptional. They were on all occassions extremely polite, professional and helpful. The Hotel is situated in a real middle to upper middle-class neighborhood, a short distance from Invalides and the Eiffel Tower. It is one block from the gourmet corridor known as Rue Cler. There are artisanal cheese shops and bolangerie one block in eash direction. A post office is around the corner. The metro is one block away. There is an ATM at the bank right across the street; a supermarket three doors donw ; a dry cleaner next to that; a self-service laundromat one block east and some lovely inexpenseive brasseries within footsteps of the hotel. Of course, you can easily get to St . Germain and all the other areas of Paris quickly and efficiently via the metro. The Relais Bosquet offers free internet and wifi in its lobby and a breafast, which we did not take advantage of. The rooms & beds were very comfortable and clean, some with balconies providing a view of Paris roof tops and the Eiffel Tower. We would most certainly stay at the Hotel Relais Bosquet again. Gerard at the front desk was particularly helpful. (By the way, if you have not been to Paris previously or in a long time, I recommend you walk over the the Seine, right beyond the Eiffel Tower some nice evening and take the river tour cruise - corny, but it definitely helps you to begin to appreciate the overwhelming beauty, age and history of the city).

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: GoWorm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Relais Bosquet due to a recommendation from a highly rated travel guide. The staff was not friendly and the rooms needed a coat of paint. When I planned our trip, I had tried to get a reservation there for our first night in Paris. Fortunately, they were booked and I used TripAdvisor to find another hotel in the same area. The location was great, but this hotel would not rate two stars. On our two week trip, this hotel was the only disapointment and it cost more than some of the other rooms. My best advise is get the travel guide and see how the rooms are rated on Trip Advisor. I would not stay there again, nor would I recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: travelngurl
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here just recently for a week. I was familiar with the Rue Cler area and really liked the quiet residential feel. I chose this hotel based on trip advisor and found that it had also been recommended by Rick Steves. We had booked a standard room on the 5th floor on the street side (all the superior rooms were booked) and it was pretty good size (by european standards) for the two of us. I asked for an upper floor and a view of the eiffel tower and they did not disappoint me. What a fantastic view each evening to see it lit up (or twinkling on the hour) outside your window when you return to your room!!! I ducked my head into a room that was a 'superior' and I would recommend spending the extra $$ for the extra room it provided. Yes, I will admit, this does not look like a new hotel as based on the furnishings. And, yes, I think I saw a bath towel that was frayed a bit. But I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Everyone who worked there was more than friendly at all times. They answered all our questions with a smile. And opened our wine bottle when we realized the cork was REALLY stuck in there!! Who can ask for more? And they recommended a REALLY great restaurant on the next street over "La Litote" on Rue Bosquet which is a definite MUST for anyone staying in the 7th! The rooms are nicely decorated (bright yellow in our room) and it is really clean (which is a big issue for me). Although halfway through the week we must have had a change in the cleaning woman and we could tell as it wasn't cleaned as well. But still more than sufficient. Breakfast is free if you mention Rick Steves. Hey, I though you get a good deal for what you got---and hey, its free!! If you want more variety for breakfast, yes, Rue Cler is around the corner but I was happy with my croissant and coffee. (you get more than that) The roll down shades are great! Really gives you a great nights sleep. Air conditioner worked great and there is a safe in the room. I would highly recommend this place to anyone and would stay there again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Large By European Standards”
Reviews.Author: Judsongirl
Reviews.Content: Had a very good experience with this hotel. We stayed here over the first week in July and booked the hotel a couple of months before we left. Unfortunately, no Eiffel Tower views were available -- we knew that when we made our reservations -- and our windows faced the courtyard. We paid EUR147.00 a night. Hotel was very, very prompt in answering emails. The Hotel Relais Bosquet is located in a less touresty area of the 7th arrondissement. The Hotel is only a couple of blocks from the Metro -- best way to travel in Paris. Best of all, the rooms are air conditioned with individual controls!!!!!!! Definitely a plus when the weather in Europe has been so odd the past couple of years. I was concerned when we saw our room because it was next to the elevator. No worries. Couldn't hear a thing (I made my husband test it before I unpacked). Windows had, best I can describe, hurricane shutters that you could electronically lower if you liked. They blocked out 100% of the light. I had the best sleep I have had in a very long time. Room had a safe and a small refrigerator. Bath had double sinks and a tub/shower combo. Separate room off bath held toilet. Room was normal size -- and large by Euro standards. I've stayed in smaller in the States. This is not a new hotel and one should not expect it to look like one. But I found the room clean, maid service excellent, and the management helpful. Don't bother with eating breakfast at the hotel because the rue Cler is just about half a block away, and a bakery next door. Lots of food (baked goods, crepes, fruit, wine, and cheese) at this open air market area. Check out their web site. I found the pictures of the hotel were accruate. We will most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel near Rue Cler”
Reviews.Author: sue7778
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with 6 other people and we were all staying near Rue Cler. Most hotels are small and book quickly. The hotels where others were staying were booked. That's how I came across this gem of a hotel. The front desk staff is very professional and treated us very well. They were accomodating when we asked them to make dinner reservations for our party of 7. The room was very clean and comfortable and had air conditioning. The windows have privacy shades which keeps light out and reduces street noise (I heard no street noise at all). The shades are on the exterior and are operated by a click of a button (by the bed). There is a coffee maker with free coffee, and a mini-bar (at fairly reasonable rates). There is a dresser, desk, armoire, and TV in the room. There is internet access in the breakfast room, which is free for guests. It is not attached to a printer, so if you need to print something, you will need to go elsewhere. The hotel is about a minutes walk from the Rue Cler pedestrian street. This street has a couple of cafes, a delicious crepe/Greek restaurant, and many other shops. There are two grocery stores within the block and a couple of bakeries. We never ate breakfast at the hotel because there we opted to eat outside at a cafe or ate on the run (being late to meet our family/friends). The hotel is a few minutes walk from the subway (only one subway line stops at Ecole Militaire). It is an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower and it was fun to walk over there in the evening and watch the light show and people. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. It was an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Relais Bosquet!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tara3056
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Relais-Bosquet for 7 nights in January of this year. I was a little hesitant about booking a regular double room (as opposed to a superior double) because we'd never been to Europe before and had heard nothing but horror stories about the small rooms. I needn't have worried! The room, while cozy, was plenty large enough for the two of us and our two big suitcases (+ carry on backpack and shoulder bag). We didn't feel like we were stepping all over each other, or our luggage. The room had an armoire where we could hang some of our clothes, iron and ironing board, those wonderful electric darkness blinds, and a very functional bathroom with hairdryer and nice toiletries. Oh, and there was also a safe and mini-fridge. You could buy items from the mini-bar, but it also came in handy for us to store our own sodas/water. Just walk a few steps to the right of the hotel's front door, to the grocery store there, and buy Coke or Evian for something like 2.50-3.00 Euros for a 6 pack of either. The front desk staff was always warm and helpful, and housekeeping was excellent. I do recommend that you tip the housekeeper each day - it's apparently the norm in Europe, and you'll get much better service if you do it each day instead of waiting until the end of your stay. I generally left 2-3 Euros a night, and in return, got extra toiletries and towels, a spotlessly clean room, AND I wasn't charged for the 2 drinks we actually did take from the mini-bar before realizing we could just walk to the grocery store. We really enjoyed using the free internet on the computer in the breakfast room. I was able to check in with friends and family, and also get info about some of the tourist sites we wanted to visit later in our trip. The carpet and furniture in the lobby and in the halls is slightly worn, but we didn't mind at all. For the price and location, this hotel is a GEM. As for location, you couldn't ask for better. We spent some time in the Latin Quarter at night, and it was bustling and noisy even late at night. We really loved coming "home" to our little section of Paris, where it was peaceful and not as crowded. At the same time, it was soooo easy to get from our location in the 7th to anywhere else in Paris. For one, Paris is incredibly walk-able. Second, the Ecole Militaire metro stop is an easy 3 minutes or so away. I was a bit intimidated to try using the metro on our first day, but it really was easy, and we ended up using it multiple times a day, zipping all over Paris with ease. Finally, the location can't be beat for restaurants. The 7th is full of lovely little bistros that are moderately priced (23-30 Euros per person for a delicious multi-course prix fixe meal). In short, the Relais Bosquet is fabulous, and I'm fairly certain that if you choose you stay there, you will love it as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller200
Reviews.Content: I stayed with two friends during the first week of July. We had a beautiful and clean room with a view of the Eiffel Tower! All of the concierges were very nice and helpful. They helped us with directions, booking tours, and general information about Paris such as protecting yourself from pickpockets. The location was great. There are excellent restaurants all around and a street market and an ATM just around the corner. I had never been to Paris before and didn't know what to expect, but I found it to be absolutey beautiful and I can't wait to return to this hotel again someday. If you've never been to Paris before either, I highly recommend going to the top of the Eiffel Tower, the Arc de Triumphe, Musee D'Orsay, the Louvre, Montmartre where you can buy beautiful art on the streets, Versailles with its spectacular 10,000 acre garden, a night river cruise along the Seine and a trip to Brugge where you can taste the most delicious chocolate in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Rick was right this time”
Reviews.Author: kiwifan
Reviews.Content: Another Rick Steves recommended hotel, which meant of course that it was overun with Americans. Despite this fact the local crew was quite accomodating. Our room was delightful, with AC and windows that opened to a Paris view. We were there for Bastille Day, le Fete Nationale, and had a five minute walk to the Champs du Mars to see the fireworks over le Tour d'Eiffel. Wonderful,and nice to be so close. Easy walk to the Metro and the bus, and many fine restaurants. Le Bosquet, which is under new management, a block away provided maybe one of the best meals we had the entire trip, competing with a wonderful restaurant near the Pantheon in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience with this hotel. Its in a great neighborhood and has excellent views of the Eiffel Tower. The staff went out of their way to help us. Many thanks to Federica and the others for making our stay a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: gooseylucy
Reviews.Content: We agree with previous travelers who have stayed at this hotel. We arrived at the Relais after we had just finished a bus tour around Europe and were very happy to find that our room (with a view of the Eiffel Tower) was equal to, if not better than, our rooms on the tour. (I might add, these rooms were three times as expensive). It was lovely to walk out the door and feel that you were IN Paris, not just the main tourist section. Gerard and his staff were always smilng and helpful-Gerard helped my husband organise a Seine Dinner Cruise for my birthday, which was beautiful. He also gave me directions to a section of Paris to shop (at normal prices) for clothing, shoes etc; shops where the locals go to. Our room and bathroom were a good size, always clean, fresh towels. We found use of the Metro not too daunting, once worked out, with the 'Ecole Militaire' as our station. Plenty of cafes, supermarkets and easy walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and the Seine. We have recommended this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smokey1127
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Relais Bosquet for a week in June 2006 and were thoroughly satisfied. We were able to check in early, which was appreciated after the long flight. The staff was gracious and accomodating. They helped us with our French and spoke excellent English as well. We selected a superior room with Eiffel Tower view. Our view was a bit sideways, but perfectly adequate. The room was spacious by European standards with plenty of storage for our clothing, toiletries, and luggage even though we do not pack lightly. The bathroom was clean and modern, although we did have a slightly claustrophobic separate WC. The bed was actually two singles put together with some sort of a bridge to eliminate the gap. It was comfortable if a bit firm. We were grateful for the air conditioning on the warmer days. The mini-fridge was convenient for storing goodies purchased at the wonderful shops nearby. There were many, boutiques and restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel. The only downside of the location was that the closest subway line didn't run directly to many major attractions. All this meant was changing lines, so it really wasn't a problem and certainly wouldn't deter us from staying in the area on our next visit. We loved the neighborhood! We had considered other areas, namely the Marais and St. Germaine de Pres, but we were certain the Rue Cler area was the right choice after visiting the others. It just felt like a real neighborhood. We had breakfast daily at Cafe du Marche on the corner, and we came to recognize the locals dining and walking by. By the end of the trip we even managed to coax a smile out of the crusty tabac shopkeeper. Thanks to the many previous reviewers whose insights helped us select Hotel Relais Bosquet!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Relais Bosquet was a wonderful little hotel--very quaint, clean, and well-located in the Rue Cler neighborhood. My husband and I spent 7 nights here in October 2005 and enjoyed every minute. We even had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our hotel room. I actually had booked several months in advance with this hotel and they were excellent about communicating with me via e-mail prior to my arrival and giving me tips about shuttles, etc. If we return to Paris, I wouldn't hesitate for a moment to stay at Hotel Relais Bosquet again. We paid a little more for this hotel but after arriving and staying for 7 days, we were so pleased that we chose to spend the extra money. Having a place that we felt comfortable in made our trip that much better!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Relais Bosquet in April, this was our first trip to Paris and when we arrived at the hotel we were checked into our room quickly even though we were early. The room was just wonderful, very clean, lots of space in the closet for your clothes, large modern bathroom, in room safe and hospitality tray. I chose this hotel because of all the wonderful reviews on this website....it is all true, you cannot go wrong with this hotel. The staff speaks English and are very helpful. Also it is ideally located. We are single women and felt very safe in this area and in this hotel. I love Paris and the hotel Relais Bosquet for making my trip worry free.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute gem! My friend and I arrived in Paris on a rainy Sunday afternoon. We had reserved a room for four nights at a nearby hotel that turned out to be nothing like what was represented on the hotel's website on in "France for Dummies". We called back to the US and had my husband check TripAdvisor for some other hotels in the same neighborhood. With three hotel names in hand, we wandered out in the rain and happily found the Hotel Relais-Bosquet just two blocks away. We walked into the lobby, looking quite soggy and miserable, and inquired if they had a room available. The man at the front desk was so kind and polite when we explained that we had a reservation at another hotel but the room was unsatisfactory. He said he had a room we could have for two nights but then we would have to change to a different room. We were more than happy to change rooms since we did not have a reservation. The desk clerk then asked us if we would like to see the room. It was lovely -- spacious, clean and beautifully decorated. We immediately went back to the other hotel, checked out and returned to the Relais-Bosquet with our luggage. As soon as we walked up to the desk, the clerk told us that he had found a room that we could have for all four nights. We checked in and went to the room. While it was a bit smaller than the first room, it was still very comfortable and spacious. The bathroom was very spacious as well and spotlessly clean. We had drawer space, armoire space and lots of shelf space in the bathroom. After getting settled in our room, we went to the lobby to check our e-mail since we hadn't been near a computer in a week. We asked the desk clerk if he could recommend a restaurant for dinner. He told us that many places were closed on Sunday and especially this particularly Sunday because Monday was May 1, a national holiday. He said, "Let me see if I can get a reservation for you." He called several places and did arrange reservations for dinner at a very nice, reasonably priced restaurant about 10 mins. away. This was the beginning of a beautiful friendship between us and the people at the front desk. Every single one of them was so polite and helpful. They made reservations for us for all types of things and kept us apprised of when the museums were open, the best times to visit different sites, etc. We enjoyed the breakfast every morning we were there. The breakfast room is very light and airy and the service by Christian was impeccable. Whenever I return to Paris, I will stay at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MaggieKatz
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth trip to Paris and this hotel was by far my favorite! The location is excellent! Rue Cler is right around the corner; you can't get much more French than the bakeries, cafes, cheese shops, and fruit/vegetable stands on Rue Cler. There is a Metro stop just a few blocks away and Napolean's Tomb/IHotel Invalides is in walking distance. In addition, the room is absolutely huge by Paris standards. The bathroom has a full tub and the room was clean and modern. The staff at the hotel was very curteous and helpful. Free internet access is available at the hotel which is extremely convenient.

Reviews.Title: “So Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Magstar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary and we could not have been happier. The room we had (superior) was big by paris standards and had lots of really useful ammenities...iron and ironing board, lots of clothes storage, complimentary coffee (although we did not partake...the stuff in the cafes is so much better), fridge, and safe in the room. The people at the desk were very very nice and helpful. If you want a great view of the Eiffle Tower, try to get room 63. It was so great to be able to see the eiffle tower each moring and every night. I hope this helps and good luck with your search... When you go to Paris make sure you by more souvenirs than you think you want! We thought we had so much but when we go home we wished we had bought more! There are always those people you forget, and of course for yourself. You may think you wont really want that eiffle tower statue, but when you get home and the post-paris-depression kicks in you may wish you had gotten it

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mkenny3661
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews from the previous posts, I couldn't agree more about the location and amenities of this hotel. The great Parisian sites are all within walking distance from this hotel. No need to take cab or metro. We walked everywhere during our visit which may have been a little hard on our feet but we got a greater appreciation for the city. Regarding the hotel's internet access, we didn't use the hotel's computer because we had brought our own laptop and was able to jump on their wireless network for internet access. My wife was concerned with her inability to speak or understand french but this was not a problem throughout our trip. I would say that 90% of the french individuals we encountered spoke english. They were also all very cordial and nice. We came away from our trip to Paris with an appreciation of the culture, history and people. I would recommend this hotel and the city of Paris to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “No Better Place to Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: gbtrotter
Reviews.Content: Great location, great price, great rooms - what more can you ask for? We arrived tired and hungry at the hotel at 11:00am. Our room was ready as was a recommendation for lunch nearby. The room was clean, comfortable and large by Paris standards. Checking email on the lobby computer downstairs, free of charge, was a great plus as was the view of the Eiffel Tower from our window. The Rue Cler neighborhood is perfect for anyone - couples, families, etc. There are two bakeries are at either corner on the same block as the hotel. A market is just a few doors down if you need something, but only if all the shops and street vendors have closed shop on Rue Cler. Of course, there are about 50 cafes and restaurants within a five block radius of the hotel. Try La Petit Troquet or La Florimond (both non-smoking). You are a five minute walk from the Ecole Militaire Metro station and a ten minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. In addition to all the usual sites, we had a great time on two tours with Fat Tire Tours in Paris, also within walking distance of the hotel. One was a segway tour of the city which lasted about four hours. We were treated like celebrities and asked to stop for pictures all along the way. The other great tour was a bike tour to Versailles - you bike from the office near the Eiffel Tower to a nearby train station, train to Versailles, stop at a market to pick up items for a picnic and bike around Versailles - definitely the best way to see its 800 acres. We ended the day with an audio tour of the chateau. They have many other tours as well including walking tours of several neighborhoods and evening bike tours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelBelle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a five minute walk from the Eiffel Tower, great convienent location to the Metro (2 blocks) and several great places to eat - bistros, cafes, etc. The fresh pastries from the artisan patiserie on the corner were the best we found anywhere! The rooms were on the small side but not too small (compared to other European hotels), and the bed was comfortable enough for my husband and I and our 1 year old to share (it said it was a double but it was probably between an american double and an american queen). We never would have gotten a crib/cot in the room (but I don't think they offered). The room we got was the cheaper of the two offered by the hotel. Free Internet access in the lobby was a big plus!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: wks
Reviews.Content: All the wonderful reviews of this hotel are accurate. A lovely hotel in a very pleasant area of Paris. Of note is the addition of free internet in the hotel and a computer in the lobby for guest use. In addition to the regular continental breakfast there is simple breakfast (juice, coffee, croissant)for 6 euros and you can order cereal, eggs, etc for a moderate supplement. The staff is very competent and helpful. The only negative was the standard double did not have any drawers for organizing personal items.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pozosgto
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week's stay at the Relais Bosquet. The hotel is in great condition and very clean. Our room couldn't have been nicer. The people working there are friendly and competent. Gerard was outstanding. Feel fortunate to have chosen this hotel. All positive comments we found on tripadvisor were accurate.

Reviews.Title: “A Masterpiece in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MikkiBlau
Reviews.Content: You will not find another hotel like this in Paris at the same affordable price. Everything about this hotel is unbeatable. The room was large enough to move around in and relaxingly appointed in bright, airy golden tones. And no squeezing into a tiny, sparsely lit bathroom; this bathroom was clearly remodeled recently and was impeccably clean, with bathtub/shower combination and lots of light. The best part about this hotel is the staff. From the minute I made my reservation to the time I checked out, we received nothing but courteous and friendly service, all delivered with a smile. And feel free to communicate with them by email! They are attentive and responsive to questions or concerns. In addition, they are quite knowledgable and more than prepared to offer whatever advice the new (or returning!) traveller to Paris needs. The lounge area in the lobby even sports recent editions of some of the popular city travel guides to Paris. They offer a continental breakfast, but we did not try it. The other fabulous part about this hotel is it's location. It is on a cosy side street just 5 minutes walk from the Ecole Militaire Metro station. With the Tour Eiffel, shops, varied restaurants, a market, and drugstore right there at it's doorstep, one doesn't have to go far to satisfy whatever needs come up. I have stayed in many hotels around Europe. Hotel Relais Bosquet is the first to cover ALL the essentials of a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “A gem! Everything in these glowing reviews is true”
Reviews.Author: Divingguy
Reviews.Content: This wonderful little hotel has garnered some great reviews on this site. They're all true. The Relais Bosquet is quiet, clean, friendly, honest, efficient, and a great value. Located just a short walk from the Ecole Militaire Metro station, it provided a great base for 6 days of Paris enjoyment. You cannot go wrong here. While you're there, try the Paris Walks tours... a great way to learn and enjoy the city. Realis Bosquet made the stay a joy. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem!”
Reviews.Author: mayflye
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent, Gerard made my sister and my first trip to Paris a treat. He called cabs, made recommendations and generally made everything go smoothly. The hotel is clean, in a great area for shopping, eating and sightseeing. All that, and a view of the Eiffel Tower from our window!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cgilmore
Reviews.Content: We rented the apartment via the hotel. It is just down the street from the hotel. It had one bedroom and a pull out sofa in the living room. We are a family of 4 and our boys are only 5 and 7 year so it worked out perfectly. Everything in the apartment is new and it has a welcoming decor. It has it's own private patio which due to the time of the year and rain we didn't get to use much. The kids did go out there and play for a bit though. I can imagine in the summer the patio would be amazing. It had a washer/dryer so I just packed light and did laundry. It is about a 5-10 min walk to the Ecole Militare Metro stop, a few minutes from Rue Cler, restaurants, grocery store, bakery. A previous review said to try pizza Tina. It was so delcious we got take out there twice and ate in once! The pizza, pasta couldn't be beat. It was so great we didn't want to leave! Part of me hates to write this review since I would love to keep it a secret so when we return we can get a reservation but Trip Advisor has been such a help to me that I had to give back.

Reviews.Title: “Stop looking! You won't beat this place.”
Reviews.Author: radio71
Reviews.Content: You can drive yourself crazy trying to find the "perfect" hotel in Paris. Well, stop looking. You simply can't beat the Relais Bosquet. It's small, yet, by Paris standards, the rooms are large. Everything is spotless. The bathrooms are a true rarity in Europe: large, light and airy, and (at least in mine) a double sink. Refrigerator in room with mini-bar (we used it to store the wonderful foods you can buy 1/2 block away on Rue Cler). Coffee and tea provided in room at no charge. Helpful, friendly, English-speaking staff: will make all your local calls for you, arrange tours, etc. Free high-speed internet (with computer) in the lobby. You'll be surrounded by Americans and Canadians, with their Rick Steves books in hand. As long as you keep in mind that European (and Parisian, in particular) hotels are SMALL, with SMALL rooms, you'll enjoy the Relais Bosquet. Visit their website - everything is just as presented on it.

Reviews.Title: “Extra Amenities, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Relais Bosquet October 2005 for 3 nights during our first stop on a 3-week journey through Europe. The hotel was 150 euros/night (about $180 US) and did not include breakfast. We were very pleased with the hotel overall and will stay here when we return and will also recommend to friends. Here's a rundown ... "Spacious" (by Europe's standards) modern bathrooms with plush towels and wash clothes - a rare luxury in Europe; spotless rooms that were well-maintained and cleaned daily; professional, helpful English-speaking staff; terrific location (right next to Rue Cler, which is the pedestrian-friendly food market, so delicious food is a stone's throw away); best boulangerie in Paris for breakfast and for patisseries (located on the corner across from delicious Cafe du Marche, which serves excellent Parisian cafe fare for reasonable prices); hotel is located a short 5-minute walk to the Eiffel Tower; free Internet access in the lobby; quiet neighborhood (request a room facing the courtyard for maximum quiet); black-out blinds, which would be helpful during the summer months. The hotel charges 6.5 euros/person additional for a standard, uninspiring continental breakfast, which is served in their lobby. I would recommend forgoing this expense and instead visiting the boulangerie for delicious breads and pastries and then walking 5 more steps to Cafe du Marche to sit and enjoy your breakfast and order coffee, juices, etc. at the cafe. Although the room was a bit expensive, we were happy with the extra amenities Hotel Relais Bosquet affords. Many US travelers might find the size of the rooms very small by US standards, but these rooms are fairly large by Europe standards and the bathrooms are especially large and modern. If you want to stay in this perfect Paris neighborhood but are on budget, try Champ du Mars, which is located 2 doors down from Relais Bosquet. We met several travelers who were staying there and were very happy with this hotel (its rate was less than 100 euros/night). Otherwise, stay at Relais Bosquet for a terrific experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: GrrlAnn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Relais Bosquet on our honeymoon in September. We were very happy with the hotel. The rooms were just as pictured on the website. Large bathrooms, very clean linens, just spotless in general. My husband loved the electronic black out blinds and the air conditioning. The elevator is small but it fit both my husband and I and our luggage without a problem. I definitely saw smaller as our stay continued in Europe. The lobby and hallways are much shabbier than the pictures. The staff speaks fluent english. Almost no need to speak french at all. The other guests all seemed to be American with only a few exceptions. The guests also all seemed to be in their mid-50s to 60s. I didn't see any other young people (<35) at the hotel. The pastry shop on the corner makes the perfect breakfast stop (1-2E per pastry). So we never tried the breakfast at the hotel. There are about 6 restaurants within at 2 block radius, if not more. We tried a few and none of them were bad but none were fabulous. We enjoyed La Terrace near the metro the most. Location near many metro stops, RER, Eiffel Tower, Seine, and Invalides was great. Very quiet residential neighborhood. While in Paris we stayed at another hotel with almost double the list price as this hotel and it was no where near as nice. I would definitely recommend the Hotel Relais Bosquet to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: darrennelson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, and really enjoyed the hotel. Very friendly staff. The room was small, but clean, and had a nice view of the Eiffel tower as we were on the sixth floor. Though small, the room was more spacious than other rooms we have had in Paris. The hotel is close to the metro, as well as Rue cler for shopping. Short walk to the Eiffel tower and Napoleons tomb. The hotel serves breakfast, but we didn't try it out. The pastry shop around the corner was fanatastic, we went there daily. Overall, we would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip”
Reviews.Author: klf0963
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at the Bosquet. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The double (king, I think) bed was firm -- great after a long day of sightseeing. The location was an easy walk to the TourEiffel, Invalides, and much more. Don't miss the Rue Cler early in the morning as the shop keepers clean the sidewalks and set up for the day. We used the Yellow Van Shuttle (booked throught the hotel) which was a good value and punctual. Buy the museum multi-day pass, and if you are a "walker" skip the Metro carne or passport. In 4 days we used the RER once to Versailles and the metro once to Montmarte. Special "thank you" to Frederika for her warm welcome and helpful suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrSgt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in Jan 05 and loved it. The rooms are small, but are well-appointed. The lobby is a bit dated, but don't let that discourage you. The staff is great and the location ideal. We would stay here again without hesitation. Just don't eat at 'Le Bosquet'. You can't go wrong with the Cafe du Marche. Both a short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible city, wonderful hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of spending 4 nights here in July 2004, and couldn't have been happier. It was my first visit to Paris, and the location in the Rue Cler neighborhood was superb. Quaint shops, great cafes and bistros EVERYWHERE you turn, and only a couple blocks from the Metro. We even had a view of the Eiffel Tower! Our room was very clean and comfortable, the bathrooms were modern and spotless, and the air conditioning was a lifesaver in the summertime. Also, the elevator, roughly the size of a telephone booth, is both fun and a real welcome to Europe. We laughed for hours! For only 105 euro, it's hard to beat The Relais Bosquet. The staff was helpful and friendly, as were all the Parisians we spoke with. Can't wait to go back, and will definately recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Neighborhood, Great View”
Reviews.Author: Historiana
Reviews.Content: A friendly staff for a small hotel in Paris. Staff was very accomodating in providing information. Our room was very comfortable, well-maintained, and had a terrific view of the Eiffel Tower. Wonderful neighborhood with plenty of restaurants within walking distance & convenient to a metro stop. Too many Americans but the charming neighborhood makes up for it. There is even a bakery next door so the aroma of fresh baked breads greets you in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NancyCA
Reviews.Content: This was not my first stay in this neighborhood; however, it was the first time for the Relais Bosquet. Its excellent reputation is well-deserved. The staff at the desk are very knowledgeable, the room was clean and well-appointed, and guests can even use the hotel computer. Moreover, the location is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from first visit to Paris at the Hotel Relais Bosquet. It was everything Trip Advisor had promised from prior guests and their testimonials. After an overnight flight we arrived and found our room ready. The bath was spotlessly clean. The bedroom had a very comfortable king with air cond., refrig, retractable blinds, and nicely decorated. However, no closet, and a somewhat awkward cabinet for clothes. Room was very quiet. Gerard and others at the front desk were very friendly, gracious, and accomodating. The Rue Cler market and neigborhood is wonderful..... hotel is just a block away from the Ecole Militaire metro stop. I would recommend the hotel and would stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Relais Bosquet Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 19 rue du Champ de Mars, 75007 Paris, France
